finding: Located near CXCR4 on 2q22.1, this variant showed a statistically significant association with ALL (OR=1.28, p=2.5×10-6) and was identified as a novel risk variant.
title: Genetic Determinants of Blood Cell Traits Influence Susceptibility to Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

finding: The sentinel variant rs4364036 was significantly associated with short-term varenicline effectiveness (SVE) and was noted for its implications in biological processes related to varenicline response.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: This locus was associated with multiple sleep and circadian rhythm proxy phenotypes, including TLA during early morning and late night, also showing strong signals for sleep duration.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs4148325 was associated with 'Bilirubin levels' with a reported p-value of 5e-62 in the GWAS Catalog. This association is relevant as it reflects the relationship between bilirubin levels and disorders of bilirubin excretion.
title: The Michigan Genomics Initiative: a biobank linking genotypes and electronic clinical records in Michigan Medicine patients

finding: The rs6739323-A variant was associated with lower expression of LTBP1 at both protein and mRNA levels in human smooth muscle cells (SMCs). It was identified as a causal variant affecting LTBP1 expression at the 2p22.3 locus, contributing to an increased risk of SMC calcification and found to have lower abundance in unstable atherosclerotic plaques.
title: Secreted protein profiling of human aortic smooth muscle cells identifies vascular disease associations

finding: The SNP rs887829, found in the UGT1A1 gene, demonstrated a recessive effect on total bilirubin levels. This SNP was strongly connected to variations in bilirubin and was linked to Gilbert's syndrome, a condition characterized by autosomal recessive inheritance.
title: Improved prediction of blood biomarkers using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs266058 was significantly associated with the volume of grey matter in the left amygdala (p < 2 × 10^-24) and strongly correlated with ADHD in the GWAS catalog. It also showed an association with the isthmus cingulate cortex in ENIGMA3 summary statistics (p < 2 × 10^-4). This association is relevant since ADHD patients generally exhibit smaller amygdala volumes compared to healthy individuals.
title: A Multimodal Foundation Model for Discovering Genetic Associations with Brain Imaging Phenotypes

finding: The GG genotype and G allele of the D543N polymorphism (rs17235409) were found to be significantly associated with increased susceptibility to pulmonary tuberculosis, with the GG genotype observed at 84% in the case group compared to 72% in the control group.
title: Relationship between common polymorphisms of NRAMP1 gene and pulmonary tuberculosis in Lorestan LUR population

finding: The SNP rs1260326 was associated with triglyceride levels on chromosome 2, meeting the genome-wide significance threshold with a p-value of 5.67 x 10^-11.
title: Two-phase sample selection strategies for design and analysis in post-genome wide association fine-mapping studies

finding: This SNP was in complete linkage disequilibrium (LD, R2=0.99) with a 5.5 Kb deletion located 8 Kb upstream of NCK2. This deletion was associated with the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD), highlighting the potential regulatory influence of structural variations in this genomic region.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: This variant was in high LD (R2=0.94) with a 5.2 Kb deletion in the intron of NBEAL1, which is implicated in Alzheimer's disease. The deletion overlapped with an H3K27ac peak, suggesting a functional role in gene regulation.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The SNP rs887829 was significantly associated with gene expression of UGT1A3 in the liver, with a normalized effect size of 0.46 and a p-value of 3.8 x 10^-14, which indicated its role in bilirubin metabolism.
title: Multi-ancestry Polygenic Mechanisms of Type 2 Diabetes Elucidate Disease Processes and Clinical Heterogeneity

finding: MultiSuSiE identified rs560887 as a fine-mapped variant at the G6PC2 locus for blood glucose concentration. This intronic variant had previously been validated in experimental assays and was shown to impact G6PC2 splicing. Though it was fine-mapped in Eur94k, it did not appear in Afr47k or Eur47k due to linkage issues.
title: MultiSuSiE improves multi-ancestry fine-mapping in All of Us whole-genome sequencing data

finding: rs492594 was fine-mapped at the G6PC2 locus but was not fine-mapped in either Afr47k, Eur47k, or Eur94k. It is a missense variant affecting G6PC2 protein abundance and G6Pase activity. Its failure to be fine-mapped was attributed to its low association evidence in the European cohorts and linkage masking by rs560887.
title: MultiSuSiE improves multi-ancestry fine-mapping in All of Us whole-genome sequencing data

finding: The rs6545389 variant was identified as a novel genome-wide significant SNP for self-reported moderate physical activity (PA) with a p-value of 3.5×10⁻⁸, suggesting a potential genetic influence on self-reported PA levels.
title: Association of Sedentary and Physical Activity Behaviors with Body Composition: a Genome-Wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs1990760 SNP in IFIH1 was associated with an increased risk of developing invasive pulmonary aspergillosis (IPA) in patients who underwent hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT), particularly when the variant was carried by the recipient in a recessive genetic model. This finding was reinforced by a significant reduction in key inflammatory cytokines in patients with the CC genotype.
title: MAVS expression in alveolar macrophages is essential for host resistance against Aspergillus fumigatus

finding: The rs6712151 variant at INHBB was recognized as one of the novel loci associated with PCOS, contributing to understanding the hormonal regulation involved in the syndrome.
title: Genomic and proteomic evidence for hormonal and metabolic foundations of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The rs13004711 variant at FSHR was reported for the first time in a majority European-ancestry GWAS, replicating an association observed in Han Chinese populations.
title: Genomic and proteomic evidence for hormonal and metabolic foundations of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs17034876 located in the EPAS1 gene region was identified as significantly associated with both pregnancy loss and birth weight. The study demonstrated a striking enrichment of EPAS1 genetic variants linked to these adverse outcomes, suggesting that variations at this locus could predispose individuals to pregnancy complications. The odds ratio derived from the UK Biobank sample indicated a highly significant association (p=7.1E-28). Additionally, it was confirmed through an independent GWAS for birth weight (p=3.1E-47), linking EPAS1 disruption to dysregulation of key genes involved in trophoblast function and placentation.
title: Active remodeling of the chromatin landscape directs extravillous trophoblast cell lineage development

finding: This SNP was identified as an exonic variant of ATPase homolog 2 pseudogene (AHSA2P) and was associated with the FLL IIb phenotype, indicating its relevance in this specific dyslipoproteinemia.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: This variant, located approximately 500kb upstream of IRS1, was strongly associated with both type IIb and IV phenotypes and previously linked to a 35% increased risk of type 2 diabetes, highlighting its role in lipid metabolism and insulin resistance.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: The analysis indicated that this SNP was significantly associated with ANC, with a beta coefficient of 0.450 (p=0.026). The presence of the minor allele was associated with an increase of approximately 450 cells/mm3 in ANC, suggesting a potential protective effect of this variant in neutrophil counts.
title: Clozapine metabolism is associated with Absolute Neutrophil Count in individuals with treatment-resistant schizophrenia

finding: This variant, located in the <italic>OTX1</italic> gene at 2p15, showed a strong association with PSA levels with <italic>P</italic>=4.9 10<sup>−13</sup> in the meta-analysis, highlighting its potential relevance in androgen-signaling pathways.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Associated with PSA through the <italic>THADA</italic> gene at 2p21, this variant had a notable <italic>P</italic>=1.7 10<sup>−13</sup> following meta-analysis of 95,768 men, indicating its significance in PSA variation.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP was linked to <italic>THADA</italic> at 2p21 with a reported <italic>P</italic>=1.7 10<sup>−13</sup>, underlining its role in PSA expression.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Linked to <italic>LDAH</italic> located at 2p24.21, this SNP showed strong associations with prostate cancer and PSA metrics.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP was associated with increased GFAT, indicating a relationship between the allele increasing BFP and favorable adipose tissue profiles.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: Linked as an eQTL in visceral adipose tissue but did not affect gene expression directly, emphasizing its potential role in obesity.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs7566405 variant in the GACAT3-CYRIA locus was newly identified with an association to overall CH (OR = 0.94 [0.93-0.96], P = 1.03 x 10^-8).
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The rs2280334 variant at MEIS1 was discovered as a novel risk factor for DNMT3A-associated CH (OR = 1.08 [1.05-1.10], P = 2.30 x 10^-8).
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The BP allele of rs6748341 was associated with decreased expression of CUL3 in the brain cortex (P = 4.91×10^-6). This SNP was identified as the most significant SNP associated with bipolar disorder.
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: A SNP in very high linkage disequilibrium with rs6748341, rs11685299, was genome-wide significant for association with schizophrenia.
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The BP allele of rs11681451, which is in high LD with rs6748341 and rs11685299, was associated with decreased expression of CUL3 in three brain regions: cortex (P = 1.81×10^-6), hippocampus (P = 1.95×10^-5), and caudate (P = 2.33×10^-5).
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The BP allele of rs55775495 was associated with increased expression of SF3B in various nervous system regions: central nervous system (P = 2.68×10^-15), peripheral nervous system (P = 1.13×10^-6), brain cerebellum (P = 1.30×10^-6), and brain caudate (P = 2.19×10^-6). This SNP is in high LD with another significant SNP for schizophrenia.
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The SNP rs6434928, which is highly linked to rs55775495 (R² = 0.88), was also genome-wide significant for association with schizophrenia and had similar eQTL results suggesting increased expression of SF3B.
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The variant rs17022452 was identified as statistically interacting with rs3822019 and is located near the gene GAPDHP25. In the study, it was shown that 75.0% of individuals homozygous for the rs17022452_GG genotype were cases of PD. This further supported its association with Parkinson's Disease and underscored the interaction between these two genetic variants.
title: Interaction-based feature selection algorithm outperforms polygenic risk score in predicting Parkinson’s Disease status

finding: rs3739095 mapped to GTF3C2 and was identified in the gene-based analyses among the significant associations, suggesting its involvement in addiction risk pathways.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: rs6718128 was associated with ZNF512 and demonstrated potential as a causal SNP linked to the genetic architecture of addiction.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: identified as a significant SNP mapping to RP11-89K21.1 which was implicated in the genetic basis of addiction risk.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: rs4953152 was noted as a significant SNP associated with SIX3, contributing to the understanding of the genetic factors influencing substance use disorders.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: this SNP was related to CTD-2026C7.1 and was part of the significant associations in relation to addiction risk.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: this SNP was related to VRK and indicated an association with the broader genetics of addiction.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: associated with GCKR, contributing to aspects of alcohol metabolism in the context of addiction.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with cervical ectropion (p=5.1 × 10⁻¹⁶) and was related to cervical biology, indicating its relevance to cervical health.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with cervicitis (p=3.9 × 10⁻¹⁰) and also showed correlations with cervical dysplasia, highlighting its role in cervical pathology.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: Significantly associated with cervical dysplasia (p=3.2 × 10⁻⁹), indicating its relevance in early epithelial differentiation and its potential role in cervical cancer.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with cervical cancer (p=9.4 × 10⁻¹⁵) and is located within the PAX8 gene, a key player in reproductive tract development.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12471304 located within the ACMSD gene was noted as significantly associated with non-verbal ASD cases by affecting the kynurenine pathway, evident in the observed neuroprotective compound relationships to the disorder.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: At rs538479553, associated with the FAM98A gene, the study found a significant interaction with long sleep duration (LTST) for systolic blood pressure (SBP), with P_GxE=3.3×10^-9.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The research identified rs141117715, linked to KCNJ3, interacting significantly with STST for PP (P_GxE=1.7×10^-8).
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The study analyzed the effects of IFIH1 rs1990760 variants on systemic inflammation and outcomes in critically ill COVID-19 patients. It found that this SNP was associated with various degrees of systemic inflammation, suggesting its role in the immune response of patients under severe inflammatory conditions.
title: Glucocorticoid-driven gene expression in circulating monocytes and neutrophils in health and severe inflammation

finding: The SNP rs1549339 was associated with mRNA expression variations in the PSMD1 gene specifically in arsenic-exposed workers. This study was significant as it provided insights into genetic factors affecting susceptibility to pollutants, linking specific genetic polymorphisms with health outcomes related to environmental exposure.
title: Brick kiln pollution and its impact on health: A systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs13402242 also showed an association with mRNA expression variations in the PSMD1 gene among arsenic-exposed workers. This finding reinforced the impact of genetic variations on health responses in individuals exposed to toxic pollutants from environments such as brick kilns.
title: Brick kiln pollution and its impact on health: A systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The rs6733839 variant in the BIN1 gene was linked to longevity in the parental-longevity GWAS, contributing to findings supporting its role in age-related diseases.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: The rs876461 variant near the PRKD3 gene exhibited a significant effect on longevity, replicating findings across different studies.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: The rs13420463 variant was associated with systolic blood pressure and found significant in longevity-related genetic analyses.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: This SNP was associated with the delayed recall memory phenotype with a gene-based P value of 1.17E-07, suggesting a strong link to memory performance.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease brain imaging biomarkers and neuropsychological phenotypes in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset

finding: The SNP rs9282858 was described as a missense variant predicted to be deleterious and was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with another significant SNP. It was associated with higher estradiol levels, highlighting its relevance in the estradiol metabolic pathway.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: The SNP rs7346 was identified as a synonymous variant in INPP5D and was in tight linkage disequilibrium with the missense variant rs9247 (p.His1157Tyr). Although rs7346 had no clear deleterious prediction, its association with IgAV was significant, as it impacted myeloid signaling pathways, including those regulating allergic responses.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: The missense variant rs9247 (p.His1157Tyr) in INPP5D was closely linked to rs7346 and associated with IgAV. Despite no clear detrimental prediction, this variant may affect the binding energy of SHIP-1, a regulator of FcαR signaling, thus indirectly influencing IgAV susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: This SNP was one of the seven loci shared between hypothyroidism and TSH levels, demonstrating its involvement in these thyroid traits.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: Lead variant rs546039326 was noted for having a higher effect allele frequency in the EstBB and FinnGen cohorts, underscoring its significance in hypothyroidism.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: This SNP also exhibited a higher effect allele frequency in specific cohorts, emphasizing its relevance in hypothyroidism.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: It was associated with reproductive health traits, indicating its relevance in both thyroid and reproductive systems.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: Associated with reproductive health traits, this SNP demonstrated genetic pleiotropy.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The SNP rs34601365, located near TDRD15 and APOB, showed a significant interaction with age concerning ApoB, with a p-value of 8.4e-09. Similar to other lead variants, this interaction indicated a decrease in genetic effects with increasing age.
title: Large-scale genome-wide interaction analyses on multiple cardiometabolic risk factors to identify age-specific genetic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs72928925, associated with endometriosis, functioned as an eQTL for the gene BMPR2, which plays roles in TGF-beta signalling pathways linked to cellular processes such as proliferation and differentiation.
title: The Association between Endometriosis and Immunological diseases

finding: The SNP rs72928605, associated with osteoarthritis, also served as an eQTL for the same gene BMPR2, indicating a shared genetic correlation with endometriosis.
title: The Association between Endometriosis and Immunological diseases

finding: The SNP rs10196189 in the GALNT13 gene was identified as significantly associated with elite sprinting ability in a cross-ancestry meta-analysis involving athletes from Jamaica, the USA, Japan, and several independent cohorts of elite European athletes, achieving genome-wide significance (P < 5E-08).
title: Multi-phase, multi-ethnic GWAS uncovers putative loci in predisposition to human sprint performance, health and disease

finding: The intron variant rs113303758, strongly linked to rs10196189, exhibited significant association with sprint performance across multiple populations, supporting the role of GALNT13 in athletic performance with high odds ratios (OR = 2.52).
title: Multi-phase, multi-ethnic GWAS uncovers putative loci in predisposition to human sprint performance, health and disease

finding: The SNP rs35611688 was found near ACVR2A, which encodes a receptor for activin A, linked to atherogenesis, representing a novel CAD association.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: SNP rs1260326, associated with the GCKR gene, served as the top variant in the 'Reduced inflammation' cluster with a weight of 5.7. It was found to be more frequent in individuals of African (AFR) ancestry, establishing a significant original finding in that population context.
title: A clustering approach to improve our understanding of the genetic and phenotypic complexity of chronic kidney disease

finding: This SNP was found to have the strongest signal in the GWAS for retinal age gap (RAG), located on chromosome 2, with a significance level of P=1.4e-95. It was associated with the genetic correlation of age-related processes, implicating its relevance in biological age predictions.
title: Genomic Determinants of Biological Age Estimated By Deep Learning Applied to Retinal Images

finding: Located on chromosome 8, this SNP is also potentially deleterious (CADD scores > 12.37) and has been associated with expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL), further reinforcing its potential impact on RAG.
title: Genomic Determinants of Biological Age Estimated By Deep Learning Applied to Retinal Images

finding: The non-coding SNP rs3792112 was found to disrupt autophagy signaling, impacting proteins involved in the pathology of Crohn's disease. This SNP specifically propagated towards ATG16L1 and helped influence autophagy-related pathways, linking genetic variations to the pathogenesis of CD.
title: Decoding Non-coding SNPs: Systems Genomics Modelling Dissects the Heterogeneity of IBD

finding: The non-coding SNP rs3828309 was also implicated in disrupting autophagy signaling in Crohn's disease. Similar to rs3792112, it was shown to propagate towards ATG16L1 and other autophagy-related proteins, thus contributing to the understanding of CD pathogenesis through genetic mechanisms.
title: Decoding Non-coding SNPs: Systems Genomics Modelling Dissects the Heterogeneity of IBD

finding: The SNP <italic>rs12466997</italic> linked to the <italic>UGT1</italic> family members A3-A10 indicated a negative association with total bilirubin with a trans-ancestry beta of -0.107. It had substantial significance in African participants (beta=-0.554) and a heterogeneity p-value of 1.5×10<sup>-109</sup>.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP <italic>rs4953016</italic> was implicated in low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol variability, participating in a network of associations tied to blood biomarkers showing cross-ancestry heterogeneous effects.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs2382817, linked to Inflammatory Bowel Disorder, originally had a credible set of 68 variants. Applying the FDR 0.10 threshold with the TSABL model reduced this credible set to 5 variants, demonstrating the model's effectiveness in identifying pertinent genetic variants.
title: TSABL: Trait Specific Annotation Based Locus Predictor

finding: The SNP rs62124869 was found to be associated with rare amino acid variation in the EBV gene BBRF1. It displayed an odds ratio (OR) of 1.29 and a p-value of 4.2×10^-11. This SNP maps to the non-coding RNA gene LINC01830 on chromosome 2, illustrating a significant genetic interaction related to EBV.
title: The influence of human genetic variation on Epstein-Barr virus sequence diversity

finding: The SNP rs7559150 was found to be a causal expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene PPIL3, showing a significant association with differential gene expression between European (EUR) and Yoruba (YRI) populations. The T allele of rs7559150 had a much higher frequency in the EUR population (0.736) compared to the YRI population (0.259), which correlated with higher expression levels of PPIL3 in EUR individuals. This finding highlighted the impact of allele frequency differences on gene expression and contributed to the understanding of low portability of polygenic risk scores across different ancestral groups.
title: Allele frequency differences of causal variants have a major impact on low cross-ancestry portability of PRS

finding: This SNP in EIF2AK3 showed a protective association with an odds ratio of 0.80 and a p-value of 9.06·10^-03, replicating previous associations with PSP risk.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The SNP rs62164740 located on chromosome 2p12 was identified as a novel association with orofacial clefts (OFCs), showing a p-value of 6.27e-07. This association was strongest in the combined sample of 12,000 individuals.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Non-syndromic Orofacial Clefts in a Multiethnic Sample of Families and Controls Identifies Novel Regions

finding: The rs419598 CC genotype was associated with decreased levels of inflammatory biomarkers including IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, and D-dimer, as well as lower mortality rates among males aged 55-74, showing a decrease from 18.4% to 5.5% mortality (p<0.001). This SNP was linked to increased plasma levels of the anti-inflammatory cytokine IL-1Ra.
title: Interleukin-1 receptor antagonist gene (IL1RN) variants modulate the cytokine release syndrome and mortality of SARS-CoV-2

finding: The SNP rs13030427 was found to be positively associated with age acceleration as indicated by the new proteomic aging clock (PAC) in cancer survivors. The study provided evidence suggesting that this SNP contributed to the biological age estimation and subsequent mortality risk in cancer survivors, linking it to particular age-related phenotypes.
title: Proteomic Aging Clocks and the Risk of Mortality among Longer-Term Cancer Survivors in the Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Study

finding: SNP rs4663105 was identified as a significant locus associated with ncAD, yielding a p-value of 7.94×10−9. It was also the top result in the female-specific analysis in connection with Braak stage.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: This SNP was top-ranked in the Braak stage analysis with a significant p-value of 3×10−8, further implicating its role in AD neuropathology.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: This SNP was found to be significant in the female-specific Braak stage analysis with a p-value of 8.5×10−8, contributing to the understanding of sex-specific genetic influences on AD pathology.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: The alternate allele of rs6755571 reduced the susceptibility to jaundice five-fold, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.2 (p-value = 2.7 × 10<sup>-55</sup>), indicating a significant protective effect against neonatal jaundice in nearly 30,000 parent-offspring trios from Norway.
title: Genome-wide analyses of neonatal jaundice reveal a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: This SNP was found in strong LD with rs6755571 within the UGT1A gene region, indicating a similar genetic basis affecting neonatal jaundice.
title: Genome-wide analyses of neonatal jaundice reveal a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: The SNP rs2176040 was evaluated for its potential causal effect on glucose levels using the proposed MR MiSTERI methods. An inference indicated a significant causal effect estimate, with a standard error of 0.0139 and a p-value of 0.003. However, conflicting results from standard two-stage least squares analysis yielded a negative causal effect estimate of -1.619 (se: 2.04, p-value: 0.428), suggesting that rs2176040 may not be a valid instrumental variable, potentially leading to biased results.
title: On Mendelian Randomization Mixed-Scale Treatment Effect Robust Identification (MR MiSTERI) and Estimation for Causal Inference

finding: The variant was significantly associated with hypothalamus volume, and there was a notable sex difference in effect sizes (females: β = 0.07, males: β = 0.002, P = 1.31 x 10^-5). This finding indicated a genetic influence on neuroanatomy linked to sex.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: This SNP was part of genome-wide association studies that revealed a significant association with susceptibility to chickenpox infections, with a p-value of 3 x 10^-7, indicating its role in immune response.
title: Loss of C2orf69 defines a fatal auto-inflammatory mitochondriopathy in Humans and Zebrafish

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with schizophrenia in a genome-wide association study, with a p-value of 2 x 10^-13, illustrating its relevance in neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Loss of C2orf69 defines a fatal auto-inflammatory mitochondriopathy in Humans and Zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs1260326, linked with the GCKR locus, was previously reported in the Coffee and Caffeine Genetics Consortium (CCGC) study and associated with the amount of coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs2867110 at the LOC105373352-TMEM18 locus was associated with coffee consumption and aligned with findings from earlier GWA studies.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The rs4988235 SNP was associated with the abundance of the gut microbiome genus Bifidobacterium. However, the findings highlighted that this SNP did not reflect a causal relationship with colorectal cancer (CRC) but instead indicated potential horizontal pleiotropy, as there were over 200 other traits linked to this SNP that might independently influence CRC risk. Despite this, regional association plots confirmed the importance of the genomic region surrounding rs4988235 in both Bifidobacterium abundance and CRC risk.
title: Exploring the causal role of the human gut microbiome in colorectal cancer: Application of Mendelian randomization

finding: The FN1:rs140926439-T variant was included in the identified variants and was characterized as resilient.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The FN1:rs116558455-A variant was documented as resilient in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: RAB10:rs142787485-G variant was included in the investigation and reported as resilient.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The UGT1A4 rs3732218 genetic variant was associated with the drug Anastrozole, affecting its glucuronidation. This variant indicated variability in the drug's elimination from the body, which consequently influenced both its efficacy and the incidence of side effects in breast cancer patients.
title: Pharmacogenomics in Tailoring First-Line Therapy for Breast Cancer: PharmGKB Database Insights

finding: The SNP rs2861694 was associated with both endometriosis and the GPM phenotype. This association was at a genome-wide significant level, confirming the link between these conditions.
title: Evidence of shared genetic factors in the aetiology of gastrointestinal disorders and endometriosis and clinical implications for disease management

finding: The SNP rs560887, associated with the G6PC2 gene, displayed drastically different significance levels across tests, with a significant p-value (p-value = 4.37 × 10^-20) in the two degree of freedom test. However, it yielded non-significant p-values in the maternal and fetal meta-analyses, thereby indicating complex patterns of maternal and fetal genetic interactions relative to birth weight.
title: Direct and INdirect effects analysis of Genetic lOci (DINGO): A software package to increase the power of locus discovery in GWAS meta-analyses of perinatal phenotypes and traits influenced by indirect genetic effects

finding: The SNP rs17710829 was noted for its interaction with the SNP rs9298897, contributing to a novel genetic interaction that played a role in PD progression as analyzed in cohorts like PPMI and LABS-PD.
title: Elucidating Molecular Networks Underpinning Heterogeneity in Parkinson’s Disease Progression Across Clinical Manifestation Spectrum

finding: The SNP rs77559646 was identified as a well-established causal variant for prostate cancer (PrCa) due to its role in disrupting ANO7 mRNA splicing and protein expression. This finding reinforced the known association of the chr8q24 region with PrCa susceptibility.
title: A novel Bayesian fine-mapping model using a continuous global-local shrinkage prior with applications in prostate cancer analysis

finding: The rs11125830 variant was identified in the GWAS for recurrent miscarriage and demonstrated a significant association (P=1.2e-08) with an Odds Ratio of 1.042. This variant was located near BCL11A, a gene involved in brain development.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The T allele on rs5742909 was more prevalent among patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) than the C allele, indicating its association with disease onset.
title: Genetic Susceptibility Of Cytotoxic T Lymphocyte-Associated Antigen 4 Gene Polymorphism In The Onset Of Arthritis

finding: The G allele was found to be more common among patients compared to the A allele. The mutation at rs231775 led to the change of threonine into alanine, contributing to decreased control over T cell activation, potentially resulting in autoimmune disorders including RA.
title: Genetic Susceptibility Of Cytotoxic T Lymphocyte-Associated Antigen 4 Gene Polymorphism In The Onset Of Arthritis

finding: G allele was more prevalent among RA patients compared to the A allele, suggesting its impact as a significant risk factor in the onset of RA.
title: Genetic Susceptibility Of Cytotoxic T Lymphocyte-Associated Antigen 4 Gene Polymorphism In The Onset Of Arthritis

finding: The study found that C allele was replaced by T allele and was significantly associated with the onset of RA while not significantly associated with osteoarthritis (OA).
title: Genetic Susceptibility Of Cytotoxic T Lymphocyte-Associated Antigen 4 Gene Polymorphism In The Onset Of Arthritis

finding: Allele G on rs3087243 was more common among patients than controls, indicating its contribution to RA onset. The mutant G allele altered levels of cytoplasmic and membrane CTLA-4.
title: Genetic Susceptibility Of Cytotoxic T Lymphocyte-Associated Antigen 4 Gene Polymorphism In The Onset Of Arthritis

finding: The SNP rs6431690 was identified within a locus on chromosome 2 that was specifically significant for recurrent major depression (MD). It demonstrated strong evidence of genetic association with this subtype of MD, as indicated by a p-value of less than 3.125e-9, even after applying stringent Bonferroni correction. This finding highlighted the potential for subtype-specific genetic effects within the broader context of genetic heterogeneity observed in major depression.
title: Genetic heterogeneity and subtypes of major depression

finding: This SNP was reported to associate with elevated circulating IL-6 levels and inferred as causal to AAA, LDL-C, total cholesterol, and triglycerides.
title: Shared Genetic Susceptibility between Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm and Cardiometabolic Traits

finding: The GCKR gene, with the SNP rs1260326, was linked to increased risk of liver disease, highlighting its relevance in insulin metabolism and liver fat.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: The SNP rs1544730 was associated with both ACEi-induced cough and chronic dry cough, mapping to the gene SRBD1. This association reached significance under Bonferroni correction, indicating it had previously reported relevance.
title: Genomics of chronic cough unravels neurological pathways

finding: The variant rs184204326 located on gene FBXO11 demonstrated a significant association with suicidal behaviors (SB) at p=1.48E-07, and a bivariate association with alcohol use disorder (AUD) at p=3.63E-08, indicating a notable overlap between SB and AUD susceptibility. This variant was the only common variant with a minor allele frequency (MAF) over 5%, and it was linked to differential expression in various brain regions.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Suicidal Behaviors and Alcohol Use Disorders in an American Indian Population

finding: While primarily highlighting its linkage disequilibrium with rs184204326, rs77969729 on gene FBXO11 had previous associations with Alzheimer’s disease in external datasets. In the AI cohort, it was tied to SB-AUD with a significant association of p=3.4E-7.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Suicidal Behaviors and Alcohol Use Disorders in an American Indian Population

finding: The rs1990760 TT variant of the IFIH1 gene provided protective effects in COVID-19 infections, correlating with better outcomes and less pronounced inflammatory response. The study indicated that carriers of the TT variant showed a blunted induction of the IFIH1 transcript, which was associated with a reduced type 1 interferon storm and less severe ILD in the context of anti-MDA5 positivity. This SNP was particularly significant in younger patients and those with less severe disease, as well as in the presence of other covariates such as gender and need for ventilation.
title: MDA5-autoimmunity and Interstitial Pneumonitis Contemporaneous with the COVID-19 Pandemic (MIP-C)

finding: The SNP rs62154092 was found in an intergenic region, showing a significant association with large coronary aneurysms (CAA/L) in Kawasaki disease given its p-value of <6.32E-08. This variant was the most significant in the study linking it to the pathology of CAA, which can occur despite IVIG treatment.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The rs535484207 variant in RANBP2 demonstrated a staggering association with multiple cancers in lymphoid neoplasms, showing an odds ratio of 256.01 and a p-value of 1.46×10^-6.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The SNP rs76122535 was associated with an intronic region of the ICA1L gene at 2q33.2. It was linked to variant effects on expression and splicing in multiple tissues, with a priority score suggesting a significant role in stress responses and senescence.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The SNP rs3931848 was identified as a lead SNP associated with the non-SU externalizing factor in the study. It was found on chromosome 2 and pertains to genetic variance that contributes to liability for polysubstance use (PSU) independent of substance use (SU). This suggests that genetic factors linked to externalizing traits may play a unique role in the risk for PSU.
title: Genetic associations among internalizing and externalizing traits with polysubstance use among young adults

finding: The SNP rs11682175 was another lead SNP located on chromosome 2 that was associated with the non-SU externalizing factor. This association reinforced the idea that certain genetic factors related to externalizing traits independently influence the risk for PSU, distinct from those affecting SU.
title: Genetic associations among internalizing and externalizing traits with polysubstance use among young adults

finding: The SNP rs7560837, also situated on chromosome 2, was among the lead SNPs related to the non-SU externalizing factor. Its identification supported the conclusion that externalizing traits have a genetic basis contributing to PSU risk, separate from general substance use.
title: Genetic associations among internalizing and externalizing traits with polysubstance use among young adults

finding: The variant rs1484116 in <italic>TTN</italic> was associated with reduced cardiac function and worse long-term mortality in heart failure (HF) patients, showing a risk allele frequency of 0.315 in East Asians compared to 0.800 in Europeans. Its effect size was significantly greater in Japanese individuals.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: This missense variant related to <italic>TTN</italic> was associated with heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF), showing a substantial frequency difference between East Asians (64.7%) and Europeans (20.1%).
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs72824565 was associated with a 3-week decrease in gestational age, suggesting that it may influence fetal neurodevelopmental impairments. It was the most significant signal in the GWAS for GA and mapped to the CTNNA2 gene.
title: Genetic association study of Preterm birth and Gestational age in a population-based case-control study in Peru

finding: The SNP rs13000026 had been identified as associated with endometriosis and high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC). It was located intronic to the gene COBLL1, demonstrating genome-wide significant associations (P-value < 5×10^-8) with a combined signal indicating a shared causal relationship.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The regulatory coding SNP rs1990760 in the IFIH1 gene was linked to lupus susceptibility and acted as a trans-eQTL, influencing nine immune signaling-related genes, thereby enhancing the immune response.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: The SNP rs7585730 associated with AC068490.2 was also identified as a shared locus among the psychiatric disorders studied.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The lead SNP rs11890028 was reported in multiple studies, specifically noted in the GWAS conducted by Song et al. (2021) and ILAE (2018). Its presence suggested sample overlap but confirmed its association across studied cohorts.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: The rs147001633 SNP in DNMT3A was significantly associated with lifespan reduction (HR = 1.8, p = 3.7 x 10^-5).
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The rs377023736 SNP in SF3B1 was identified as significant for lifespan reduction with a hazard ratio of 6.0 (p = 8.5 x 10^-8).
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: SNP rs58857776 had a replication p-value of 0.003 and was previously associated with BMI, insomnia, and naps. This association was significant as it represented a novel finding relevant to OSA.
title: Genome-wide association study of obstructive sleep apnea in the Million Veteran Program uncovers genetic heterogeneity by sex

finding: Within the CTLA4 gene, the rs3087243 SNP displayed a moderate protective role against thyroid disorders, indicated by a RAF of 0.8125 in cases and 0.8333 in controls. The OR was approximately 0.867 which suggested a marginal protective effect, yet it was still associated with increased rates of autoimmune thyroid diseases like Graves' disease and Hashimoto's thyroiditis.
title: SNP Genes Effect on Thyroid Disorders in a Chinese Demographic

finding: The rs231779 SNP, also in the CTLA4 gene, was associated with an increased risk of thyroid disorders, as demonstrated by a case RAF of 0.78125 against a control RAF of 0.6944. The odds ratio was recorded at 1.571, supporting its role as a significant risk factor for both Graves' disease and hypothyroidism.
title: SNP Genes Effect on Thyroid Disorders in a Chinese Demographic

finding: The SNP rs1250258 in the FN1 gene was found to replicate for heart failure with a P MTAG HF_R of 4.08×10^-2.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs4245791, associated with the ABCG8 gene, demonstrated consistent effects in both GWAS CAD and MTAG HF analyses. It reached significance in GWAS CAD and was noted in the context of heart failure.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The variant rs6705977 was associated with fifteen N-acetylated molecules, identifying its functional impact on metabolite levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This missense variant in SLC23A3 was associated with 19 metabolites and was likely the causal variant for these associations.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The variant rs77684493 was in near-perfect LD with the missense variant rs2255991, both associated with pyroglutamylglutamine levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The variant rs6544713 was associated with lower campesterol levels and was correlated with higher gallstone risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The AOX1 variant was associated with 7-methylguanine levels, demonstrating its metabolic relevance in purine metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This variant in HADHA/HADHB was associated with 3-hydroxylaurate levels, linking it to fatty acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The KYNU variant was associated with xanthurenate, highlighting its role in tryptophan metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The ST3GAL5 variant was associated with lactosyl-N-behenoyl-sphingosine levels, relevant for glycosylation processes.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This SNP exhibited a nominal association (p=9.70E-07) near the AFF3 gene, a candidate associated with externalizing psychopathology.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: This SNP was significantly associated (p=1.10E-08) near SPHKAP and PID1, suggesting novel links with impulsivity.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: This SNP showed a nominal association (p=1.10E-07) near the AFF3 gene, related to externalizing behaviors.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: Showed significant findings (p=9.70E-09) near BLC11A, linked with behavioral traits.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs887829, which corresponds to the UGT1A1*80 polymorphism, was associated with indirect hyperbilirubinemia in the general population, specifically connected to Gilbert syndrome. This polymorphism was significant in the context of patients treated with atazanavir, as those with the PMs genotype (carriers of two decreased function alleles) were more likely to develop jaundice, affecting treatment adherence.
title: Exploration of interethnic variation and repurposed drug efficacy in the treatment of SARS-CoV-2 Infection (COVID-19)

finding: The intronic variant rs76952347, located in the LYPD6 gene on chromosome 2, was strongly linked with functional chest pain.
title: Combined GWAS and single cell transcriptomics uncover the underlying genes and cell types in disorders of gut-brain interaction

finding: The leading SNP rs117888248 was part of a Neanderthal-originating haplotype within the DPP4-DT gene on chromosome 2, which in heterozygous form was reported to double the severity of COVID-19, while in homozygous form, it correlated with a quadruple occurrence of severe disease.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs118098838 was combined with rs117888248 as part of the same haplotype that was linked to severe COVID-19 outcomes, showing substantial genetic implications for disease severity.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs11125529 was associated with shorter telomere length, which, in turn, was causally linked to increased risk of developing coronary heart disease, highlighting its role in cardiac aging.
title: Leukocyte Telomere Length and Cardiac Structure and Function: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs116763937 located at 2p13.3 was significantly associated with endometriosis, with a P-value of 4.07E-08, and was significant in both the AFR analysis and the surgically confirmed cases analysis.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The SNP rs115117372, identified in KCNF1, showed significant association with endometriosis, with a P-value of 1.97E-08, and was also significant in the EUR meta-analysis.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: This SNP was marked as an index variant associated with neutrophil count, displaying a statistically significant association similar to findings by other studies (e.g., Chen et al.), thus underscoring its importance.
title: Investigating a causal role for neutrophil count on P. falciparum severe malaria: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1260326 near GCKR was associated with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease, emphasizing its involvement in lipid and glucose metabolism.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: This SNP was associated with thyroid function and was identified in the context of TSH GWAS, supporting its role in thyroid adenoma related genetics.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: With its association mapped to genes influential in cancer biology, rs10179849 contributed to the understanding of cancer-related genetic factors.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: In the COLEC11 locus, the T allele of rs3820897 was associated with lower levels of the anti-inflammatory protein ALPL, differing from previous associations with higher circulating inflammatory protein levels.
title: Genome and epigenome wide studies of plasma protein biomarkers for Alzheimer’s disease implicate TBCA and TREM2 in disease risk

finding: The rs3821236 SNP related to the STAT4 gene showed significant interactions restricted to CD4+ T cells and was associated with greater STAT4 expression compared to CD14+ monocytes, suggesting the presence of cell type specific regulatory mechanisms.
title: Functional genomics in primary T cells and monocytes identifies mechanisms by which genetic susceptibility loci influence systemic sclerosis risk

finding: The SNP rs6741951 was associated with an adverse effect on adult-BMI, hip circumference (HC), and waist circumference (WC) after the removal of an outlier from the daytime-sleepiness instrument during radial-MR analysis. Specifically, following the exclusion, the results reported were beta=0.48 SD for adult-BMI, beta=0.55 SD for HC, and beta=0.51 SD for WC, suggesting a bidirectional relationship between daytime-sleepiness and these adiposity traits.
title: Establishing causal relationships between sleep and adiposity traits using Mendelian randomisation

finding: The SNP rs113017476 was linked to a negative effect on schizophrenia, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.60 and 95% confidence intervals (CIs) ranging from 0.88 to 0.41, with a significance of p=0.010. This SNP mapped to the SRD5A2 gene, which is involved in processing androgens.
title: The role of sex hormones in severe mental illness: a genetic exploration

finding: The SNP rs17020490 at the PRKD3 locus was independently replicated in the study, demonstrating an association with AD risk consistent with previous findings.
title: First GWAS on Alzheimer’s Disease in Argentina and Chile populations

finding: The SNP rs4663105 in the BIN1 gene was found to have a genome-wide significant association with AD (p=3.2×10^-9), indicating its role as a significant risk factor after APOE.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The SNP rs780093 located in the GCKR locus presented a significant association with hs-CRP levels, with a P-value of 1.85e-13, which relates to metabolic regulation.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The rs797045038 variant in the DCAF17 gene was linked to Woodhouse-Sakati syndrome (WSS) and identified as a founder variant in the Qatari population with a MAF of 1.25%. It was strongly associated with the disease context, particularly given its occurrence in 30 reported cases globally.
title: Qatar Genome: Insights on Genomics from the Middle East

finding: The SNP rs10171574 exhibited an inverse association with coronary heart disease (CHD), where higher genetically-predicted expression of CXCR4 correlated to reduced CHD risk, indicated by a p-value of 9.52x10^-7. Colocalization results suggested that the CHD-increasing allele corresponded with higher neutrophil percentages, reinforcing suggestions about possible safety concerns associated with RXCR4 inhibitors due to their potential effects on CHD risk.
title: Transcriptome- and proteome-wide Mendelian randomization to prioritize therapeutic targets for coronary heart disease

finding: The SNP rs10199082, associated with the PNPT1 gene, was identified as having a strong association with accelerated abdominal aging. This gene is linked to mitochondrial RNA metabolic functions and has been implicated in various diseases, including mitochondrial disorders and Leigh syndrome. Additionally, this locus was associated with pulse pressure, indicating its relevance in cardiovascular traits. The finding suggested a genetic basis for abdominal aging, contributing to an understanding of heritable factors in this phenotype.
title: Using deep learning to predict age from liver and pancreas magnetic resonance images allows the identification of genetic and non-genetic factors associated with abdominal aging

finding: The SNP rs1597916, which is an intronic variant within the CPO gene, exhibited a significant association with GDM susceptibility, presenting an OR of 1.65 (95% CI 1.39, 1.97) and a p-value of 1.98×10-8, highlighting its role in GDM risk.
title: Genome-wide association and Mendelian randomisation analysis among 30,699 Chinese pregnant women identifies novel genetic and molecular risk factors for gestational diabetes and glycaemic traits

finding: The rs744373 SNP in the BIN1 gene was associated with increased tau-PET levels as well as impaired memory, indicating its role in the cognitive decline associated with Alzheimer's disease. This finding was established in the study by Franzmeier et al. (2019) and further supported in their 2022 study, which showed that this SNP correlated with faster accumulation of Aβ-associated tau and cognitive decline in Alzheimer's disease patients.
title: Towards cascading genetic risk in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs13389219, associated with COBLL1, revealed a significant correlation with GFATadjBMI (P = 3.0 x 10^-23) while being implicated in a metabolically healthy obesity phenotype.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs3820981 exhibited a significant association with GFATadjBMI (P = 1.5 x 10^-12).
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs34224594 was linked to GFATadjBMI with a significant P-value of 2.8 x 10^-9.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs6738627 was implicated in a metabolically healthy obesity phenotype and presented a strong link to rs13389219.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs55920843, a missense variant in ACVR1C, was associated with a reduced VAT/GFAT ratio (beta = -0.18; P = 1.9 x 10^-8) and previously linked to reduced WHRadjBMI.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs56188432, another missense variant in ACVR1C, was also linked with a reduced VAT/GFAT ratio (beta = -0.20; P < 0.01).
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs2713552 showed a strong association with GFATadjBMI corresponding to IRS1 expression (Z-score = 9.1; P = 6.2 x 10^-20), confirming the role of IRS1 in insulin resistance.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The study identified rs13396472 as linked to the gene BCL2L11 within the RA locus. This SNP showed strong allelic imbalance (FDR 1.86E-96) with a 40% reduction in chromatin accessibility associated with the protective allele. Despite its positional association with ACOXL, BCL2L11 is crucial for autoimmune pathogenesis and T cell activity.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: This SNP showed strong allelic imbalance (FDR 1.86E-96) indicating a reduction in chromatin accessibility associated with the protective allele. It connects enhancer activity to BCL2L11, crucial for T cell regulation in autoimmune contexts.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs1260326 was significantly associated with PUFA traits in multiple studies, positioning it as a well-established locus in the genetics of PUFA levels.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: The variant rs359268 exhibited genetic links with the mode of the cingulum, specifically within the context of hypersomnia.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs62158170 variant was associated with key brain network features, indicating its role in the genetic landscape of sleep duration.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: In genetic analyses, rs12713372 showed overlaps with brain network features linked to sleep manipulation.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: This variant was linked to several genes related to attention networks, contributing to the genetic landscape of sleep studies.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: This variant was found to relate to cerebellar characteristics tied to sleep disturbances.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was observed in genetic studies concerning brain functionalities and sleep.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs3834129, associated with the CASP8 gene, indicated a positive finding concerning its correlation with colorectal cancer susceptibility. This was highlighted in a study referenced for its updated meta-analysis, suggesting that variations at this locus contributed to increased risk for colorectal cancer.
title: Prevalence of cancer susceptibility variants in patients with multiple Lynch syndrome related cancers

finding: The SNP rs1260326 at the GCKR locus had a p-value of 4.53×10−08, confirming its previous associations with alcohol consumption measures. This corroborated its relevance in genetic frameworks of alcohol consumption.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs6752675 on chromosome 2 had a p-value of 2.57×10−08, establishing its role in the genetic architecture governing alcohol traits.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The variant rs1260326 in the GCKR gene was identified as an independent variant associated with problematic alcohol use (PAU) in the cross-ancestry meta-analysis, contributing to the overall risk of PAU.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: Variant rs472140 in the ADH1B gene was part of the credible set identified in the EUR analysis, reinforcing its association with PAU and potential as a risk factor.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The rs13026575 variant was identified as a shared causal SNP between hearing difficulty (HD) and the brain imaging-derived phenotype (IDP) associated with left primary visual cortex volume (IDP 0419) in females. Its colocalization with the SPTBN1 transcriptomic regulation across multiple brain tissues suggests a genetic mechanism linking brain structure and HD.
title: Sex differences in the pleiotropy of hearing difficulty with imaging-derived phenotypes: a brain-wide investigation

finding: The coding variant rs2232326 at the <italic>G6PC2</italic> locus was implicated in RG with predicted deleterious effects, supporting its role in gluconeogenesis.
title: Random glucose GWAS in 493,036 individuals provides insights into diabetes pathophysiology, complications and treatment stratification

finding: The coding variant rs138726309 at the <italic>G6PC2</italic> locus was highlighted for its established deleterious effects and connection to RG.
title: Random glucose GWAS in 493,036 individuals provides insights into diabetes pathophysiology, complications and treatment stratification

finding: The rs2232323 variant, also within the <italic>G6PC2</italic> locus, was noted for showing deleterious effects related to RG signals.
title: Random glucose GWAS in 493,036 individuals provides insights into diabetes pathophysiology, complications and treatment stratification

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with combined drug response, particularly noting its association with tamoxifen, BI.2536, and belinostat (p=4.26 x 10^-8). It is located in the ATRAID gene, which plays a role in drug transport and may influence treatment outcomes through interaction with retinoic acid pathways.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: This intergenic SNP acted as a cis-eQTL for SANBR, a negative regulator of class switch recombination, highlighting its role in antibody responses.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: The rs1469513 SNP was found to be associated with obesity, with the findings indicating that its effects were modified by dietary fat intake in the Korean population. This suggests that individuals with this genotype may respond differently to obesity in the context of dietary factors.
title: Weight loss in patients with COVID-19 and Influenza in comorbidity with NCDs: a pilot prospective clinical trial

finding: The rs6760240 SNP, located in the ZSWIM2 gene, interacted with STST regarding TG levels, showing a significant genetic association.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The rs190975828 SNP, mapped to the ZNF804A gene, interacted with LTST concerning LDL-c levels, indicating a significant association.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The SNP rs34771893, which mapped to SLC8A1, showed significant interaction with STST in relation to TG levels.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: Located intronic of LINC00298, this variant showed significant association with AD with a meta-analysis P-value of 2.44×10^-4, underscoring its novel contribution to AD risk.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals new Alzheimer’s disease-associated rare variants in loci related to synaptic function and neuronal development

finding: The common missense variant in the glucokinase regulatory protein (GCKR) gene, rs1260326 (GCKR:p.Leu446Pro), was significantly associated with 51 out of 56 selected metabolites, demonstrating a high level of pleiotropy and indicating its critical role in metabolic processes.
title: Genome-wide association study for circulating metabolites in 619,372 individuals

finding: GCKR, associated with this SNP, was identified as a shared signal between multiple FA traits in both models 2 and 3.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was identified at the CPS1 locus and linked to various FA traits, contributing to the complexity of metabolic regulation.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Identified as a novel variant associated with atopic dermatitis across two or more populations, representing a new finding in this GWAS context.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: Found to be a missense variant in the INPP5D gene, which has been implicated in other immune-related conditions, marking its association with AD.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP showed consistent effects in European, Latino, and Japanese individuals and is located between NEU4 and PDCD1, both of which are associated with immune function.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP was noted for its association with several genes and had previously been observed in significant analyses regarding immune system loci.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: SNP rs7587026, located in the gene SCN1A, was associated with MTLEHS + FS. The linkage of SCN1A mutations to various forms of epilepsy was emphasized, demonstrating the gene's critical role in the disorder's genetic background.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: The c.2133G>C (p.Leu711Phe) variant in the SCN9A gene was repeated in 3% of the tests, indicating a potential pathogenicity. The amino acid change from leucine to phenylalanine might alter the function of the Nav.17 sodium channel, leading to signal disruptions, and was classified as probably damaging by PolyPhen-2.
title: Previously defined variants of uncertain significance may play an important role in epilepsy and interactions between certain variants may become pathogenic

finding: The D19H variant of ABCG8 (rs11887534) demonstrated a highly significant association with gallstones (P < 4.94 * 10^-324) and was recognized as the lead SNP.
title: Genome-wide Analysis Identifies Novel Gallstone-susceptibility Loci Including Genes Regulating Gastrointestinal Motility

finding: The SNP rs4274624 located at locus 2q32.2 was found to be significantly associated with Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) with a P-value of 9.7×10⁻⁶⁶. This finding related to common non-HLA susceptibility genes identified across both European and Chinese populations.
title: Genome-wide Association Clustering Meta-analysis in European and Chinese Datasets for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus identifies new genes

finding: The rs12992672/TMEM18 variant was linked to several HF risk factors including BMI, HDL-C, T2DM, AF, and smoking, indicating its role in HF predisposition.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The rs3820888/SPATS2L variant was associated with six LV cardiac-MRI traits and AF, with all associations being directionally concordant with HF findings.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The eQTL rs1375493 was identified for the inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)-associated ITGA4 locus using the SAIGE-QTL method. This SNP was noted for its ability to recapitulate the monocyte-specificity of the eQTL, which had been previously documented.
title: Efficient and accurate mixed model association tool for single-cell eQTL analysis

finding: The study found that variants of IFIH1 rs1990760 influenced systemic inflammation and outcomes in critically ill COVID-19 patients. This indicates a significant role of this SNP in the pathogenesis of severe COVID-19.
title: Transcriptomic clustering of critically ill COVID-19 patients

finding: The variant rs887829 located in the core promoter region of the UGT1A1 gene was found in a previous GWAS to explain 12.4% of the variance in serum total bilirubin levels in African Americans, further highlighting its role in bilirubin metabolism.
title: Systematic comparison of phenome-wide admixture mapping and genome-wide association in a diverse biobank

finding: The association with phecode 573.5 ‘Jaundice (not of newborn)’ was confirmed, indicating that high bilirubin levels underlie the association between this SNP and the phenotype, highlighting its importance in bilirubin metabolism and associated conditions.
title: Systematic comparison of phenome-wide admixture mapping and genome-wide association in a diverse biobank

finding: Located at 2p16.1, SNP rs1123573 was significantly associated with endometrial cancer, with a p-value of 3.29×10^-85.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: Located within the BAZ2B gene, the sentinel variant rs13003835 was significantly associated with an increased risk of COVID-19 hospitalization (OR=1.20, 95% CI=1.12-1.27, p=3.66×10^-8). This association was novel and had not been previously reported.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: For rs3923113 in the GRB14 gene, the liability GWAS revealed a significant association with type 2 diabetes while the binary method failed to detect it, confirming previous literature findings.
