title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs1999 was found to correlate with psychological distress levels as measured during the midlife peak years of 1999 for the NSHD cohort. This finding related to the psychological well-being of participants born in 1946, showing that genetic contributions could potentially influence stress responses during this time frame. The analysis indicated that variations at this SNP may explain some of the observed changes in psychological distress trajectories leading into the COVID-19 pandemic.
title: Disruption of long-term psychological distress trajectories during the COVID-19 pandemic: evidence from three British birth cohorts

finding: The rs1469513 SNP was identified as a cis-eQTL in adipose tissues, which showed a directional mismatch in therapeutic predictions due to its association with a missense variant (rs679899) in the APOB gene. The APOB genetic association showed higher levels of the protein predicted a lower risk of hypercholesterolemia, which was inconsistent with the biological function of apolipoprotein B.
title: Systematic disease-agnostic identification of therapeutically actionable targets using the genetics of human plasma proteins

finding: The rs679899 SNP was indicated to be in linkage disequilibrium with rs1469513, influencing the protein levels of apolipoprotein B. The findings suggested a complex interaction whereby the predicted therapeutic association diverged from expected outcomes, thus emphasizing the importance of thorough biological context in interpreting genetic data.
title: Systematic disease-agnostic identification of therapeutically actionable targets using the genetics of human plasma proteins

finding: Variant rs554982961 near ACP1 was newly identified in sensitivity analysis, being genome-wide significant (P=3.63×10−8) and emphasizing roles in cardiac hypertrophy and fibrosis.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs7574806 was also linked to the 'Problems' latent factor for AUBs, with a very strong association indicated by a P value of 4.49 × 10^-53. This variant is located downstream of the SERTAD2 gene on chromosome 2, suggesting a significant role in the genetic architecture of alcohol-related problems.
title: Genetic Heterogeneity Across Dimensions of Alcohol Use Behaviors

finding: The rs1374749 variant in the EPAS1 gene was associated with lower hemoglobin (HGB) levels in Tibetans, indicating its potential role as a risk factor for HAPC with a significance of P<0.01.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: This locus showed significant differences in genetic susceptibility to HAPC in the Tibetan population but was not specifically detailed in the findings related to risk.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: The variant rs11678465 in EPAS1 was assessed in relation to genetic susceptibility towards HAPC among Tibetans, showcasing a connection to blood phenotype variation.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: Identified as a risk factor for HAPC within the Tibetan context, with significant implication on hemoglobin level alterations.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: This variant in EPAS1 showed a correlation with susceptibility to HAPC, consistent with trends of altered blood phenotypes in Tibetans.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs1123573 was successfully replicated at locus 2p16.1, where it serves as an intronic variant for the gene BCL11A. This variant highlights its potential contribution to IPF, with implications for lymphocyte development and immune responses.
title: Common and rare variant analyses reveal novel genetic factors underlying Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis and shared aetiology with COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs13010017 was associated with the prognosis of B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia relapse in childhood. This finding was significant in the context of high-dimensional analysis of flow cytometry data. The research indicated that while there were no notable differences in immunophenotypic patterns between relapse and non-relapse patients based solely on flow cytometry, the genomic analysis incorporating this SNP provided insights into relapse prediction.
title: Computational flow cytometry immunophenotyping at diagnosis is unable to predict relapse in childhood B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

finding: The SNP rs72842919 was part of the locus associated with endophenotype T2:14, which previously linked it to late-onset Alzheimer’s disease. This finding highlighted its significance in cortical thickness and surface area measurements, identifying regions like the hippocampus and parahippocampal gyrus.
title: New phenotype discovery method by unsupervised deep representation learning empowers genetic association studies of brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs12470661 was part of the 118 novel variants that were replicated, corresponding to one of 18 novel loci associated with blood pressure (BP) traits.
title: Genome-wide pleiotropy analysis identifies novel blood pressure variants and improves its polygenic risk scores

finding: The SNP rs4264571 was identified as a significant genetic variation associated with Alzheimer’s disease (AD) risk uniquely in females. This was evidenced by LocusZoom plots that showed several SNPs within the MERTK locus with r² > 0.8 specifically in the female population, indicating a strong genetic link between this SNP and AD in women. Additionally, tissue-specific gene-level association assessments revealed that the relationship between MERTK and AD was significant in various tissues including brain sub-tissues in females, but not in males.
title: Single-cell transcriptomic atlas of Alzheimer’s disease middle temporal gyrus reveals region, cell type and sex specificity of gene expression with novel genetic risk for MERTK in female

finding: The rs55790676 polymorphism was associated with decreased ADAM17 expression, with a frequency indicating increased susceptibility to COVID-19 among Indians.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The frequency of rs1524668 related to ADAM17 expression showed high prevalence in the Indian population, suggesting an increased risk for COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The T allele frequency of rs1990760 was found significant, suggesting a protective effect against infections in the Indian population through immune regulation.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs2270360 polymorphism was associated with increased COVID-19 severity, with a notable allele frequency observed in the Indian population.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The A allele of rs71040457 was associated with increased risk of mortality in COVID-19 among diverse populations.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: rs113892140 was correlated with increased risk of COVID-19 mortality, with allele frequencies varying across populations.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: SNP rs842634 was shown to be associated with increased IL-12 production from dendritic cells after stimulation with TBWCL and LPS. Although it was not directly linked with TB meningitis, it was in linkage disequilibrium with rs842618, which was associated with increased risk for TB meningitis.
title: CNBP, REL, and BHLHE40 variants are associated with IL-12 and IL-10 responses and tuberculosis risk

finding: The genetic variant rs842618, which was in linkage disequilibrium with rs842634, was associated with an increased risk of TB meningitis in Vietnamese patients, underlining its potential role in TB susceptibility.
title: CNBP, REL, and BHLHE40 variants are associated with IL-12 and IL-10 responses and tuberculosis risk

finding: The study indicated that SNP rs11887534 had a noteworthy impact on the association between cholecystectomy and gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). When this SNP was excluded in the leave-one-out analysis, the overall association between cholecystectomy and GERD remained consistent in direction but lost statistical significance, suggesting that this SNP significantly influenced the initially observed association.
title: Associations of cholecystectomy with the risk of gastroesophageal reflux disease: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: Variant rs7601684 was associated with Raynaud's syndrome and is located upstream of the RAB6C gene. This gene is part of the RAS oncogene family, which could hint at its involvement in vascular and growth signaling pathways relevant to RS.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The rs7559925 SNP, which is located in the intron of the ACVR2A gene, was significantly associated with Raynaud's syndrome and related immunological traits such as lymphocyte counts, indicating a potential correlation between immune function and vascular dysautonomia.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The SNP rs62641680 was associated with DGUOK, identified as a significant variant in mtDNA depletion disorders, suggesting its role in mtDNA copy number regulation.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The SNP rs74874677 was linked to DGUOK and represented a non-synonymous variant with posterior probability of 1, underlining its significant contribution to mtDNA function.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The SNP rs62165226 was associated with PNPT1 and showed significant mtDNA-CN impact, reinforcing its role in mitochondrial regulation.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The SNP rs10205130, mapped to LRPPRC, exhibited significant associations with mtDNA-CN, suggesting its involvement in gene expression regulation.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The rs1047891 nonsynonymous SNP in the CPS1 gene was associated with blood biomarkers related to endocrine/metabolic, genitourinary, and digestive functions.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: SNP rs12464825 emerged robustly from the multivariate MOSTest analysis, despite displaying weaker effects distributed across several cerebellar features, including opposite effect directions.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in recent human evolution and psychopathology

finding: The SNP rs55730955, located within the CD28 gene, demonstrated a significant association with pSSNS, with a p-value of 4.27 × 10^-10. This finding was categorized as novel, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing pSSNS.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The functional enhancer variant rs1427407 was previously reported and confirmed in this study with a probability of causality of 1.0, being a significant regulator of fetal hemoglobin levels linked to sickle cell disease.
title: Genomic discovery and functional validation of MRP1 as a novel fetal hemoglobin modulator and potential therapeutic target in sickle cell disease

finding: Similar to rs1427407, rs7606173 was also identified as a functional enhancer variant associated with fetal hemoglobin modulation, possessing a probability of causality of 1.0.
title: Genomic discovery and functional validation of MRP1 as a novel fetal hemoglobin modulator and potential therapeutic target in sickle cell disease

finding: The lead SNP rs6706648 at the BCL11A locus was associated with fetal hemoglobin levels, showing an effect size of -0.39 and achieving genome-wide significance (P = 4.96 x 10^-34). This finding underscored the role of BCL11A in modifying clinical severity in sickle cell disease (SCD).
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The SNP rs1427407 was identified within a trait-boosting haplotype at the BCL11A locus, associated with increased HbF levels. It was thought to disrupt transcription factor binding, reinforcing its role as a functional variant that may enhance fetal hemoglobin production.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The SNP rs7565301 was found to tag a significant haplotype at the BCL11A locus associated with HbF elevation. It showed a strong association with fetal hemoglobin levels and suggested potential functionality that required further investigation.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The SNP rs7606173 was defined within a haplotype at BCL11A with HbF-increasing effects, reinforcing its potential as a functional variant influencing fetal hemoglobin levels.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The SNP rs6738440 was found to play a role in HbF variance alongside other notable SNPs at the BCL11A locus and contributed to the complexity of genetic regulation of sickle cell disease.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The intronic variant rs1662979:G>T in CIB4 was associated with hospitalization (OR = 1.05, 95% CI = 1.03–1.07, P = 5.6 × 10^-9) but also indicated a decrease in lung function.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: IL1RL1 was highlighted as putatively causal for inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD), Crohn's disease (CD), and ulcerative colitis (UC) specifically within East Asian ancestry. This was determined through two-sample Mendelian randomization and colocalization analyses, using the strict V2G cis-pQTL identified in the Kyoto University Nagahama cohort.
title: Multi-ancestry proteome-phenome-wide Mendelian randomization offers a comprehensive protein-disease atlas and potential therapeutic targets

finding: IL1RL1 was also found to have a causal effect on inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD) and ulcerative colitis (UC) in African ancestry. This finding was supported by Mendelian randomization performed using outcome GWAS data from the Million Veteran Program, indicating a significant association for the variant in relation to these phenotypes.
title: Multi-ancestry proteome-phenome-wide Mendelian randomization offers a comprehensive protein-disease atlas and potential therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs4591370 was previously reported to be significantly associated with circulating LDL-cholesterol concentrations with a p-value of 8.2 x 10^-9. This finding relates to its role in cholesterol metabolism.
title: Enhancing genotype-phenotype association with optimized machine learning and biological enrichment methods

finding: I923V variant was identified as T1D-protective and associated with other autoimmune conditions such as psoriasis, hypothyroidism, Crohn's disease, and ulcerative colitis.
title: MDA5 variants trade antiviral activity for protection from autoimmune disease

finding: T946A variant was found to be common and was associated with T1D protection as well as other diseases including psoriasis and hypothyroidism.
title: MDA5 variants trade antiviral activity for protection from autoimmune disease

finding: The lead SNP rs10174949 was found in the intron of gene LINC00299 and played an important role in atopic dermatitis, including asthma, hay fever, and eczema in European and UK populations.
title: A powerful replicability analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: At the GCKR locus, rs1260326 was identified with associations across 20 traits, similar to the pleiotropic pattern observed in other loci.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: This SNP was associated with beta-sitosterol levels with a significant P-value of 5.54×10^−14. It represents a missense variant (p.Gly98Ala) within the ABCG5/8 locus, indicating a decrease in ABCG5 transporter function, which potentially leads to increased beta-sitosterol levels.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with beta-sitosterol levels (P=1.0×10^−12) and had been previously reported in the GWAS Catalog as significantly linked to the beta-sitosterol trait.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: This variant was independently associated with campesterol levels and reached genome-wide significance (P=4.15×10^−8) as part of the ABCG5/8 locus.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: pgBoost linked rs1427407, fine-mapped for red blood cell count with a PIP of 0.99, to BCL11A at a distance of 40kb to the TSS. This SNP was located in an intronic enhancer of BCL11A, which is crucial for fetal-to-adult hemoglobin switching in erythroid cells. The link recorded highly in cell-type-level predictions for erythroid cells, indicating its relevance.
title: Linking regulatory variants to target genes by integrating single-cell multiome methods and genomic distance

finding: SNP rs4953149 was one of the 42 SNPs associated with the common liability to addiction, although specific details on its individual effects were not highlighted in the provided findings.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: The variant rs13025959 in the MYO7B gene was linked to reduced improvement in general psychopathological symptoms after antipsychotic treatment in patients of African ancestry.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The frameshift variant rs11368509 in the UPP2 gene was associated with improved treatment outcomes in patients with anti-psychotic medications among Xhosa populations.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The CC genotype of the DNMT3A gene variant rs2304429 was linked to an improved antipsychotic treatment response in South African schizophrenia patients.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: This SNP was associated with cognitive traits and morphological features of the brain, as evidenced by data showing overlapping genetic influences.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: Related to intelligence and confirming earlier research, this SNP further elucidated its genetic link to brain shape characteristics.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The SNP rs186500234, tagging LINC01865/LINC01874, was identified as significantly associated with low T1D PRS in the study, suggesting a potential novel locus related to autoimmune type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs28957087, linked to LOC730100, showed significant association with low T1D PRS, indicating a novel genetic locus that could influence susceptibility to type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs75634056, associated with B3GNT2/TMEM17, was found to be significantly linked to low T1D PRS, highlighting its potential role in the genetic architecture of type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs77418738, which tags FAM136A/TGFA, was also significantly associated with low T1D PRS, marking it as a novel contributor to type 1 diabetes susceptibility.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs922452, linked to GCC2/EDAR, showed genome-wide significance in relation to low T1D PRS, suggesting its involvement in type 1 diabetes pathogenesis.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: This SNP at the IL1RN locus significantly associated with IL-1β response to monosodium urate crystal stimulation, indicating its relevance in gout's inflammatory response.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: At the XDH locus, rs7594951 was associated with gout risk specifically in males, showing sex-specific risk visualization.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: The SNP rs7570232 was significantly associated with Body Mass Index (BMI), with a p-value of 6.6E-09 and a beta coefficient of -0.08 in the GWAS. This association suggested its influence on BMI, which is a crucial trait related to the risk of developing Type 2 Diabetes (T2D).
title: Improved Type 2 Diabetes Risk Stratification in the Qatar Biobank Cohort by Ensemble Learning Classifier Incorporating Multi-Trait, Population-Specific, Polygenic Risk Scores

finding: The SNP rs59330234 was highlighted as the lead SNP in an intron of the CCDC85A gene, marking it as a potentially novel PD locus not previously observed in European PD GWAS. This gene was implicated in Parkinson's Disease for the first time in this study, indicating its potential significance in the genetic landscape of PD.
title: The genetic drivers of juvenile, young, and early-onset Parkinson’s Disease in India

finding: The SNP rs200560853, located in the ITGA6 gene, was significantly associated with cataract susceptibility in a Puerto Rican population. This rare coding variant exhibited a large effect size (odds ratio of 12.7) and was linked to a 13.7-year earlier onset of cataracts. The study found that this variant was primarily present in individuals with ancestry from the Americas and suggested a North African origin, highlighting the importance of including underrepresented populations in genetic research.
title: GWAS of cataract in Puerto Ricans identifies a novel large-effect variant in ITGA6

finding: The rs145201970 variant in the ERCC3 gene was significantly associated with prostate cancer (PrCa) risk, showing a p-value of 2.57 x 10^-4 in the combined datasets. It affects the gene's function as it results in an amino acid change (p.R283C) that may disrupt essential protein interactions.
title: Germline sequencing of DNA-damage-repair genes in two hereditary prostate cancer cohorts reveals new disease risk-associated gene variants

finding: Associated with rapid progression subtype (Subtype III), indicating its relevance in understanding phenotypic heterogeneity in Parkinson's disease.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was linked to mild progression subtype (Subtype I), emphasizing protective genetic influences in less severe cases.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs143080277 was associated with late onset Alzheimer's disease (AD). It was found in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with a 5,505bp deletion at chr2:105731359, upstream of the highly expressed microglial cell gene NCK2, with an R2 value of 0.7.
title: A Specialized Reference Panel with Structural Variants Integration for Improving Genotype Imputation in Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Dementias (ADRD)

finding: The SNP rs2715199 demonstrated a significant sex-specific interaction effect on orofacial cleft risk among a cohort of Filipino ancestry trios. Analysis indicated a genome-wide significant p-value of 1.1 × 10^-8 following genomic-control correction. Across various populations, the effect estimates varied, with the strongest association (effect estimate of 3.24) observed in the Filipino trios, further highlighting the relevance of this SNP in genetic research related to sex-specific traits in orofacial clefts.
title: Custom Biomedical FAIR Data Analysis in the Cloud Using CAVATICA

finding: The SNP rs4338920 was associated with the LRP1B gene, displaying a weak genetic connection to rheumatoid arthritis as determined through mapping with other significant GWAS findings.
title: New Genetic Insights in Rheumatoid Arthritis using Taxonomy3®, a Novel method for Analysing Human Genetic Data

finding: The rs34263553 SNP was associated with the ETAA1 gene and demonstrated strong regulatory features, including its highest PPLD value (0.87). This SNP was shown to interact with the ETAA1 promoter and was implicated in decreased ETAA1 expression in T cells, suggesting an important regulatory role in muscle pathology.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: In the study, it was reported that among the entire cohort evaluated for undiagnosed pediatric and prenatal genetic conditions, only one variant was identified with an increased frequency, which was the AR VUS c.636G>C (p.[Gln212His]) associated with the gene ARMC9. This variant, rs201590882, was found in an East Asian case and was noted to have a gnomAD frequency of 0.003 in East Asians, indicating a specific association with this genetic ancestry.
title: Diagnostic Yield of Exome Sequencing in a Diverse Pediatric and Prenatal Population is not Associated with Genetic Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs4251961 was associated with variations in IL-1 receptor antagonist concentrations during human infection. This original finding indicated the correlation of this SNP with differential regulation of IL-1Ra levels, influenced by transcription factor GATA-1, providing insights into the genetic factors affecting the inflammatory response in diseases.
title: Alterations in secondary structure and binding affinity from mutations in the interleukin-1 receptor antagonist

finding: The SNP rs72958644 located in the 2q33.3 locus was associated with higher (more positive) changes in NIHSS (ΔNIHSS), driven by the gene ADAM23, which was significantly expressed in neurons. This association was reinforced by consistent directionality across various ethnic groups.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: The SNP rs58763243 was correlated with lower ΔNIHSS, suggesting that its minor allele was associated with decreased neurological instability. It was located in a region with long non-coding RNAs.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: The SNP rs13403787 was associated with a higher ΔNIHSS, indicating that its minor allele was linked to increased neurological instability. This SNP was situated in a gene-rich region on chromosome 2.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: This SNP was associated with circulating leptin and was located in a positive effect cluster linked to obesity traits affecting reproductive conditions including PCOS.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: The analysis revealed that patient F001 had a mutation in the BCL11A gene at rs1427407, which contributed to a higher level of Hb F expression. It was noted that this elevation in Hb F expression occurred in correlation with >10% Hb F levels post-treatment, indicating the SNP's influence on hemoglobin characteristics without affecting the expression of HbA<T87Q>.
title: Gene therapy using optimized LentiHBBT87Q vector in two patients with transfusion dependent β-thalassemia

finding: Similar to rs1427407, rs4671393 also showed mutations in patient F001's BCL11A gene, correlating with an increase in Hb F expression exceeding 10%. This increase was evidenced in the patient's total hemoglobin levels over the treatment timeline, reinforcing its contribution to Hb F levels.
title: Gene therapy using optimized LentiHBBT87Q vector in two patients with transfusion dependent β-thalassemia

finding: Patient F001 exhibited a mutation at rs766432 within the BCL11A gene, which was associated with elevated Hb F levels post-treatment. This finding contributed to a broader understanding of how these specific genetic variants impact hemoglobin stabilization and expression patterns following gene therapy.
title: Gene therapy using optimized LentiHBBT87Q vector in two patients with transfusion dependent β-thalassemia

finding: The SNP rs7607879, located in the intron of the gene ARHGAP15 on chromosome 2q22, showed genome-wide significance in the association with diverticulosis. This finding indicated that the genetic variations at this locus could be linked to an increased risk of diverticular disease, which has implications for understanding the genetic basis of cancer risk in patients with diverticular disease.
title: Rho GTPase Activating Protein 15 (ARHGAP15) increases cancer risk in patients with diverticular disease

finding: The study identified a damaging missense variant rs12463674 (CADD=22.2, NP_001254479.2:p.Ile26225Thr) as a causal variant for hand grip strength (HGS) at the TTN locus. It was reported to be in high linkage disequilibrium with the sentinel SNP rs36051007 (r2=0.97), indicating its significant role in muscle strength.
title: Rare genetic variants impact muscle strength

finding: The SNP rs36051007 was noted as the sentinel SNP for fine-mapping the TTN locus, which showed a significant gene-based association (p=5.5e-8) with hand grip strength (HGS). This highlighted the combined effects of both rare and common genetic variation affecting muscle strength.
title: Rare genetic variants impact muscle strength

finding: The rs886815 SNP at the FARP2 locus was newly identified and deemed significant for FTLD-TDP A, indicating its potential role in FTLD-TDP pathology.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The minor allele T was associated with significantly worse global deficit score (GDS) and greater neurocognitive impairment (NCI) among participants, as 41.7% had at least one risk allele. The association remained significant in multivariable analyses, indicating a dose-dependent relationship.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: The minor allele C was associated with significantly worse GDS and increased NCI, with 41.4% of participants having at least one risk allele. The finding was significant across analyses but did not remain significant after considering other SNPs.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: The C risk allele was associated with significantly worse GDS and increased NCI, with analyses showing 39.4% frequency among participants. It remained a significant finding in doses with clear impact on cognitive scores.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: Homozygosity for the G allele was associated with significantly worse GDS and NCI. Although only 30.9% had this allele, it indicated significant correlations in cognitive deficits when factored into multivariable models.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: The G allele was significantly correlated to worse outcomes in GDS and NCI, with 30.9% of participants carrying it. It contributed to deficits in cognitive tests specifically concerning verbal fluency.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: The A risk allele was independently associated with worse GDS and NCI, found in 41.3% of participants. This SNP's association persisted through multivariable analysis and was linked to specific deficit patterns, particularly in executive functioning.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: The variant rs113171399 was associated with a reduced risk for type 2 diabetes (T2D) in African/African American populations, showing a significant odds ratio (OR) of 0.66 (95% CI: 0.57-0.77, p = 4.03 x 10^-8).
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: The variant rs1057163508 conferred a strong protective effect against T2D with an odds ratio of 0.07 (95% CI: 0.03-0.17, p = 4.24 x 10^-8), indicating its notable enrichment in African/African American ancestry.
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: This SNP was associated with adiponectin levels and exhibited significant heterogeneity in effect sizes across different populations.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: SNP rs1260326, a missense variant in the GCKR gene, was identified as a shared causal variant associated with lower omega-6% levels and reduced alcohol consumption. The T allele was linked to lower levels of omega-6% (β = -0.11, P = 7.0 × 10^-159) and decreased alcohol consumption, with noteworthy implications for liver-related health issues.
title: Shared genetic basis informs the roles of polyunsaturated fatty acids in brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs7594852 was described as the only fetal index SNP identified in a GWAS, showing a fetal only effect with a beta of 0.37 days. This finding established it as independent of parent origin.
title: Genetic effects on the timing of parturition and links to fetal birth weight

finding: The intronic SNP rs34555419 within the TET3 gene demonstrated significant enrichment across various conservation metrics, suggesting a high level of evolutionary conservation. It was related to gestational duration through eQTL associations.
title: Genetic effects on the timing of parturition and links to fetal birth weight

finding: The SNP rs1730120 demonstrated an association with expression of the gene DDX55 exclusively in males. This variant was associated with a reduced risk of multiple sclerosis (p=3.98×10^-8, OR=0.90) and revealed significant colocalization with male-specific eQTL (PP4=0.90), but not in females (PP4=0.06), indicating potential protective effects in male individuals.
title: Biological sex affects functional variation across the human genome

finding: The lead variant rs77509633 was identified at 2q32.3, located near the SLC39A10 gene, which has been previously found to express abnormally in patients with atopic dermatitis. The role of the gene was indicated in humoral immunity, making it relevant to psoriasis pathology.
title: Genetic study of psoriasis highlights its close link with socio-economic status and affective symptoms

finding: The RAPGEF4 variant (rs777158731) was similarly recognized as 'rare' (ExAC_SAS score of 0.0001) and was found to be common in both B1 and B2 NPC lines. This variant was classified as 'deleterious' by three of the prediction tools applied, suggesting its involvement in the observed cell migration abnormalities in bipolar disorder.
title: Dysregulation in EGF/ERBB signaling pathway may explain abnormalities in cellular migration in bipolar disorder in patient-derived neural precursors

finding: Near BABAM2, this African ancestry-specific variant was associated with reduced metformin response, with carriers of the G allele showing an increase in fasting glucose after treatment.
title: Genome-wide association analysis identifies ancestry-specific genetic variation associated with medication response in the Study to Understand the Genetics of the Acute Response to Metformin and Glipizide in Humans (SUGAR-MGH)

finding: The rs72844599 variant located downstream of THSD7B on chromosome 2q22.1 was associated with VT recurrence, resulting in a HR of 1.98 (95% CI: [1.55-2.52], P=3.83×10^-8). THSD7B is part of the thrombospondin family, which inhibits angiogenesis.
title: Genomic Landscape of Thrombosis Recurrence Risk Across Venous Thromboembolism Subtypes

finding: The SNP rs744373 was associated with faster rates of Abeta-associated tau accumulation and cognitive decline, indicating its role in Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Polygenic effect on accelerated tau pathology accumulation in Alzheimer’s disease: implications for patient selection in clinical trials

finding: This SNP was related to amino acid associations and was included despite its complexities in data harmonization due to its relevance in the study.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: This SNP was part of a haplotype affecting the FMNL2 gene with two mutations linked. It caused a stop-gain substitution that produces a truncated protein lacking critical domains needed for actin filament interaction, which was directly related to cell migration issues in pregnancy.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: Similar to rs750755379, this SNP also affected the FMNL2 gene, resulting in a missense mutation. Both findings regarding FMNL2 mutations were noted due to their link in embryos with poor outcomes, suggesting possible roles in embryonic viability.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: This SNP was identified in embryo FE165, presenting a damaging missense mutation. The significant effects of this alteration in the FMNL2 protein support the connection of these mutations to adverse reproductive outcomes, as FMNL2 is vital for cellular mechanisms influencing embryo health.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: This SNP was confirmed as a coding missense variant strongly linked to NAFLD with a significant association.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: This variant was identified as a lead SNP in the UGT1A region associated with neonatal jaundice. It was intronic and found to be in nearly perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs6755571, suggesting similar effects on risk.
title: Genome-wide analyses of neonatal jaundice reveal a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: Found in the UGT1A region, this SNP had a strong LD relationship (R² = 0.9) with rs6755571, indicating its association was driven by the transmitted parental alleles and highlighting genetic similarities in neonatal jaundice susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide analyses of neonatal jaundice reveal a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: The rs10209244 SNP, located at chr2:161561898:A/G, was identified as an array-wide significant SNP downstream of the RBMS1 gene. In the TS-EUROTRAIN/GWAS2 meta-analysis, it showed a random effects p-value of 6.16e-08, suggesting its association with TS, although it lacked individual significant status in previous analyses.
title: Genome-wide Association Study identifies two novel loci for Gilles de la Tourette Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs4849879 was associated with a lower risk of breast hypertrophy but a higher risk of breast cancer, indicating an antagonistic effect related to hormonal changes.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The SNP rs4343432 was associated with higher risk of breast cancer but lower risk of Crohn's disease, showcasing the balancing selection characteristic seen in antagonistic genetic variants.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The rs1047891 variant, located within the CPS1 gene, was previously associated with 266 traits including glycine levels in plasma and eGFR, demonstrating its importance in metabolic pathways.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: Associated with cardiac contractility, this SNP was linked to changes in the mitral valve annular diameter at systole and contributed to the phenotypic variations observed.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: A novel locus associated with mitral valve annular diameter measured in systole, this SNP exhibited genome-wide significance, implicating its role in cardiac function.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: This SNP was associated with an intergenic locus overlapping with open chromatin, contributing to mechanistic pathways relating to cardiac health.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: For SNP rs72777026, the hub gene ADAM17 was identified in astrocytes, suggesting its potential relevance to AD.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The SNP rs4663105 was linked to the gene BIN1, which was prioritized in various cell types, pointing to its potential contribution to AD.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: This SNP was identified as the top variant for sleep problems at genomic risk loci 6 (MEIS1) and had previously been associated with insomnia and restless leg syndrome. Its association indicated a genetic link between sleep disturbances and depression symptoms.
title: Investigating the genetic relationship between depression symptoms and Alzheimer’s Disease in clinically diagnosed and proxy cases

finding: The SNP rs1356334 had significant associations with mean corpuscular volume (p=2 × 10^-36), which may provide insights into hematological changes that coincide with both anxiety symptoms and COVID-19.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs1517006 was associated with red cell distribution width (p=1 × 10^-26), potentially linking blood parameters to anxiety disorders and their severity in COVID-19.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs114266592 showed a significant association with platelet count (p=2 × 10^-15), which may offer a genetic basis for enhanced coagulation risks in patients with anxiety during COVID-19.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs1260326 in GCKR, known for its association with triglyceride levels and non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, plays a significant role in hepatic glucose metabolism and lipogenesis.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs149682241, found between ASNSD1 and SLC40A1, was identified as a novel locus implicated in iron metabolism associated with hemochromatosis.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs982371659 at APOB was linked to liver fat and is significant due to its role in various lipid traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: In the context of eczema, the SNP rs34290285 was fine-mapped with a PIP of 0.99 and linked by cS2G to the immune-inhibitory receptor gene PDCD1, suggesting a biological mechanism in eczema.
title: Combining SNP-to-gene linking strategies to pinpoint disease genes and assess disease omnigenicity

finding: This SNP was noted as rs199988716 in the study and identified for its association with Alzheimer's disease, suggesting new genetic influences.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The variant rs200608168 was also identified as a previously unreported SNP linked to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs201356360 was recognized as a novel variant associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs138478634, a low-frequency variant in the CYP26B1 gene, was proved to be involved in the development of esophageal squamous cell cancer (ESCC).
title: Comprehensive Study of Germline Mutations and Double-Hit Events in Esophageal Squamous Cell Cancer

finding: For the EXOC6B rs61619102 CC genotype, there was a marked decrease in AD risk, indicated by an HR of 0.49 (95% CI: 0.31-0.75, p<0.001). This finding was consistent with the notion that higher frequencies of circulating CD34+CD133+ endothelial progenitor cells contributed to a lower incidence of AD among those with the CC genotype.
title: Circulating Endothelial Progenitor Cells Reduce the Risk of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs149630102-T variant in MSH2 was associated with altered survival based on temozolomide treatment status, showing worse outcomes for treated individuals (HR=1.74, 95% CI: 1.27-2.39, p=0.00052) compared to non-treated individuals.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs12615967-G in MSH2 had a suggestive association with poorer prognosis, indicating a HR of 2.04 (95% CI: 1.22-3.33, p=0.0032) related to a median survival of 11.3 years.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs62139913-A in MSH6 was linked to longer overall survival (HR=0.26, 95% CI: 0.09-0.76, p=0.0046), with A allele carriers achieving a median of 6.5 years.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: rs6739909-G in MSH2 showed suggestive association with poor survival in temozolomide treated patients (HR=3.77, 95% CI: 1.48-9.58, p=0.0054).
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The SNP rs6733839 was identified as one of the 18 SNPs in the BIN1 locus that were significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD), with various studies acknowledging its implications in the risk profile of AD.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs4663105 was among the 18 BIN1 SNPs associated with AD, and it was noted to have a significant effect with a beta estimate of 0.239, showing a strong linkage to increased AD risk.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: This SNP was included in the 18 BIN1 SNPs associated with AD, contributing to the understanding of genetic susceptibility linked to AD.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs744373 was part of the identified BIN1 SNPs associated with AD, reinforcing its role in the genetic architecture of AD susceptibility.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The rs6733839 SNP located at BIN1 was associated with Alzheimer's disease with a P-value of 1.02e-08, emphasizing its involvement in amyloid-related mechanisms.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: Rs200945165 contributed most to the rare variant test statistic (19.24%) for the NR4A2/GPD2 locus and was predicted to be a non-coding deleterious variant within an active transcriptional start site in pancreatic islet tissue. This indicated a regulatory mechanism linked to T2D.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: Rs200622604 was associated with higher fasting insulin (FI) in European ancestry with a significant P value of 6.1×10^-3, reflecting its potential role in T2D pathology.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: Carriers of rs929186279 in the PSD4/PAX8-AS1 locus showed earlier onset of T2D compared to non-carriers, indicating its relevance to T2D susceptibility.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The IL1R1 locus carried SNP rs13427957, which showed a significant association with IgA levels (Beta=0.04, P=6.19×10^-10), highlighting its importance in T-cell responses.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs9808377 was found among multiple variants in the TTN gene, which is associated with cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs3829746 was also reported as a variant in the TTN gene related to cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs2042996 was identified as a variant in the TTN gene with associations to cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs1560221 was included in several variants associated with cardiomyopathies within the TTN gene.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs1001238 was noted as another variant in the TTN gene linked to cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs2042995 was identified in the TTN gene as relevant to cardiomyopathy.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs12693164 was among variants in the TTN gene related to cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs13390491 was included in the variants of the TTN gene relevant to cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs16866465 was associated with the TTN gene and implicated in cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs12693166 was noted as a variant within the TTN gene linked to cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs150785160-G was implicated in a protective role against AD progression, as carriers were identified to have a significantly higher risk of developing AD, with an Odds ratio of 5.7, indicating its relevance in cognitive decline.
title: Rare genetic coding variants associated with age-related episodic memory decline implicate distinct memory pathologies in the hippocampus

finding: The SNP rs13020212 was associated with the expression of PTTG1, a gene involved in tumor proliferation and migration. The study cited a connection between PTTG1 and the more aggressive pathology observed in retroperitoneal liposarcoma (RPLS) patients. Furthermore, patients classified with lower levels of PTTG1 exhibited better overall survival (HR=0.41, P<0.001) and disease-free survival (HR=0.60, P=0.005), linking this SNP's effect to favorable clinical outcomes.
title: Molecular Feature-Based Classification of Retroperitoneal Liposarcoma: A Prospective Cohort Study

finding: The non-synonymous variant rs11676272 in <italic>ADCY3</italic> was a strong predictor of infant BMI, peaking at one year, with implications for energy regulation.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: As a member of the cluster related to sustained effects, rs77165542 was associated with traits linked to ongoing BMI associations.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The non-coding transcript variant rs17407477 was shown to explain a significant association regarding testis transcript expression, further supporting its role in the genetic architecture related to AMH levels.
title: Circulating anti-Müllerian hormone levels in pre-menopausal women: novel genetic insights from a GWAS meta-analysis

finding: The intronic variant rs786244 was associated with skin transcript expression, indicating its contribution to understanding the genetic influences on AMH levels through colocalization analysis.
title: Circulating anti-Müllerian hormone levels in pre-menopausal women: novel genetic insights from a GWAS meta-analysis

finding: This variant was involved in influencing H3K27ac levels in liver tissue and was noted as a high LD variant with significant implications for cALT-associated liver diseases.
title: A trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of unexplained chronic ALT elevation as a proxy for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease with histological and radiological validation

finding: Similar to rs2140773, this variant was also identified as contributing to variations in H3K27ac levels, which could impact gene expression relevant to liver conditions associated with cALT.
title: A trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of unexplained chronic ALT elevation as a proxy for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease with histological and radiological validation

finding: The SNP rs2276683 was identified as the lead cis-eQTL variant associated with the expression of the long noncoding RNA MAP3K2-DT.
title: Whole Genome DNA and RNA Sequencing of Whole Blood Elucidates the Genetic Architecture of Gene Expression Underlying a Wide Range of Diseases

finding: The SNP rs780094 on the GCKR gene was identified as having a significant positive association with Vitamin A and prealbumin levels, suggesting its relevance in the context of pregnancy-related metabolic aspects.
title: Genetic analysis of 104 pregnancy phenotypes in 39,194 Chinese women

finding: The cis-pQTL rs1050785 from the UK Biobank was strongly associated with increased odds of coronary artery disease (CAD) with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.32 (95% CI: 1.16 - 1.50, P = 1.75 × 10^-5). This finding supported the hypothesis that COL6A3-derived endotrophin is responsible for the effect of COL6A3 on CAD.
title: COL6A3-derived endotrophin mediates the effect of obesity on coronary artery disease: an integrative proteogenomics analysis

finding: The lead cis-pQTL of COL6A3, rs11677932 from the deCODE study, was linked to decreased plasma levels of COL6A3-derived endotrophin, correlating with a decreased risk of coronary atherosclerosis (β = -0.05, P = 1.0 × 10^-5) and was associated with significant protective effects against various health outcomes.
title: COL6A3-derived endotrophin mediates the effect of obesity on coronary artery disease: an integrative proteogenomics analysis

finding: The SNP rs6727102 was identified as a cis-regulatory variant for the DPP4 gene, where the alternative allele was found to decrease expression by 3.3-fold. This finding highlighted the substantial genetic effect on gene expression related to COVID-19, demonstrating that genetic regulatory variation could influence the expression of genes involved in the response to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Genetic and non-genetic factors affecting the expression of COVID-19 relevant genes in the large airway epithelium

finding: The variant rs529979470 in B3GNT7 was associated with a higher risk for severe AD cases, indicating its relevance to disease severity.
title: Meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis in 1,094,060 individuals identifies new risk loci, and sub-analysis characterizes the loci with disease severity and onset

finding: The SNP rs2675972 was associated with SCZ through the isoform ENST00000373566 of GIGYF2, where a strong isoQTL signal was detected. The variant exhibited a positive effect on the isoform yet a negative effect on SCZ, suggesting a complex relationship within the neuropsychiatric context.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: The variant rs1663078846, found in intergenic regions on chromosome 2, increased the risk of IPF in females (OR 1.69) while decreasing the risk in males (OR 0.76). This SNP also represented a new finding in the context of sex-specific associations with IPF susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide SNP-sex interaction analysis of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs2113389 was associated with higher tau deposition and faster cognitive decline in Alzheimer's disease (AD) participants. It was found to explain 4.3% of the variation in cortical tau, with the minor T allele linked to increased tau levels. Additionally, it was related to higher expression levels of CYP1B1 and methylation levels, suggesting a significant genetic influence on tau pathology.
title: Novel CYP1B1-RMDN2 Alzheimer’s disease locus identified by genome-wide association analysis of cerebral tau deposition on PET

finding: The SNP rs744373 in BIN1 was found to be associated with greater tau levels in a separate study assessing genetic predictors of Aβ PET measures, indicating its potential role in tau pathology.
title: Novel CYP1B1-RMDN2 Alzheimer’s disease locus identified by genome-wide association analysis of cerebral tau deposition on PET

finding: The SNP rs918804 was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs2113389 and also showed a significant association with tau deposition, thereby supporting the findings related to the CYP1B1-RMDN2 locus.
title: Novel CYP1B1-RMDN2 Alzheimer’s disease locus identified by genome-wide association analysis of cerebral tau deposition on PET

finding: The SNP TMEM163 rs6430538 showed a strong association with influencing levels of alpha-synuclein in cerebrospinal fluid among different genotypes.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: The TCF23-SLC5A6 locus (lead SNP rs1659696) revealed a novel association with vitamin B5, important in cellular metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: At the GCKR locus (lead SNP rs1260333), a novel association with vitamin A was identified.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The GIGYF2 locus (lead SNP rs13424351) found a novel association with barium levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The ZNF713 locus (lead SNP rs72933867) provided evidence for genetic associations with multiple metabolites.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The LOC101928327-DIRC3-AS1 locus (lead SNP rs2162000) was associated with hormone biosynthesis pathways.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs72912115 was associated with TGFA, indicating its involvement as a cis-pQTL.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs2270297 was associated with IL18R1 in Th17 memory cells as a cis-eQTL.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: This SNP was implicated as a cis-eQTL for NLRC4, which mediates the trans-pQTL for IL18.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs13010492 was prioritized as having a mediating role through CTLA4 for CCL19 levels.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The novel rs77136907 variant was identified in the MYO1B;NABP1 locus as African-specific and was newly defined with p=2.74e-08 in relation to POAG risk in a recent cross-ancestry analysis.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs12476634 variant was noted as a novel African-specific association to POAG with significant effect on gene expressions in the context of multi-ancestry GWAS analyses.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs2947411 was discovered as an intergenic lead SNP on chromosome 2 in the Scz intersected with Smk and CanUD subsets. This SNP replicated previous associations with smoking (Smk) and was an eQTL specifically for the gene SH3YL1 in whole blood.
title: Cross-ancestry genetic investigation of schizophrenia, cannabis use disorder, and tobacco smoking

finding: The rs1801701 SNP, associated with the APOB gene, was identified as an independent risk factor for early-onset coronary artery disease (CAD) within a Spanish cohort. This finding suggested a significant relationship between this SNP and the development of CAD, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing the disease, particularly in the context of early onset.
title: Exploring associations between estrogen and gene candidates identified by coronary artery disease genome-wide association studies

finding: This lead CAD risk variant was strongly associated with both CAD and type IIb risk phenotypes, indicating a shared genetic basis for these conditions.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: The SNP rs6542368, found at 2q13, was recognized as a plausible candidate for craniofacial dysmorphism, achieving suggestive significance (p = 1.06×10^-7) in the context of UCL. Its original detection suggests a possible contribution to the risk for this subtype of orofacial clefts.
title: The PAX1 locus at 20p11 is a modifier for bilateral cleft lip only

finding: This intronic variant in GDF7 significantly associated with descending aortic distensibility and served as a strong eQTL for both GDF7 and LDAH in the aorta.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The GCKR variant rs1260326-T was connected to higher blood lipid levels, including very low-density lipoproteins (VLDL) and triglycerides, showing significant metabolic associations with multiple metabolic measures.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: This SNP tagged an eQTL regulating GPD2 expression, where diminished expression was associated with extended lifespan in model organisms, suggesting potential longevity implications in humans.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: Associated with GLS1 expression regulation, reduced GLS1 expression ameliorated age-related issues in animal studies, indicating a possible mechanism for its contribution to human longevity.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The analysis revealed that the SNP rs7574865 was associated with various autoimmune diseases, specifically contributing to the risk of type 1 diabetes in offspring, as part of a broader genetic background involved in autoimmune conditions.
title: Effect of parental autoimmune diseases on type 1 diabetes in offspring can be partially explained by HLA and non-HLA polymorphisms: a nationwide registry and biobank-based study in 7.2M Finns

finding: This SNP was found to causally link to macular degeneration with a significant MR effect size of -0.11 (p=2.0x10^-6) and demonstrated a strong colocalisation probability of 0.81.
title: Efficient candidate drug target discovery through proteogenomics in a Scottish cohort

finding: A significant association was found for rs3087243 (CTLA4) with ME/CFS patients potentially triggered by an acute infection. The power to detect this association reached the target of 80% when the probability of misdiagnosis was low (<0.09). When chance of misdiagnosis exceeded this threshold, the target power could not be maintained.
title: Impact of imperfect diagnosis in ME/CFS association studies

finding: The SNP rs28946889, associated with UGT1A complex, had significant associations with total bilirubin levels (p-value = 5.08E-14) and indirect bilirubin levels (p-value = 1.51E-16). It was previously identified from the BBJ database.
title: A Chinese host genetic study discovered type I interferons and causality of cholesterol levels and WBC counts on COVID-19 severity

finding: SNP rs10201159 showed associations with the odds of missingness of multiple metabolites including N2-acetyl,N6,N6-dimethyllysine and was suggested to influence lysine metabolism, possibly related to mitochondrial function given its proximity to PYROXD2.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs10188058 was identified as being associated with the odds of missingness of N-acetylkynurenine, involved in kynurenine metabolism, which has implications for various metabolic pathways related to kidney function and diseases.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs143080277 in the gene NCK2 showed a strong association with late-onset Alzheimer's disease in the analyses. It had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.0054 and was found to be highly expressed in amyloid-responsive microglial cells, suggesting its role in Alzheimer’s disease pathology and potential regulatory functions in the brain.
SNP rs17269688 showed a discovery-level association in the UKBB data with p-value of 1.52×10^-6, although it was not replicated in IGAP.

The variant rs148950085 (c.21522+3A>G) was noted as a paternally inherited variant adjacent to exon 144 of the 'NEB' gene. It had conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity in ClinVar based on six submissions (four indicated pathogenic and two categorized as of uncertain significance). In-silico predictions suggested that this variant could potentially lead to a loss of donor splice site functionality. Moreover, it was linked to nemaline myopathy when found in trans with another NEB missense or truncating variant, indicating its involvement in disease. Furthermore, although a homozygote was identified in gnomAD, it did not rule out the variant's pathogenicity, particularly because biallelic NEB variants can lead to late-onset diseases.
title: Differential inclusion of NEB exons 143 and 144 provides insight into NEB-related myopathy variant interpretation and disease manifestation

finding: A sQTL that colocalized with waist circumference, this SNP reached a perfect PP4 of 1.00 and had a frequency of 23.5% in 1000 Genomes Africans.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: The rs934734 SNP in the SPRED2 gene was identified to provide increased protection against rheumatoid arthritis with its minor allele.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The rs11676922 SNP in the AFF3 gene was associated with an increased risk of rheumatoid arthritis with the minor allele.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The CTLA4 gene SNP rs11571302 was associated with reduced protection against rheumatoid arthritis when the minor allele was present.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The SNP rs11677932 (GRCh38, chr2:237315312 A/G) was associated with increased aortic expression (G allele), increased plasma levels of COL6A3, and a decreased risk of abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA). This finding was supported by a posterior probability of 0.84 in Bayesian colocalization analysis, indicating a causal relationship between genetic variation and AAA risk.
title: Plasma proteomics reveals the potential causal impact of extracellular matrix proteins on abdominal aortic aneurysm

finding: Similar to rs13109980, the SNP rs4953148, linked to the gene SIX3, was also associated with lifetime smoking, reinforcing the connection between smoking genetics and COPD susceptibility.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: Proximal to the gene BCL11A, the SNP rs5831575 was identified as important in immune dysfunction associated with COPD, marking a potential genetic locus linked to immune response in this context.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: The SNP rs79641866 located in PARD3B was found to be significantly associated with RPD, with a genome-wide significance at p=1.3e-08. This locus presented a novel association unique to RPD.
title: Genetic Distinctions Between Reticular Pseudodrusen and Drusen: Insights from a Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The intergenic variant rs569994581 located near ACVR2A-PABPC1P2 was associated with squamous cell carcinoma development, demonstrating a strong genetic association signal.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Identification of rs182939337 near LOC101927196-LOC105373782 on 2q32.1 was also associated with squamous cell carcinoma.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This variant located in ACTR2 demonstrated consistent direction of genetic effects across all populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Identified in the FinnGen study as a significant variant for IIH with a p-value indicating strong association, showing a risk for both IIH and PAP.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: The SNP rs1260326 was genome-wide significant and associated with multiple traits related to metabolism, including lipids and blood glucose levels, suggesting its relevance to the phenotypes explored in the COVID-19 context.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection identifies multiple novel loci and contrasting etiological roles of irritable bowel syndrome subtypes

finding: The SNP rs1260326 at the GCKR locus was associated with a significant number of proteins in the context of the T2D liver lipid polygenic score (PGS). It explained 256 out of 268 protein associations, indicating a strong pleiotropic effect of this variant on circulating proteins.
title: Identification of plasma proteomic markers underlying polygenic risk of type 2 diabetes and related comorbidities

finding: The rs315952 polymorphism exhibited significant associations with the risk of Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE). Specifically, the T/T genotype and the T allele were linked to an increased likelihood of SLE, indicating that individuals with these genotypes had a higher risk for developing the disease. Conversely, the C/C and C/T genotypes, along with the C allele, were found to have no significant association with SLE risk, suggesting a potential protective effect associated with carrying at least one C allele.
title: “The Association of the IL-1RA (rs315952) Cytokine Gene Polymorphism and Susceptibility to Systemic Lupus Erythematosus: A Meta-analysis”

finding: The SNP rs1420385 showed significant down-regulation of the GAD1 exon expression (ENSE00003699191.1), which was linked to alterations in the GABA system reported in schizophrenia. This association illustrates the SNP's role in the expression levels of genes implicated in psychiatric conditions.
title: Variant-risk-exon interplay impacts on cortical cell-cell interactions in severe psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs7591091, located within the <italic>CCDC141</italic> locus, appeared most frequently in the top lo-siRF-prioritized interactions, suggesting a pivotal role in influencing cardiac hypertrophy through epistatic interactions.
title: Epistasis regulates genetic control of cardiac hypertrophy

finding: The rs1446585 SNP located at the lactase (LCT) locus on chromosome 2 reached genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.3e-17. It was associated with area-level cohort infant mortality rate (IMR) exposure. Notably, the frequency of the lactase-persistence-associated allele (major allele) varied significantly between counties with high and low IMR, especially within the 1940 birth cohort, where it maintained higher frequencies before declining in subsequent years. These changes highlighted the impact of historical environmental factors on genetic selection.
title: GWAS on Birth Year Infant Mortality Rates Provides New Evidence of Recent Natural Selection

finding: The SNP rs11692435 was identified as being significantly associated with the protein ACTR1B, which affected dietary habits related to BMI. It explained more than 60% of the posterior probability of colocalization with dietary intake and protein levels.
title: Genetic control of body weight by the human brain proteome

finding: The SNP rs1018218 was significantly linked with the protein ADCY3, showing a strong correlation with dietary habits. Similar to rs11692435, it also accounted for over 60% of the posterior probability of colocalization with BMI and dietary intake.
title: Genetic control of body weight by the human brain proteome

finding: The SNP rs13010105 was identified in a study that analyzed the TCGA Dataset, revealing that subsites of Laryngeal Squamous Cell Carcinoma exhibited molecular distinctiveness. This finding highlighted the genetic variability within this cancer type, suggesting that different subsites could potentially respond differently to treatments, thereby impacting clinical outcomes.
title: Benchmark Pathology Report Text Corpus with Cancer Type Classification

finding: The SNP rs4664446, located in intron 2 of the CD26/DPP4 gene, showed a strong association with postprandial glycemic excursions (P=1.63×10⁻⁷) in individuals with normal glucose tolerance (NGT). This association indicated that CD26/DPP4 plays a significant role in glycemic regulation following glucose intake.
title: Prediabetes Blunts CD26/DPP4 Genetic Control of Postprandial Glycemia and Insulin Secretion

finding: The SNP rs2300757 was associated with C-peptide release responses during an oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT) (P=6.86×10⁻⁵) in NGT subjects, suggesting that the CD26/DPP4 gene is involved in pancreatic responses to glucose.
title: Prediabetes Blunts CD26/DPP4 Genetic Control of Postprandial Glycemia and Insulin Secretion

finding: The SNP rs2909449 showed a significant association with both glucose (P=1.96×10⁻⁶) and C-peptide AUC during OGTT in NGT individuals. The lower glucose excursions associated with this SNP also correlated with lower C-peptide responses, indicating its role in glucose-insulin dynamics.
