title: Prediabetes Blunts CD26/DPP4 Genetic Control of Postprandial Glycemia and Insulin Secretion

finding: The rs2268890 SNP in intron 18 demonstrated strong nominal association with glucose AUC (P=2.27×10⁻⁶) in NGT individuals, which highlighted the importance of CD26/DPP4 in glucose regulation.
title: Prediabetes Blunts CD26/DPP4 Genetic Control of Postprandial Glycemia and Insulin Secretion

finding: The SNP rs6432708 was significantly associated with glucose excursions in NGT subjects (P=2.87×10⁻⁵), confirming its role in the glycemic response mechanisms governed by the CD26/DPP4 gene.
title: Prediabetes Blunts CD26/DPP4 Genetic Control of Postprandial Glycemia and Insulin Secretion

finding: The SNP rs11558990 was identified as a heterozygous exonic mutation (5144 A>G), resulting in an amino acid change from 254Tyr to Cys in exon 8 of the OLA1 gene. It was associated with poor prognosis in cancer patients, indicating its deleterious nature as highlighted by predictive analyses using PhD-SNP, PhyPhen2, and SIFT. In the context of human heart failure, this mutation was found in patients, suggesting its potential negative impact on cardiac function.
title: Identification and development of Tetra-ARMS PCR-based screening test for a genetic variant of OLA1 (Tyr254Cys) in the human failing heart

finding: The SNP rs1260326 found in GCKR was previously reported and confirmed as associated with daily alcohol intake. In this study, it was implicated alongside the rs671 in predicting alcohol metabolism.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: rs12720820 was identified as a significant driver of the association between total FAw6 levels and 2-hour post glucose in South Asians, marking it as a novel contribution.
title: Genome-wide association and mendelian randomisation study of metabolites and pregnancy dysglycemia in a UK multi-ethnic birth cohort

finding: This SNP, associated with ACOXL, exhibited a p-value of 5.93×10^-18, indicating its potential causal role in ERM as identified during fine-mapping.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: Also associated with the ACOXL locus, this SNP presented a p-value of 1.13×10^-11, reinforcing its biological role in connection to ERM.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: This SNP exhibited significant associations with retinal gene expression changes, particularly in relation to AC073283, indicating relevance to ERM.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: The SNP rs676210 at the APOB locus was associated with NMR traits, revealing variants with different biological effects on lipid levels, highlighting its role in cholesterol transport.
title: Lipoprotein profile and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: Located upstream of the APOB gene, SNP rs138905573 was associated with various NMR traits, indicating its regulatory role in APOB expression and lipid metabolism.
title: Lipoprotein profile and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: This SNP contributed to the super-variant chr2_197, which was linked to the gene DNAH7, implicated in ciliary dysfunction. The hypotheses suggested that disruptions here could lead to respiratory failure, a likely cause of COVID-19 mortality.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: Also within the super-variant chr2_197, this SNP was tied to the gene SLC39A10, which plays crucial roles in immune system regulation. Variants in this gene showed potential impacts on cell survival, affecting the immune response in COVID-19 patients.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: Another contributing SNP that was associated with the super-variant chr17_26, related to genetic risk factors impacting COVID-19 mortality.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: Linked to super-variants influencing COVID-19 outcomes, this SNP displayed patterns that indicated higher risk for males, potentially due to it being an eQTL impacting gene expression related to immune functions.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: This SNP was located in the context of gene DNAH7 within super-variant chr2_197, reinforcing its role in ciliary function and respiratory failure mechanisms in COVID-19 patients.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: Also located in the gene DNAH7 within super-variant chr2_197, this SNP contributed to the understanding of respiratory failure linked to ciliary dysmotility in COVID-19.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: Found within the gene DNAH7, contributing to chr2_197, which connects significantly to respiratory health issues in COVID-19.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: Part of the gene SLC39A10, this SNP was linked to immune dysregulation in COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: This SNP, also within SLC39A10, was tied to the genetic risk assessment in the context of COVID-19 mortality.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: The rs1990760 TT variant in the IFIH1 gene was associated with a significantly lower expression of inflammation-related pathways and better outcomes in critically ill COVID-19 patients. Specifically, patients with this variant exhibited lower concentrations of pro-inflammatory mediators and enhanced anti-inflammatory profiles. Notably, all patients with the TT variant who did not receive steroid treatment survived their ICU stay, whereas those treated with dexamethasone experienced higher hospital mortality.
title: IFIH1 rs1990760 variants, systemic inflammation and outcome in critically-ill COVID-19 patients

finding: The rs2111485 SNP was part of the IFIH1 locus and showed nominally significant local genetic correlation across eosinophil count, lymphocyte count, and T1D, indicating its potential impact on these diseases.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: Similar to rs2111485, rs2075302 also located within the IFIH1 locus confirmed nominal local genetic correlations with the same metrics, supporting its relevancy to T1D and CAD in the context of leukocyte counts.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: The second SNP identified, rs10803744, located in the lncRNA gene MIR3681HG on chromosome 2, showed a significant association with HCV infection (P=7.99×10−8) based on population-based controls. The allele frequencies differed between HCV clearance (MAF=17%) and persistent infection (MAF=13%) individuals, highlighting an odds ratio of 1.42 (P=4.06×10−4) in this context. No exploratory GWAS consistently eliminated the signal for this locus, indicating a robust association with HCV dynamics.
title: Pathogen exposure misclassification can bias association signals in GWAS of infectious diseases when using population-based common controls

finding: The genetic variant rs1878289 was shown to have a dynamic regulatory effect on the expression of the gene NGEF in excitatory neurons. Importantly, this effect increased substantially as these neurons matured, illustrating how neurodevelopmental changes can impact gene regulatory mechanisms.
title: Single-Nucleus Atlas of Cell-Type Specific Genetic Regulation in the Human Brain

finding: Achieved suggestive significance in the replication GWAS at 2q12.1 with p=1.38×10^-6 and OR=3.82.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The lead SNP rs13008848 was associated with spleen iron levels. It was identified near the gene SLC40A1, which encodes the iron transporter ferroportin. This SNP demonstrated a beta of -0.057 and a significance level with p=2.9e-10, suggesting a strong association with iron levels in the spleen.
title: Analysis of MRI-derived spleen iron in the UK Biobank identifies genetic variation linked to iron homeostasis and erythrocyte morphology

finding: The SNP rs34290285 was identified as a causal variant for eosinophil counts and showed a strong colocalization signal at the 2q37.3 locus associated with IDH<sub>mut</sub> non-codeleted gliomas. The variant had a posterior probability (PP<sub>SNP</sub>) of 0.944, linking it to genetic predisposition for this glioma subtype.
title: Genetic predisposition to altered blood cell homeostasis is associated with glioma risk and survival

finding: The rs6435017 variant in SATB2 exhibited lateralized association with lower volume of the posterior insula and left Heschl gyrus, as well as higher volume in the right anterior middle temporal gyrus, highlighting its neuroanatomical implications in dyslexia.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: The SNP rs10191758, linked to ARHGAP15, was identified as part of the 20 loci that shared the same PTSD causal SNP in the LE8-related phenotypes, with a high probability of colocalization.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs197261 was featured in the findings linking PTSD to various cardiovascular disease markers.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs16944 was associated with variations in IL-1β serum concentration and mRNA levels in the context of hyperglycemic normalization of Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) patients. This finding indicated a genetic influence on inflammation that could relate to IL-6 dynamics observed in COVID-19 patients, suggesting that patients' genetic profiles at this locus might affect their inflammatory response and treatment outcomes.
title: Early transfusion of convalescent plasma improves the clinical outcome in severe SARS-CoV2 infection

finding: The SNP rs7574865, associated with the STAT4 SLE risk allele, was linked to increased production of IL-12-induced IFN-γ in T cells from SLE patients. This finding suggested a functional role of this genetic variant in the modulation of immune response in the context of systemic lupus erythematosus.
title: The Lupus Epigenome Relates to Genetics, Transcription and Serological Profiles with Dependency on Molecular Subtypes and Informs Drug Discovery

finding: The rs62175241 SNP was identified as disease-protective for trigger finger (TF) and carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS). It was associated with increased expression of the long non-coding RNA DIRC3 and its downstream effector IGFBP5, specifically in tissue-specific contexts, thereby implicating its role in modulating IGF-1 signaling, which was linked to both diseases.
title: DIRC3-IGFBP5 is a shared genetic risk locus and therapeutic target for carpal tunnel syndrome and trigger finger

finding: The index SNP rs10203066 at the DIRC3 locus was found to be significantly associated with both trigger finger (TF) and carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS). Both studies indicated strong statistical significance, demonstrating the shared genetic underpinning of these conditions, and the analysis confirmed its significant association even after excluding overlapping cases.
title: DIRC3-IGFBP5 is a shared genetic risk locus and therapeutic target for carpal tunnel syndrome and trigger finger

finding: The SNP rs13029479 was identified as a leading variant proximal to the TMEM18 gene, associated with obesity. This SNP contributed to the leading factor for BMI which exhibited significant enrichment for brain cell types.
title: A scalable variational approach to characterize pleiotropic components across thousands of human diseases and complex traits using GWAS summary statistics

finding: Similarly, rs74676797 was another leading variant proximal to TMEM18 associated with obesity, contributing to the same leading factor for BMI characterized by traits including basal metabolic rate and fat mass.
title: A scalable variational approach to characterize pleiotropic components across thousands of human diseases and complex traits using GWAS summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs231779 was associated with increased risk for autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, hypothyroidism, and type 1 diabetes, while it conferred a protective effect against melanoma and keratinocyte cancers, indicating a complex pleiotropic effect where the risk allele for autoimmune conditions reduced cancer risk.
title: Mapping inherited genetic variation with opposite effects on autoimmune disease and cancer identifies candidate drug targets associated with the anti-tumor immune response

finding: This variant was associated with height and is located downstream of IRS1.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Fine-mapped for height only in the UK Biobank, with concerns regarding its validity.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs80306347 was reported as the lead SNP at the LRP1B locus with a Hazard Ratio (HR) of 3.37, indicating a significant association with progression to dementia in PD, showing strong evidence of its role.
title: Association between the LRP1B and APOE loci and the development of Parkinson’s disease dementia

finding: The SNP rs116725215 is also at the LRP1B locus, having demonstrated an independent association with PD dementia progression with a HR of 3.48, linking it to cognitive decline in PD.
title: Association between the LRP1B and APOE loci and the development of Parkinson’s disease dementia

finding: Associated with systolic and diastolic blood pressure in offspring, rs4553827 is located within KCNS3, a gene expressed in the placenta and vital for placental vascular operations.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: Variant rs2070094 was identified with higher frequencies in NG men and is located within the BARD1-binding domain of BRCA1, suggesting a potential protective function that enhances DNA repair mechanisms; it also remains classified as a VUS.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing of Nigerian Prostate Tumors from the Prostate Cancer Transatlantic Consortium (CaPTC) Reveals DNA Repair Genes Associated with African Ancestry

finding: Variant rs41416, located within the EXOC6B gene, was significantly increased in diabetic gastroparesis cases (OR 3.3, p-value < 10^-7), demonstrating its association with diabetes risk.
title: The role of M1 to M2 macrophage polarization in the etiology of idiopathic gastroparesis: GWAS perspective

finding: This SNP was associated with long sleep duration in the EUR population, achieving genome-wide significance with p=3.6×10−8. It was located near the PAX8 gene, which has been linked to various sleep-related phenotypes and prior GWAS.
title: Genome-wide association study investigating short and long sleep duration: a cross-population meta-analysis

finding: This SNP was located in a microglia specific enhancer connected to INPP5D, informing novel insights into Alzheimer's disease through its role in disease mechanisms.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: Located in a microglia enhancer 24kb upstream of BIN1, this SNP was predicted to disrupt KLF4 binding, linking it to Alzheimer's disease risk through altered microglia activation.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: The rs744373 SNP was positively associated with increased tau-PET levels, indicating that carriers of this variant exhibited higher levels of tau pathology. This SNP was implicated in impaired memory performance among patients, emphasizing its relevance in the context of Alzheimer's disease and cognitive decline.
title: Tau-PET and in vivo Braak-staging as a prognostic marker in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Located between FAP and IFIH1, this SNP was associated with immune responses and also noted for its potential link to tumorigenic roles.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: Found near GCKR, associated with metabolic traits that impact cancer risk.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: The rs1427407 SNP at the BCL11A locus was noted for its association with fetal hemoglobin levels in a multi-ancestry analysis. It was the only fine-mapped variant that demonstrated overlap with accessible chromatin across different ancestry groups and illustrated the complex variations contributing to HbF production.
title: Genetic regulation of fetal hemoglobin across global populations

finding: This variant was identified in association with several proteins and was linked to the gene <italic>HIBCH</italic>.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: This variant was reported as associated with protein levels in the context of its involvement with the gene <italic>TP53I3</italic>.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The SNP rs12472359 appeared as a shared locus for RA and COVID-19 hospitalization, highlighting its significance in the gene interaction.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1047891, a nonsynonymous Thr1405Asn substitution in the CPS1 gene, was identified as the most significantly associated variant for glycine levels, with a p-value of 7.8E-1101. It was associated with decreased risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) in a manner consistent with prior research, although this association did not meet genome-wide significance. The finding suggested that protective cardiometabolic properties of glycine might be influenced by this SNP.
title: Effect of Genetic and Dietary Perturbation of Glycine Metabolism on Atherosclerosis in Humans and Mice

finding: The synonymous SNV on RAB10 was significantly replicated in the Cox regression with concordant direction of effect, underscoring its potential association with Alzheimer's disease.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This SNP interacted significantly with IL37 expression, showing a main effect beta of -0.77 and an interaction effect that nearly doubled in inflamed skin, suggesting implications for inflammatory pathways in psoriasis.
title: Immunosuppression causes dynamic changes in expression QTLs in psoriatic skin

finding: The SNP rs1067327 was identified as a significant genetic variant affecting response to OSU6162 treatment in individuals with alcohol dependence (AD). Specifically, a negative correlation was observed between anxiety factor PRS (which included rs1067327) and several drinking outcomes among OSU6162-treated individuals. This included the number of drinks consumed, percentage of heavy drinking days, and changes in blood phosphatidylethanol (PEth) levels, indicating that individuals with a higher genetic predisposition to anxiety drank less when treated with OSU6162. These findings were not present in the placebo group, emphasizing the SNP's relevance in predicting treatment outcomes for AD patients.
title: Genetic liability for anxiety associates with treatment response to the monoamine stabilizer OSU6162 in alcohol dependence

finding: The SNP rs1427407 was associated with increased production of fetal hemoglobin (HbF), accounting for 20% of variation in HbF levels. This association contributed to protection from clinical malaria but also resulted in increased gametocyte prevalence, thereby enhancing parasite transmissibility.
title: Fetal hemoglobin enables malaria parasite growth in sickle cells but augments production of transmission stage parasites

finding: The SNP rs1374204 was identified as an outlier in the context of schizophrenia analyses, where it influenced estimates slightly. The odds ratio for schizophrenia changed to 0.84 post-removal of this outlier, suggesting it had a significant impact on the results.
title: Mendelian randomization study of birth weight and risk of psychiatric disorders later in life

finding: The rs838717 SNP, an intronic variant in DGKD predicted to be a transcription factor binding site, was associated with a 4.30 odds ratio for increased kidney stone disease risk per 1 standard deviation increase in serum calcium. This was linked to reduced calcium-sensing receptor (CaSR) signal transduction.
title: Genetic variants predisposing to increased risk of kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs7564805 was associated with SAG, which is known for its role in Oguchi disease, showing significant variation in PRC thickness impact across different retinal fields.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs869016 was linked to MERTK which plays a role in the phagocytosis of OS and is associated with retinal dystrophies, significantly affecting OS thickness.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs201030469 linked to TNS1 demonstrated effects on both PRC thickness and breast cancer diagnosis, illustrating unexpected associations between retinal and cancer phenotypes.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs17183814 was identified as a missense variant in the gene SCN2A. It had a CADD score of 20 and was classified as benign for seizures and developmental and epileptic encephalopathy according to ClinVar, indicating its potential relevance in bipolar disorder (BD) and related phenotypes.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: The rs1518395 variant was associated with schizophrenia and major depression disorder (MDD), showing shared genetic influences particularly in the default mode network in fMRI.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The rs2947349 variant in the 2p16.1 region was associated with epilepsy and demonstrated significant associations with the default mode network.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The SNP rs2542580, which was associated with ERLEC1, was genetically predicted to be linked to an increased risk of haemorrhoidal disease (HEM) with a statistical significance of p=5.18e-07. It also demonstrated a high level of colocalization with HEM, confirming its potential role as a causal variant.
title: Research Letter: Therapeutic targets for haemorrhoidal disease: proteome-wide Mendelian randomisation and colocalization analyses

finding: The SNP rs3732218, associated with the UGT1A* gene, was identified in this study as a variant influencing both clozapine and norclozapine plasma concentrations, thus confirming its previously established links to clozapine metabolism in the context of diverse ancestries.
title: Pharmacokinetics and pharmacogenomics of clozapine in an ancestrally diverse sample: A longitudinal analysis and GWAS using clinical monitoring data from the UK

finding: The missense variant rs1260326 at the GCKR locus was found to be associated with 11 traits, further establishing its role in influencing various phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide study on 72,298 Korean individuals in Korean biobank data for 76 traits identifies hundreds of novel loci

finding: The rs744373 SNP was positively associated with increased tau-PET levels and impaired memory, establishing a link between genetic variation and cognitive decline related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Cell-type-specific Alzheimer’s disease polygenic risk scores are associated with distinct disease processes in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs60473748 was associated with the presence of a GCC expansion in the promoter of the AFF3 gene. This association was significant, with a peak p-value of 7.9x10^-11 for obtaining a university degree, suggesting a strong link between the SNP and educational attainment. Additionally, the analysis indicated that the effect of the TRE at the AFF3 locus was independent of the local SNVs, further supporting its role in neurodevelopment and cognitive traits.
title: A phenome-wide association study of methylated GC-rich repeats identifies a GCC repeat expansion in AFF3 as a significant cause of intellectual disability

finding: The variant rs72846742 was linked to the AA %LAA950 NetSHy2 phenotype. It was noted to be previously associated with smoking intensity and shown to act as an eQTL for MGAT5, a gene implicated in cancer, adding context to its involvement in COPD.
title: Proteomic Networks and Related Genetic Variants Associated with Smoking and Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

finding: The SNP rs61030588 was identified as novel and associated with PCOS in the meta-analysis. It was positioned within the gene MSH6, which is known for its role in DNA repair, and was significantly expressed in multiple tissues, including the thyroid and ovaries. This established a connection between this locus, menopause age, and ovarian aging.
title: Understanding and Predicting Polycystic Ovary Syndrome through Shared Genetic Architecture with Testosterone, SHBG, and Inflammatory Markers

finding: The variant rs1606803 at locus 2p11.2 was associated with ease of getting up and shared genetic influence with regional brain volume, specifically the brain stem.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The variant rs62158206 at locus 2q14.1 was related to sleep duration and showed associations with resting functional connectivity.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: This SNP was part of a locus identified with strong evidence prioritizing IL18R1 and IL18RAP as causal genes, with significant colocalization noted in whole blood.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: This SNP was analyzed alongside rs6419573 and supported the prioritization of both IL18R1 and IL18RAP as candidate genes at the locus.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: Associated with insomnia in the 2q14.1 region, rs62158170 colocalized with functional connectivity between the auditory and posterior multimodal networks during resting fMRI.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: Colocalized with insomnia, rs56093896 was associated with functional connectivity between the auditory and posterior multimodal networks in resting fMRI.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The SNP rs2678897 in 2p16.1 was linked to psychological traits such as neuroticism and subjective well-being, showing correlations with default mode network activity.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: In the male-only analysis, rs17757829 was found to be genome-wide significant with a p-value of 1.02×10−8 on chromosome 2. This locus represented a genetic risk factor for borderline personality disorder (BPD) that was not significant in the main analysis.
title: Genome-wide association study of borderline personality disorder identifies six loci and highlights shared risk with mental and somatic disorders

finding: The rs6733839 SNP was also identified in the multi-trait analysis, being significantly associated with delirium with an odds ratio of 1.015 [1.012 - 1.018] and a p-value of 7×10^-25.
title: Dissecting the genetic and proteomic risk factors for delirium

finding: The variant rs11889341 was consistently associated with higher risks for both rheumatoid arthritis and hypothyroidism, supporting overlapping disease mechanisms.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: The SNP rs1047891, located in CPS1, was identified with a P-value of 8.6×10^-21 and showed a protective effect for MacTel, particularly in females, with a significant interaction noted (P<sub>interaction</sub>=1.06×10^-4). The minor allele reduced CPS1 binding affinity and dysregulated urea cycle metabolism.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: This novel SNP at locus 2p14 was associated with MacTel (P=5.9×10^-9) and located within the alanine/glycine/serine transporter gene SLC1A4.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The rs4663105 variant at the <italic>BIN1</italic> locus was associated with increased risk of AD<sup>+</sup>LB<sup>−</sup> (OR = 1.40, P = 6.5 × 10<sup>-10</sup>) and AD<sup>+</sup>LB<sup>+</sup> compared to AD<sup>−</sup>LB<sup>−</sup> (OR = 1.53, P = 1.4 × 10<sup>-10</sup>). There was no significant association found with AD<sup>−</sup>LB<sup>+</sup> or AD<sup>+</sup>LB<sup>+</sup> in comparison to AD<sup>+</sup>LB<sup>−</sup>.
title: APOE-ε4 and BIN1 increase risk of Alzheimer’s disease pathology but not specifically of Lewy body pathology

finding: The GCKR variant rs1260326 was highlighted as a highly pleiotropic locus tied to diverse metabolites, including pyruvate, showcasing the complexity of metabolic regulation.
title: Mendelian randomisation with proxy exposures: challenges and opportunities

finding: The SNP rs6544366 in the APOB locus was significant in the stringent filtering setting for TC response to statins, with a beta of -0.069 and a p-value of 3.22e-09.
title: Leveraging large-scale biobank EHRs to enhance pharmacogenetics of cardiometabolic disease medications

finding: The SNP rs11893824, related to the gene LIMS2, was recognized as a novel genetic variant associated with sVEGFR2 levels. This association underscored that higher levels of sVEGFR2 predicted through this SNP were linked to a lower risk of MP, consistent with an OR of 0.86.
title: Genetic Evidence for Soluble VEGFR2 as a Protective Factor Against Macular Pucker

finding: Positioned 2KB upstream of VAMP5, this SNP was identified as a cis-miR-eQTL for miR-6701 and associated with ischemic heart disease-related conditions.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: The SNP rs3749034, located in the promoter region of GAD1, was associated with the expression of long and short isoforms of GAD1 in the hippocampus, linking it to both schizophrenia (SZ) and autism spectrum disorder (ASD) risk.
title: Long-read sequencing reveals the RNA isoform repertoire of neuropsychiatric risk genes in human brain

finding: The SNP rs16840252 correlated with the gene CTLA4 in naïve CD4+ T cells, indicating its significance in immune regulation related to lupus.
title: Hypomethylation of miR-17-92 cluster in lupus T cells and no significant role for genetic factors in the lupus-associated DNA methylation signature

finding: The SNP rs4553808 was also related to the gene CTLA4, highlighting its impact on the immune response in naïve CD4+ T cells associated with lupus.
title: Hypomethylation of miR-17-92 cluster in lupus T cells and no significant role for genetic factors in the lupus-associated DNA methylation signature

finding: The SNP rs17362588, located within the CCDC141 gene, was found to be significantly associated with pulse rate and maximum heart rate in Europeans. This variant had previously been linked to several cardiovascular traits, including pulse pressure and heart rate response post-exercise, marking it as an important genetic factor in cardiovascular physiology.
title: Distinct Genetic Loci and Variations in Blood Pressure and Pulse Rate in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank

finding: This intronic variant in ZNF804A was identified as novel and was associated with AUD, being close to variants related to a broad psychosis trait and heroin addiction.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: Identified as an EA-specific novel variant near COBLL1 and associated with AUDIT-C, it has links to Type 2 diabetes as well.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: This variant in GCKR was associated with AUD, having both direct and indirect effect sizes.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: This novel variant was identified in relation to cardiovascular traits within the AFR population.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: The SNP rs887829 was significant in the UGT1A locus for European ancestry individuals with a p-value of 2.2 × 10<sup>−8</sup>. It was identified as a cis-pQTL for a protein encoded by UGT1A1.
title: Characterizing common and rare variations in non-traditional glycemic biomarkers using multivariate approaches on multi-ancestry ARIC study

finding: For SNP rs114780578, categorized under splice region variants, the odds ratio was reported at 1.44, indicating its association with increased risk of hyperlipidaemia and contributing to the risk signal in ABCG5.
title: Weighted burden analysis of rare coding variants in 470,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subject characterises effects on hyperlipidaemia risk

finding: SNP rs370895243, also within the splice region category for ABCG5, showed an odds ratio (OR) of 1.44, suggesting a significant association with hyperlipidaemia risk.
title: Weighted burden analysis of rare coding variants in 470,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subject characterises effects on hyperlipidaemia risk

finding: The SNP rs201469377 demonstrated an odds ratio of 1.44 within the splice region variants for ABCG5, indicating its association with increased hyperlipidaemia risk.
title: Weighted burden analysis of rare coding variants in 470,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subject characterises effects on hyperlipidaemia risk

finding: The SNP rs140374206 showed an odds ratio (OR) of 1.05 in the protein altering category. Despite its presence being equivalent in controls and cases, it was previously associated with increased non-HDL cholesterol levels.
title: Weighted burden analysis of rare coding variants in 470,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subject characterises effects on hyperlipidaemia risk

finding: The rs5742904 variant in APOB was identified as a founder pathogenic mutation for familial hypercholesterolemia, with significantly higher allele frequencies among Old Order Amish individuals. This finding explained an increased risk for coronary artery atherosclerosis in this population.
title: Decoding Genetics, Ancestry, and Geospatial Context for Precision Health

finding: At the TMEM18 locus, rs7579427 was associated with childhood obesity through its contact with promoter regions of multiple effector genes.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: Similarly, rs62104180 at the TMEM18 locus was implicated in childhood obesity by consistently contacting genes involved in metabolic regulation across various cell types.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: The lead variant rs4077678 at the ADCY3 locus was linked to childhood obesity and showed extensive mapping to effector gene ADCY3 across numerous cell types including metabolic and immune cells.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: At the TMEM18 locus, rs35796073 was noted to colocalize with the ALKAL2 gene expression, implicating it in obesity-related pathways across various immune cell types.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: This SNP also at the TMEM18 locus showed high probability of colocalization with ALKAL2 expression in adipose tissue exemplifying its role in obesity.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: This SNP found at the TMEM18 locus was involved in contacting genes implicated in metabolism, reinforcing its role in childhood obesity.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: SNP rs73978419 near GRB14 showed a genome-wide significant association in Hispanic individuals with a P-value of 1.3×10^-8 and an OR of 0.44.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis of 56,241 individuals identifies LRRC4C, LHX5-AS1 and nominates ancestry-specific loci PTPRK, GRB14, and KIAA0825 as novel risk loci for Alzheimer’s disease: the Alzheimer’s Disease Genetics Consortium

finding: The SNP rs34532804 at the GREB1 locus (2p25.1) was significant at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 6.55x10^-4, associated with endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs16831319, associated with COL5A2 which encodes type V collagen, exhibited links to connective tissue structure relevant to HEM and was associated with Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, highlighting its possible contributions to HEM.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 944,133 individuals provides insights into the etiology of hemorrhoidal disease

finding: SNP rs955658 was one of the lead SNPs associated with PTSD risk, identified as having a CADD score above 12.37, indicating possible deleteriousness. It was involved in a functional analysis showing it was linked with trauma-related traits.
title: The genetic relationships between post-traumatic stress disorder and its corresponding neural circuit structures

finding: The SNP rs668948 colocalized with the CpG cg05337441 (APOB), which is associated with coronary artery disease. This colocalization explained 41% of the observed PPFC, suggesting a significant relationship between DNA methylation at this site and coronary artery disease risk.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: The SNP rs7605824, located in close proximity to the FAM150B gene, was identified as having the strongest signal associated with accelerated eye fundus aging, with a minimum p-value of 2.4Ã—10^-180, indicating a significant genetic influence on eye aging.
title: Deep learning of fundus and optical coherence tomography images enables identification of diverse genetic and environmental factors associated with eye aging

finding: The SNP rs55742348 was associated with OCT aging and was located nearest to the SH3YL1 gene, with a p-value of 3Ã—10^-13, suggesting a genetic component in the mechanisms of eye aging.
title: Deep learning of fundus and optical coherence tomography images enables identification of diverse genetic and environmental factors associated with eye aging

finding: Previously documented in the GWAS catalogue, this SNP is associated with CYP1B1 and was linked to carcinogenesis. It showed significant association in the context of GrimAge DNAm pack years in the study.
title: Blood- and brain-based genome-wide association studies of smoking

finding: This SNP was not previously annotated in the GWAS Catalog and is mapped to RMDN2:RMDN2-AS1. The long non-coding RNA has been studied concerning eosinophil counts and melanoma, suggesting a potential role in responding to smoking-related health issues.
title: Blood- and brain-based genome-wide association studies of smoking

finding: The SNP rs62182100 was an intronic variant within the HDAC4 gene, which had been identified as a genome-wide significant finding in a prior small-scale GWAS of reaction time variability (RTV). This gene is associated with transcriptional regulation and has been implicated in synaptic plasticity, learning, and memory.
title: Genome-wide association study in 404,302 individuals identifies 7 significant loci for reaction time variability

finding: The SNP rs142556838 was linked as a lead variant in a GWAS for diastolic blood pressure and showed associations with pulse rate and ECG measures. It is an intron variant of CCDC141 and overlaps a DNAse hypersensitivity peak, suggesting regulatory activity in cardiac tissues. Its MAF (minor allele frequency) was reported at 0.09.
title: Unsupervised cardiac MRI phenotyping with 3D diffusion autoencoders reveals novel genetic insights

finding: The SNP rs6544713, located in the ABCG8 gene, was identified as associated with coronary atherosclerosis in the combined approach of the study. It had been previously reported to be associated with the risk of coronary artery disease, confirming its relevance across different methodologies.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The nonsynonymous variant p.F4C in AP1S3, associated with Psoriasis 15 (OMIM number 616106), was annotated as likely pathogenic. Functionally validated studies showed decreased activity of the mutant protein, indicating its significance in the pathology of the disease.
title: Genetic landscape of rare autoinflammatory disease variants in Qatar and Middle Eastern populations through the integration of whole-genome and exome datasets

finding: The SNP rs2302615 in the ODC1 gene was significantly associated with gastric cancer (OR = 1.36; p = 0.018) in a model adjusted for age, sex, and CagA serostatus, highlighting its role as a risk modifier and its potential impact on chemoprevention strategies with DFMO.
title: Ornithine Decarboxylase (ODC1) gene variant (rs2302615) is associated with gastric cancer independently of Helicobacter pylori CagA serostatus

finding: The SNP rs1056836 in the CYP1B1 gene was found to be associated with gastric cancer (OR = 0.77; p = 0.008) in the context of CagA positivity.
title: Ornithine Decarboxylase (ODC1) gene variant (rs2302615) is associated with gastric cancer independently of Helicobacter pylori CagA serostatus

finding: The SNP rs1800440 in the CYP1B1 gene showed an association with gastric cancer (p = 0.011) within the studied population.
title: Ornithine Decarboxylase (ODC1) gene variant (rs2302615) is associated with gastric cancer independently of Helicobacter pylori CagA serostatus

finding: The SNP rs1402906 on chromosome 2 was significantly associated with cognitive preservation, particularly through its role in regulating the transcription factors POU3F2 and POU1F1a, which in turn impacted the expression of the genes LRRTM4 and CTNNA2. This SNP demonstrated a high linkage score (HLOD = 4.87) and was noted to have a T allele frequency of 12% within the Amish population, linked to cognitive preservation particularly in cognitively unimpaired individuals. Additionally, the presence of the T allele was associated with specific genetic effects, including decreased CTNNA2 expression and potential connections to autism spectrum disorder, highlighting its relevance in cognitive health.
title: Genetic analysis of cognitive preservation in the midwestern Amish reveals a novel locus on chromosome 2

finding: The distal OCR containing the SNP rs62183854 showed significant co-accessibility with promoter OCRs for the genes DLX1 and DLX2. Both of these transcription factors are crucial for the development of GABAergic neurons, further supporting the involvement of this SNP in schizophrenia-related genetic risk.
title: Genetic implication of prenatal GABAergic and cholinergic neuron development in susceptibility to schizophrenia

finding: The NPNT-increasing rs1662979-G allele was shown to increase the risk of COVID-19 severity while simultaneously improving lung function metrics such as the FEV1/FVC ratio and lowering the risk of COPD. This paradoxical finding was interpreted as indicative of different underlying mechanisms influencing COVID-19 severity.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian randomization implicates nephronectin as an actionable mediator of the effect of obesity on COVID-19 severity

finding: The SNP rs755857714, resulting in a p.Arg1339His mutation in GREB1, was significantly associated with female infertility, with a P-value of 4×10^-9.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs62148876 was associated with SCQ stereotyped with a p-value of 4 × 10^-7 and is found in an intron of LTBP1, a gene linked to depression and Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The variant rs12475068, located within the UGT1A locus, was associated with substantial impacts on the glucuronidation process of vitamin D metabolites, highlighting an important role in maintaining vitamin D homeostasis.
title: Improved characterization of gene-environment interactions for vitamin D through variance quantitative trait loci

finding: This SNP was associated with smoking initiation, demonstrating a significant genome-wide association with a p-value of 1x10^-18. This finding indicates that variants at this locus may influence the age at which individuals begin smoking, linking it to brain structure and function.
title: Brain-wide pleiotropy investigation of alcohol drinking and tobacco smoking behaviors

finding: This SNP was connected to educational attainment with a genome-wide significance level of p=2x10^-14. The association suggests that genetic factors influencing education may also relate to cognitive abilities and potentially smoking behaviors.
title: Brain-wide pleiotropy investigation of alcohol drinking and tobacco smoking behaviors

finding: This variant was significantly associated with chronotype, with a reported p-value of 5x10^-14. The finding implies a relationship between genetic factors affecting sleep patterns and behaviors such as smoking.
title: Brain-wide pleiotropy investigation of alcohol drinking and tobacco smoking behaviors

finding: This SNP was linked to self-reported math ability with a significance of p=1x10^-10, indicating that cognitive skills may partly be influenced by genetic variations that also affect smoking behaviors.
title: Brain-wide pleiotropy investigation of alcohol drinking and tobacco smoking behaviors

finding: This SNP had a significant association with cognitive performance, showing a p-value of 1x10^-8. This suggests that cognitive function could be related to the genetic predisposition towards smoking.
title: Brain-wide pleiotropy investigation of alcohol drinking and tobacco smoking behaviors

finding: This SNP was associated with cortical thickness, presenting a p-value of 3x10^-8. This indicates that variations in brain structure linked to cognitive processing might influence tobacco and alcohol consumption behaviors.
title: Brain-wide pleiotropy investigation of alcohol drinking and tobacco smoking behaviors

finding: The SNP rs72813410 was significantly associated with the female PTS factor 1 (PTS-f1) with a beta of -0.08 and a p-value of 1.94×10^-8. This SNP was positionally mapped to an intronic region of the WDPCP gene, which had previous associations with smoking initiation and the age of first sexual intercourse.
title: Sex-stratified genomic structural equation models of posttraumatic stress inform PTSD etiology

finding: The T allele of rs1530578 was associated with elevated TMB in ovarian cancer and reduced expression of the GLI2 gene across tissues.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The SNP rs17183814 was determined to influence splicing of the SCN2A gene, affecting its function as a sodium channel subunit. This variant had previous associations with autism spectrum disorder and epilepsy, highlighting its relevance in neurological disorders.
title: Cross-ancestry, cell-type-informed atlas of gene, isoform, and splicing regulation in the developing human brain

finding: The novel variant rs138707495, located in the 3' UTR of GDF7, was noted for its association with increased risk of HPC, with an OR of 3.06 (95% CI: 2.07, 4.53; p=2.33×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The SNP rs12616502 was significantly associated (p=3.14 × 10⁻⁸, OR=1.70) with pernicious anemia and was found in high linkage disequilibrium with variants in CCDC104 and PNPT1, which have been linked to autoimmune disorders such as vitiligo and hypothyroidism.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies five risk loci for pernicious anemia and implicates the role of HLA-DR15 haplotype

finding: The SNP rs1014444 was positively associated with cheese consumption and also positively correlated with cognitive performance (p=1.26×10−9), intelligence (p=5.45×10−12), and years of schooling (p=1.80×10−12). Additionally, it was linked to resting-state functional MRI connectivity (p=1.48×10−11), suggesting its role in enhancing cognitive functions.
title: Integration of Mendelian Randomization and Genome-wide Association Analysis Reveals Potential Benefits of Cheese Intake on Human Intelligence

finding: The SNP rs1260326 was associated with higher PXS-T2D scores, indicating a causal role in increasing the risk of T2D. This missense variant, which maps to the GCKR gene, showed a beta of 0.01 and was previously linked to T2D in GWAS (OR = 1.1). It also correlated with clinical risk factors like total cholesterol and fasting glucose levels, revealing its importance in metabolic regulation.
title: Assessing the genetic contribution of cumulative behavioral factors associated with longitudinal type 2 diabetes risk highlights adiposity and the brain-metabolic axis

finding: This SNP mapped to the SH3BP4 gene was recognized for its interaction with the pathogenic APOE SNP (rs429358), indicating a potential protective mechanism against AD.
title: Novel Alzheimer’s disease genes and epistasis identified using machine learning GWAS platform

finding: The rs180177180 (G>A) SNP was associated with a significantly higher allele frequency in the patient population (29.2%) when compared to the controls (5.9%). This finding suggested a strong association with the risk of nephrolithiasis, as indicated by the elevated presence of the A allele suggesting increased propensity for stone formation.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing (WES) identifies Homozygous mutation in g.37429732G>A in GRHPR gene is responsible for early onset of nephrolithiasis in the population of West Bengal, India

finding: The SNP rs1260326 was indicated as a causal variant affecting retinol levels through the gene GCKR. This missense allele was associated with retinol increase by substituting leucine for proline, and had strong metabolic associations.
title: Genetic influences on circulating retinol and its relationship to human health

finding: SNP rs6432708 was identified as an intronic variant in DPP4 and showed significant associations across all four substance use traits analyzed in the MTAG study.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs1260326, an exonic variant in GCKR, was confirmed in the context of its association with alcohol use disorder (AUD) in previous studies.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs1366839 was found to have significant associations with substance use traits and was recognized within the context of ZNF804A.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs4675308, an intergenic variant near WDR12, was identified for its significance in smoking initiation (SMK).
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The MCM6 locus variant rs4988235 was shown to be associated with pentadecanoic acid, a metabolite highly correlated with myristic acid, indicating specific genetic effects despite the correlation.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: Variant rs9288513 in the PECR gene was associated with a 'putative novel oxylipin' and was one of the five loci explaining 5.0% of the trait variance for this new metabolite.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: The SNP rs11677238 was found to be nominally significant for SSRI/SNRI non-response and mapped to genes including RABL2A. Its nominal significance indicates a possible role in understanding variability in treatment response in depression.
title: Genome-wide meta-analyses of non-response to antidepressants identify novel loci and potential drugs

finding: This SNP was situated in a TSS flanking region of PAX8, expressing significant regulatory functions in cervical cancer context.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: The nearby SNP rs10195252 in GRB14 was found to be associated with waist-to-hip ratio (WHR), triglyceride (TG) levels, high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) at genome-wide levels of significance.
title: Identification of Genetic Loci Simultaneously Associated with Multiple Cardiometabolic Traits

finding: The SNP rs114954125 was associated with hypertensive disorders of pregnancy (HDP) as a novel finding near the gene LRP1B. It exhibited a significant odds ratio of 3.03 (95% CI: 2.05, 4.49; P=3.19×10^-8). Although not validated in the UK Biobank, it was crucial in highlighting the genetic contributions near LRP1B concerning HDP.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel candidate loci in the RARB gene associated with hypertensive disorders of pregnancy

finding: Significant association with IgAN was found for this SNP under the recessive model (P<sub>BONF</sub> = 1.545 × 10<sup>−9</sup>), indicating its relevance in disease pathology.
title: Candidate genes for IgA nephropathy in pediatric patients: exome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs115843863 showed association with clozapine-induced HDL changes (p = 2.05e-08, FDR = 0.0287) and was located near the UPP2 gene.
title: Pharmacogenetic Study of Antipsychotic-Induced Lipid and BMI Changes in Chinese Schizophrenia Patients: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The missense variant rs78446341 (Pro1247Leu in LY75) was associated with a reduced risk of DNMT3A-CHIP (OR = 0.78; P = 3.70 x 10^-10), indicating its contribution to lowering CHIP risk.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs13020252 was associated with the novel immunomarker WT1, which showed significant expression differences between dermatofibroma (DF) and dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans (DFSP). This finding contributed to the understanding of histological features relevant for the diagnosis of these mesenchymal spindle cell lesions, as reported in a study encompassing 114 cases.
title: Immunohistochemical profiles of dermatofibroma and dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans: A scoping review

finding: The SNP rs115697725[G] located in the <italic>KLHL29</italic> locus co-localized with traits related to red blood cell morphology, such as mean corpuscular volume and mean hemoglobin levels.
title: Analysis of MRI-derived spleen iron in the UK Biobank identifies genetic variation linked to iron recycling and erythrocyte morphology

finding: At the G6PC2 locus, rs2232326 was identified as a rare variant (MAF=0.01) showing significant association with fasting glucose (FG) after conditioning on common variants rs560887 and rs540524. The variant was annotated as disruptive and likely damaging. It had a glucose-lowering effect and was found to be weakly transcribed in islets.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The common variant rs560887 was established as a primary signal at the G6PC2 locus, associated with fasting glucose (FG). It contributed to glucose-raising effects when combined with other variants.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: At the G6PC2 locus, rs540524 was identified as a secondary signal associated with fasting glucose (FG). It was linked in moderate linkage (r2=0.58) with rs492594 and also had a glucose-raising effect.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: Located at the G6PC2 locus, rs2232323 was identified as a rare variant contributing to significant associations with fasting glucose (FG). It had a glucose-lowering effect in haplotype analyses.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: Another rare variant at G6PC2, rs138726309, contributed to significant associations with fasting glucose (FG), being part of haplotypes that indicated glucose-lowering effects.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: At the G6PC2 locus, rs492594 was mentioned as part of significant associations for fasting glucose (FG), particularly noted for its linkage with rs540524.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The SNP rs67492154 was identified as a single variant contributing to the colocalization of TFPI protein levels and the all-stroke genetic association, with a posterior probability greater than 80% for colocalization.
title: Genetically predicted levels of the human plasma proteome and risk of stroke: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with progression to H&Y stage 3 or greater, located in the XPO1 gene.
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and motor progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs1861412 showed an association with body mass index (BMI), reaffirming its potential role in influencing metabolic traits.
title: Exploiting collider bias to apply two-sample summary data Mendelian randomization methods to one-sample individual level data

finding: The SNP rs11694915, located within the IL1R1 gene, was identified as a novel genome-wide significant locus associated with PMR susceptibility, underscoring its relevance in the disease pathology.
title: Modifiable risk factors and inflammation-related proteins in polymyalgia rheumatica: genome-wide meta-analysis and Mendelian randomisation

finding: This eQTL variant was associated with pulmonary system functioning and thus highlighted as clinically relevant.
title: Global patterns of genetic variation and association with clinical phenotypes at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: This variant showed significant associations, specifically with respiratory conditions in the African population.
title: Global patterns of genetic variation and association with clinical phenotypes at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: It was significantly associated with systemic diseases including a notable association with malignant neoplasm.
title: Global patterns of genetic variation and association with clinical phenotypes at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: This variant exhibited significant associations with various diseases, including respiratory infections.
title: Global patterns of genetic variation and association with clinical phenotypes at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: Demonstrated high iHS scores indicating a strong selection signal in specific populations.
title: Global patterns of genetic variation and association with clinical phenotypes at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The SNP rs4988235, located in the MCM6 gene, was robustly associated with genetically predicted milk intake. In the meta-analysis of 99,152 participants, this SNP was linked to an inverse association with the risk of colorectal cancer (RR per 200 g/day = 0.60, 95% CI 0.46-0.74), colon cancer (RR per 200 g/day = 0.60, 95% CI 0.43-0.77), and rectal cancer (RR per 200 g/day = 0.49, 95% CI 0.31-0.67). This finding indicated a protective role of dairy milk intake, primarily attributed to calcium.
title: Diet-wide analyses for risk of colorectal cancer: prospective study of 12,250 incident cases among 543,000 women in the UK

finding: The SNP rs2972144, linked to the IRS1 locus, was one of the seven shared SNPs found between type 2 diabetes and self-reported depression.
title: Bi-directional Mendelian randomization and multi-phenotype GWAS show causality and shared pathophysiology between depression and type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs4852714 was implicated in the expression of CD207, a gene expressed in skin-resident dendritic cells, suggesting a direct role in the pathophysiology of atopic dermatitis based on its impact on immune cell function in the skin.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Identifies Novel Loci in Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The SP140 gene variant rs73104290 was reported to be 4824 times more frequent in UKB-AFR (0.07) compared to 1.46 x 10<sup>-5</sup> in UKB-EUR (p = 8.6 x 10<sup>-188</sup>), suggesting a significant population-specific variant.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The lead variant rs114686503 associated with Glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c) showed an impressive frequency difference, being 425.91 times more common in UKB-AFR than UKB-EUR (GWAS p-value = 6.43 x 10<sup>-12</sup>), denoting a key population distinction.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: Variant rs75763409, related to HbA1c, indicated a frequency 438.5 times greater in UKB-AFR, further validating the population-specific focus of this research.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The variant rs7557333 was similarly identified in connection to HbA1c and was found to be 438.39 times more frequent in UKB-AFR, highlighting its relevancy in genetic epidemiology.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: With respect to HbA1c, rs115457386 was also found significantly more frequent in UKB-AFR (426.57 times), underscoring its contribution to population-based trait studies.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The SNP rs1404610, located near GLI2, was noted to have a HR of 3.74 with a p-value of 5.4 x 10^-10, indicating its association with conversion from active surveillance in the study.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Prostate Cancer Conversion from Active Surveillance to Treatment

finding: The SNP rs34799259 was found in locus 5 associated with the ARHGAP15 gene. This SNP was distinct in the European ancestry analysis but suggested significance in the multi-ancestry analysis.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Traumatic Brain Injury in U.S. Military Veterans Enrolled in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs1320139 was identified as a proxy variant for rs34799259 in the FinnGen analysis, indicating its significance related to ARHGAP15 (locus 5).
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Traumatic Brain Injury in U.S. Military Veterans Enrolled in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP was the most strongly associated with LVMI (p=1.7×10^-26) and was located at the TTN locus, which has been previously implicated in left ventricular mass (LVM) and relates to familial cardiomyopathies.
title: Clinical and Genetic Associations of Deep Learning-Derived Cardiac Magnetic Resonance-Based Left Ventricular Mass

finding: The SNP rs3103257, located in the intronic region of the NPPC gene, was identified as one of the lead SNPs among the four novel anxiety loci. It showed high CADD scores indicating potential functional significance.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SNP rs78786199 demonstrated a similar pattern to rs76859653, as cancer patients carrying the minor allele had lower APE scores at one year post-treatment. This SNP is situated in an intergenic region on chromosome 2 and is associated with transcription factors that may influence cancer proliferation and neurodegenerative pathways.
title: Genetic variants associated with longitudinal cognitive performance in older breast cancer patients and controls

finding: The SNP rs13399656, mapped to SPTBN1, was recognized as a significant locus with statistical differences in effect sizes between sexes, emphasizing its role in estrogen-related hearing functions.
title: Sex differences, cross-ancestry generalizability, and noise-smoking interactions in the polygenic architecture of hearing loss in adults

finding: The SNP rs143578296, located at 2p25.3 upstream of the MYT1L gene, was another significant finding in the EUR-specific GWAS. It had an odds ratio of 1.99 (95% CI: 1.49-2.66; P=2.8x10^-6) and replicated successfully across different populations, indicating it was a risk factor for DM with stronger associations in larger meta-analyses.
title: Trans-ancestral genetic study of diabetes mellitus risk in survivors of childhood cancer: a report from the St. Jude Lifetime Cohort and the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study

finding: The index variant rs4245791 for <italic>ABCG8</italic> was associated with a decreased risk of cholelithiasis and interacted with cholesterol transport pathways, confirming its role as a lipid modifier, despite previous studies showing contrasting associations.
title: Implicating genes, pleiotropy and sexual dimorphism at blood lipid loci through multi-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs3861561 was identified within the NRXN1 gene. This variant was one of the 350 discriminating variants associated with astigmatism in the newly developed algorithms. Additionally, mutations in NRXN1 and the related pathways were implicated in cognitive disorders, including autism spectrum disorder, linking it to neurobiological functions relevant to astigmatism.
title: A novel computational methodology for GWAS multi-locus analysis based on graph theory and machine learning

finding: The G allele at rs147959551 was associated with decreased mean number of sedentary-time-at-night minutes and a decrease in maximum number of sleep-based-on-heart-rate minutes. This allele was significantly more enriched in individuals with depressive disorder compared to healthy controls, implicating it in sleep disruption, which is a common feature across various adolescent psychopathologies.
title: Digital phenotyping from wearables using AI characterizes psychiatric disorders and identifies genetic associations

finding: There was evidence of allele-specific expression of GLS connected to the associated SNP rs6741418 in the GLS gene region. This SNP was part of a study indicating a genetic mechanism linking coeliac disease (CD) to polygenic risk for metabolic conditions such as type 2 diabetes (T2D). The expression of GLS was downregulated in duodenal biopsies from children with untreated CD, which suggested an impaired intestinal gluconeogenesis (IGN) process that may contribute to the increased risk of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) in CD patients.
title: INTESTINAL GLUCONEOGENESIS IS DOWNREGULATED IN PAEDIATRIC PATIENTS WITH COELIAC DISEASE

finding: The variant rs11681562 showed a cross-ancestry GWS association with a z-score of -5.67 and a p-value of 1.4×10^-8, driven by both EUR and AFR samples. This SNP is located in a gene-rich region and is an eQTL for multiple genes, which are implicated in anxiety pathogenesis.
title: Gene Discovery and Biological Insights into Anxiety Disorders from a Multi-Ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of >1.2 Million Participants

finding: The variant rs72827480, associated with F-ANOV, demonstrated a protective effect with an odds ratio of 0.905 and colocalized with a testis-eQTL for INHBB indicating its relevance in male reproductive hormone regulation.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The variant rs12611602 was significantly associated with testosterone levels in women (β = 0.0163, P = 3.79E-08), potentially linking it to metabolic processes affecting reproductive health.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The MIR3681HG locus variant rs112938622 demonstrated an association with Covid-19 susceptibility, achieving a P-value of 4.95×10⁻⁸.
title: A year of COVID-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: This SNP, associated with the TGFA gene, was found to contribute to the genetic signals related to AA. It is implicated in the development of osteoarthritis and has been expressed in developing limbs.
title: Investigation of the genetic architecture of cam morphology, and its relationship with hip osteoarthritis, using alpha angle as a proxy measure

finding: The UGT1A1 variant rs4148323-A exhibited a 21-fold enrichment in Finland compared to non-Finnish Europeans, with a minor allele frequency of 4.2% in Finns versus 0.2% in Europeans. This variant was implicated in increased risks of adverse drug reactions to irinotecan in Finnish patients.
title: Implementation of CYP2D6 copy-number imputation panel and frequency of key pharmacogenetic variants in Finnish individuals with a psychotic disorder

finding: The SNP rs78529201 was significantly associated with an increased risk of peripheral artery disease (PAD) in Dominican participants of the BioMe biobank. Heterozygous carriers of this SNP exhibited a 37.2% risk of PAD compared to 13.3% in non-carriers, resulting in an odds ratio (OR) of 3.88 (95% CI 2.06-7.31, P<1.95×10^-5). This SNP resides within an intron of the lincRNA LINC00607, which is implicated in the regulation of endothelial cell functions related to vascular health.
title: Admixture Mapping of Peripheral Artery Disease in a Dominican Population Reveals a Novel Risk Locus on 2q35

finding: The SNP rs77979649, identified as another tag SNP in the 2q35 region, was included in the analysis and showed significance when modeled with rs78529201. However, it did not achieve genome-wide significance on its own, with an odds ratio of 2.14 (95% CI 1.09-4.20, P<2.7×10^-2). The presence of this SNP was tied to variations in PAD risk when analyzed alongside the primary tag SNP.
title: Admixture Mapping of Peripheral Artery Disease in a Dominican Population Reveals a Novel Risk Locus on 2q35

finding: Variant rs6715570 was shown to increase NKX2-5 DNA binding and was linked to the gene BARD1, which exhibited upregulation in the presence of the alternate allele in the heart atrial appendage.
title: Prioritizing Cardiovascular Disease-Associated Variants Altering NKX2-5 Binding through an Integrative Computational Approach

finding: The variant in CTLA4 was associated with increased risk of thyrotoxicosis, showcasing its potential involvement in autoimmune disorders.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: The SNP rs11889341, located in STAT4, showed a significant association with Primary Antiphospholipid Syndrome (PAPS) with a p-value of 1.39×10^-9 and an odds ratio of 0.61, indicating a consistent protective effect across five analyzed cohorts. This SNP has also been implicated in other autoimmune diseases.
title: A genome-wide association study suggests new susceptibility loci for primary antiphospholipid syndrome

finding: The variant rs886044536 corresponded to a deletion in the TTN gene characterized as c.93396_93400del AGCTT. This deletion was confirmed to cause a frameshift mutation leading to comparable functional effects as variants in ClinVar, thus indicating its pathogenicity. The research highlighted the significance of such variants in actionable genetic findings, particularly within the unique genetic structure of the Northern Isles of Scotland.
title: Identification of actionable genetic variants in 4,198 Scottish volunteers from the Viking Genes research cohort and implementation of return of results

finding: Identified as associated with antibodies against measles virus (EA = C, P = 3.5×10⁻⁸, β = -0.51), this SNP also represented a novel association.
title: Genetic analyses of common infections in the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children cohort

finding: At the BIN1 locus, rs72838287 was connected to BIN1 expression through microglia eQTLs, with the risk allele G associated with increased BIN1 expression, highlighting its regulatory role.
title: Deciphering the functional impact of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated variants in resting and proinflammatory immune cells

finding: The SNP rs12713844 was identified to share genetic variants with myocardial infarction (MI) risk, specifically associated with the protein Apo B. This association was confirmed during the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs563290 was found to be associated with the protein Apo B and linked to MI risk in the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: This intergenic SNP, located between a non-coding RNA gene and the ribosomal protein L29 pseudogene, exhibited significant association with time until relapse (TR) during acamprosate treatment, with a p-value of 3.1E-09.
title: Genetic Contributions to Alcohol Use Disorder Treatment Outcomes: A Genome-wide Pharmacogenomics Study

finding: This SNP in the BRE gene was among the top association signals for time until relapse to heavy drinking (THR), reaching significant genome-wide association with a p-value of 1.6E-08 and suggesting that carrying one additional copy of the minor allele (C) resulted in a 1.5 times higher risk of relapse.
title: Genetic Contributions to Alcohol Use Disorder Treatment Outcomes: A Genome-wide Pharmacogenomics Study

finding: This variant was prioritized as a probable causal variant in the <italic>BAZ2B</italic> locus due to its strong colocalization evidence with eQTLs.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The SNP rs2192574 demonstrated a causal relationship with lower stroke risk based on Mendelian randomisation, supporting the efficacy of warfarin in stroke prevention.
title: An Informatics Consult approach for generating clinical evidence for treatment decisions

finding: The intronic variant rs68066031 was flagged as the first evidence of human genetic association with SERPINE2, a gene implicated in thrombin inhibition.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs183868412 was identified as a novel risk locus for invasive bacterial infection in Kenyan children, correlating with a significant increased risk of infection due to multiple bacterial pathogens, independent of malaria. The association was validated in an independent case-control study showing an odds ratio (OR) of 2.77 (95% CI 1.49-5.12, p = 1.29 × 10^-3) and a meta-analysis yielding an OR of 2.21 (95% CI 1.75-2.79, p = 2.42 × 10^-11). It was particularly associated with culture-confirmed bacteraemia and critical illness among children with low probability of ‘true’ severe malaria.
title: BIRC6 modifies risk of invasive bacterial infection in Kenyan children

finding: The upstream variant rs56326533 was linked to heart failure and nearby the <italic>SPATS2L</italic> gene, which has connections with atrial fibrillation and QT-interval variation.
