finding: The STAT4 rs11889341(T) risk allele was associated with an increased risk of myocardial infarction and nephritis in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus, signifying its involvement in autoimmune and cardiovascular disease.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs1990760 in IFIH1 was associated with lower interferon-beta expression and potential vulnerability to COVID-19 infection, suggesting its importance in viral response pathways.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The COL4A3 rs55703767 gene variant was associated with type 2 diabetes, indicating its relevance in metabolic diseases.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The STAT4 rs7574865 variant was associated with type 1 diabetes mellitus, showcasing its importance in autoimmune disease risk.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP IL1B C-511T (rs16944) was associated with increased risk for alcohol drinking and alcohol use disorder (AUD), along with impaired cognition. The in vitro analyses demonstrated that this SNP potentiated both IL-1β gene expression and release, indicating its involvement in neuropsychiatric conditions characterized by cognitive deficits, including bipolar disorder, major depressive disorder, schizophrenia, and dementia.
title: Ethanol drinking sex-dependently alters cortical IL-1β synaptic signaling and cognitive behavior in mice

finding: Identified as a pQTL for MATN3 levels, this SNP has also been characterized as a methylation QTL associated with a specific CpG site affecting MATN3.
title: Genetic and epigenetic architectures of neurological protein biomarkers in the Lothian Birth Cohort 1936

finding: The study identified that the rs144223596 mutation (c.4510C>T) in the gene COL6A3 was linked to a reduction in the binding between collagen type VI and fibronectin, which provoked an osteoarthritic chondrocyte state. This finding was significant in the context of understanding how genetic mutations contribute to the pathology of osteoarthritis, particularly through the aberrant function of the pericellular matrix under mechanical stress.
title: A high-impact COL6A3 mutation alters the response of chondrocytes in neo-cartilage organoids to hyper-physiologic mechanical loading

finding: In the study, rs3136249 was identified as the causal SNP influencing both age at menarche (AAM) and age at menopause (ANM). It was located in the intronic region of the MSH6 gene, which is known to be associated with ANM based on previous studies. This finding highlighted the potential role of rs3136249 in affecting both phenotypes through a pleiotropic effect.
title: Integrating Genome-Wide Association and eQTLs Studies Identifies the Genes Associated with Age at Menarche and Age at Natural Menopause

finding: The SNP rs2867125 was associated with the gene ACP1, which received a 'positive hit' as per the high-throughput screen applied to it.
title: A multi-component screen for feeding behaviour and nutritional status in Drosophila to interrogate mammalian appetite-related genes

finding: The gene RBJ, located near the SNP rs713586, achieved a 'positive hit' in the screen, indicating its potential role in phenotypes related to obesity.
title: A multi-component screen for feeding behaviour and nutritional status in Drosophila to interrogate mammalian appetite-related genes

finding: This SNP was related to glucose levels, further supporting its association with metabolic traits.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP showed association with pancreatic cancer, indicating shared cancer susceptibility mechanisms along evolutionary lines.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Associated with 11 metabolites, this variant was found to influence levels of conjugated metabolites involved in the urea cycle, marking its relevance to metabolic regulation.
title: Genome-microbiome interplay provides insight into the determinants of the human blood metabolome

finding: The missense variant rs1260326 was associated with mannose (P = 1.2 × 10^-44) and 1-carboxyethyl-valine (P = 2.9 × 10^-11), with prior associations indicating its role in type 2 diabetes and Crohn’s disease.
title: Genome-microbiome interplay provides insight into the determinants of the human blood metabolome

finding: The lead eQTL rs7589901, located downstream of PAX8, was shared by both the PAX8 gene and its associated antisense RNA PAX8-AS1. This finding implies that it could be linked to cancer susceptibility.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The SNP rs11888559, located in the 3'UTR of CYP20A1, was originally identified as a GWAS SNP associated with height in Filipino women. It demonstrated significant differentiation among populations, with a global FST value of 0.36, thereby indicating a notable genetic variation between East Asian (CHB) and European (CEU) populations in contrast to the ancient African (YRI) population. The derived allele frequencies were high in CHB (0.81) and CEU (0.95).
title: Origin of a novel CYP20A1 transcript isoform through multiple Alu exaptations creates a potential miRNA sponge

finding: The SNP rs7577078, found within an Alu element in the 3'UTR of CYP20A1, was reported to exhibit high derived allele frequencies across all examined populations, suggesting it may play a significant role in genetic differentiation among modern human populations.
title: Origin of a novel CYP20A1 transcript isoform through multiple Alu exaptations creates a potential miRNA sponge

finding: The SNP rs849563 was identified as being associated with susceptibility to autism in an Iranian population. This association aligns with the context of Nrp2 as a candidate gene involved in autism spectrum disorders (ASDs), further supporting the hypothesis that genetic variations affecting Nrp2 function may contribute to the pathogenesis of ASD.
title: Dysregulation of Neuropilin-2 Expression in Inhibitory Neurons Impairs Hippocampal Circuit Development Leading to Autism-Epilepsy Phenotype

finding: The study reported that rs10495582 was a significant SNP linked to high-altitude essential hypertension. This finding suggested that this specific genetic variant played a role in the prevalence and clinical course of hypertension among high-altitude populations.
title: A sneak peek at the high altitude adaptation of the Ladakh populations

finding: The T allele of rs182549, which is a perfect proxy of rs4988235 associated with lactase persistence, was linked to decreased abundances of multiple microbial taxa, including species from the genus Bifidobacterium, due to its dominant inheritance model. The associations were robust, with significance levels below 1.89×10^-10.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: As a known variant regulating the LCT gene responsible for lactase persistence, rs4988235 significantly affected gut microbial composition, particularly lowering the abundance of Bifidobacterium species.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: The I648T variant (rs759271255) was identified as significantly disrupting protein stability and function, illustrating its potential pathogenic role.
title: Integrating Artificial Intelligence and Bioinformatics Methods to Identify Disruptive STAT1 Variants Impacting Protein Stability and Function

finding: The V642D variant (rs752542806) was found to destabilize the STAT1 residue, indicating a likely pathogenic effect.
title: Integrating Artificial Intelligence and Bioinformatics Methods to Identify Disruptive STAT1 Variants Impacting Protein Stability and Function

finding: The R602W variant (rs1209841496) significantly impacted protein stability, further supporting its association with potential pathologies related to immune dysfunction.
title: Integrating Artificial Intelligence and Bioinformatics Methods to Identify Disruptive STAT1 Variants Impacting Protein Stability and Function

finding: The L600P variant (rs137852678) was predicted to disrupt the stability of the STAT1 protein, suggesting a pathogenic influence.
title: Integrating Artificial Intelligence and Bioinformatics Methods to Identify Disruptive STAT1 Variants Impacting Protein Stability and Function

finding: The I578N variant (rs767475430) showed significant destabilization of the STAT1 residue, indicating a possible role in disease pathology.
title: Integrating Artificial Intelligence and Bioinformatics Methods to Identify Disruptive STAT1 Variants Impacting Protein Stability and Function

finding: The W504C variant (rs916580554) was also found to destabilize STAT1, pointing towards its potential contributions to various body pathologies.
title: Integrating Artificial Intelligence and Bioinformatics Methods to Identify Disruptive STAT1 Variants Impacting Protein Stability and Function

finding: This variant in the APOB gene was associated with increased levels of several cholesterol esters, sphingolipids, and phospholipids. It was previously linked to LDL and total cholesterol (TC), illustrating its significant role in lipid metabolism.
title: Leveraging a founder population to identify novel rare-population genetic determinants of lipidome

finding: This variant in the UGT gene was newly associated with higher levels of androstenediol in addition to its established roles.
title: Leveraging a founder population to identify novel rare-population genetic determinants of lipidome

finding: The SNP rs58964929 was identified as an introgressed reQTL at the UBE2F locus, affecting responses to both SARS-CoV-2 and influenza A virus in monocytes.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: This SNP was located within and associated with INPP5D, a gene selectively expressed in microglia, highlighting its role in immune pathways relevant to AD.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: SNP rs6733839 disrupted a MEF2 binding site located in a microglia-specific enhancer 28-kb upstream of the BIN1 gene, indicating potential involvement in AD pathology.
title: Single-cell epigenomic identification of inherited risk loci in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs13025717 was predicted to disrupt a KLF4 binding motif in a microglia-specific putative enhancer 21-kb upstream of the BIN1 promoter, further establishing its functional relevance in AD.
title: Single-cell epigenomic identification of inherited risk loci in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease

finding: SNP rs7585473 disrupted an oligodendrocyte-specific SOX6 motif, engaging with the MAL gene involved in myelin biogenesis, suggesting a role in PD through oligodendrocyte function.
title: Single-cell epigenomic identification of inherited risk loci in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs3755519 was located within a neuronal-specific intronic peak of the KCNIP3 gene, and although not a strong machine learning prediction, allelic imbalance was identified, pointing to its potential influence on transcription factor binding in PD.
title: Single-cell epigenomic identification of inherited risk loci in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7599054 disrupted a putative CTCF binding site near the TMEM163 gene, supporting its role through allelic imbalance across various samples.
title: Single-cell epigenomic identification of inherited risk loci in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease

finding: The introgressed haplotype tagged by rs76647913 was identified as an eQTL for the nearby ATOH7 gene, which is involved in retinal ganglion cell development and affects circadian entrainment based on light stimuli.
title: Archaic Introgression Shaped Human Circadian Traits

finding: The SNP rs75804782 was part of a large chromosome 2 haplotype associated with chronotype, showing a strong correlation with latitude, indicating its role in adaptive introgression relevant to circadian biology.
title: Archaic Introgression Shaped Human Circadian Traits

finding: The SNP rs61332075 was identified as showing the strongest latitudinal cline, with an association of R=0.87, highlighting its potential influence on chronotype in relation to latitude.
title: Archaic Introgression Shaped Human Circadian Traits

finding: The EUR-specific variant rs35333999 caused a missense change in the PER2 protein (V903I), which overlaps a predicted interaction interface with PPARG, implicating it in the regulation of lipid metabolism and circadian control.
title: Archaic Introgression Shaped Human Circadian Traits

finding: The SNP rs960783 was part of a smaller haplotype of introgressed variants correlating with latitude and showing potential relevance to circadian gene expression and chronotype.
title: Archaic Introgression Shaped Human Circadian Traits

finding: The SNP rs62194932 functioned as an eQTL for HES6 in blood, indicating its contribution to circadian regulation of LDLR and cholesterol homeostasis, relevant to the overall chronotype effects observed.
title: Archaic Introgression Shaped Human Circadian Traits

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with beat synchronization and was mapped at chromosome 2 close to the VRK2 gene, which codes for a protein kinase expressed in the brain. The locus was linked to multiple neurological phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide association study of musical beat synchronization demonstrates high polygenicity

finding: The interleukin 1 beta (IL-1β) gene polymorphism rs16944 was associated with COPD, suggesting its role in inflammatory processes relevant to the disease.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs4758 was identified as a significant cis-eQTL for the target gene PDIA6 in glioblastomas with a Bonferroni-adjusted p-value of 1.30 x 10^-4. It was found that glioblastoma cells with the alternative T allele expressed PDIA6 at significantly higher levels compared to those with the reference C allele. Binding of transcription factor PBX1 was demonstrated to be increased by the T variant, enhancing PDIA6 expression and suggesting a regulatory mechanism underpinning this eQTL effect.
title: Discovering single-cell eQTLs from scRNA-seq data only

finding: This SNP showed significant interaction with alcohol intake frequency and was linked to the UBE2E3 gene, known to be involved in metabolic processes.
title: Leveraging phenotypic variability to identify genetic interactions in human phenotypes

finding: rs12996547 demonstrated an interaction with age, impacting TMEM18 gene expression, which is associated with body weight regulation.
title: Leveraging phenotypic variability to identify genetic interactions in human phenotypes

finding: The variant rs12712928, located at the 2p21 locus, was shown to map in a chromatin site with increased activity in glucocorticoid signaling. It was associated with glucose levels and T2D risk, had significant allelic effects on enhancer activity, and demonstrated enhanced effects in glucocorticoid-treated cells. This variant was also identified as a likely causal variant for the glucose and T2D association.
title: Glucocorticoid signaling in pancreatic islets modulates gene regulatory programs and genetic risk of type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs2122729 was previously identified in a study by Parent and Verbyla (2010) focusing on the browning of Alaska’s boreal forest. This finding related to the health and vitality of tree species in the context of environmental stressors, such as herbivory and climate change impacts. The significance of this SNP was tied to its association with the phenotypic traits affecting leaf pigmentation and overall tree vitality, particularly under changing environmental conditions.
title: Comparisons of Tree Damage Indicators in Five NASA ABoVE Forest Sites Near Fairbanks, Alaska

finding: The SNP rs6741499 was reported to be associated with intraocular pressure (IOP) and mapped to a locus containing the gene BRE. This SNP was previously recognized in GWAS studies associated with primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG) and was one of the top hits in transcriptome-wide association studies.
title: Retinal ganglion cell-specific genetic regulation in primary open angle glaucoma

finding: The rs2041840 variant associated with the NDUFAF7 gene showed significant positive correlation with exercise responses. The T allele was linked to better responses, and the gene is crucial for mitochondrial complex I assembly.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: The rs12712528 variant within the NDUFAF7 gene showed a moderate correlation with the significant rs2041840 variant and was trending towards significance in responses related to weight and VO2max.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: The rs17035364 SNP was reported to be damaging, with a humdiv score of 0.990 and a humvar score of 0.674, indicating its potential to cause structural alterations in the Pleckstrin protein. This SNP was associated with decreased stability compared to the wild type, as evidenced by a higher RMSD of 5.79 Å compared to 5.4 Å for the wild type. It exhibited the highest compactness with a mean radius of gyration of 46.05 Å among the studied variants, and its structural changes were observable through molecular dynamic simulations.
title: Insilico analysis of structural and functional impact of SNPs in Pleckstrin

finding: The rs3816281 SNP was also predicted to be damaging, with a humdiv score of 0.997 and a humvar score of 0.935. This SNP led to increased flexibility in the protein structure, identified by the highest degree of fluctuation in RMSF analysis. The RMSD for rs3816281 was 6.51 Å, indicating less stability compared to the wild type. Additionally, it demonstrated the lowest number of intramolecular hydrogen bonds, suggesting greater flexibility. This SNP's analysis displayed lower total energy values compared to the wild type, highlighting its negatively impacting alterations on the structural and functional properties of Pleckstrin.
title: Insilico analysis of structural and functional impact of SNPs in Pleckstrin

finding: The SNP rs6733839 was identified as causally implicated in the regulation of the Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk gene BIN1 specifically within microglia. This finding aligned with previous literature and emphasized that different glial cell types, including microglia, are involved in the genetic risk mechanisms for AD.
title: Neuronal and glial 3D chromatin architecture illustrates cellular etiology of brain disorders

finding: At the 2p15 locus, rs10865331 was originally associated with B3GNT2, but the study demonstrated through CHi-C interactions that it actually implicated the promoter of COMMD1, a gene involved in NFkB signaling, suggesting a novel functional connection.
title: Chromatin-based techniques map DNA interaction landscapes in psoriasis susceptibility loci and highlight KLF4 as a target gene in 9q31

finding: The SNP rs3749171 was associated with an increased risk of ulcerative colitis (UC) and primary sclerosing cholangitis as identified by genome-wide association studies (GWAS). Structural modeling suggested that this variant causes an amino acid substitution (T108M) that may alter the activation capacity of GPR35, although the exact implications for intestinal immune homeostasis and defective GPR35 signaling remained poorly understood.
title: Lysophosphatidic acid-mediated GPR35 signaling in CX3CR1+ macrophages regulates the intestinal cytokine milieu

finding: The SNP rs9076 showed significant association with neurofibrillary tangles measurement phenotype, with a p-value of 1.00E-12, which suggests its importance in cognitive processes related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Systems genetics identifies the association between Enc1 and cognitive function in the hippocampus

finding: SNP rs116172829 was linked to MEIS1 and the EPIN promoter for gene STOM, showing a p-value of 8.19e-6, indicating its potential role in prostate cancer mechanisms.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: The change from the reference A allele to the C allele of this SNP was linked to impairment of the canonical polyA motif AATAAA, which resulted in the preference for usage of a cryptic polyadenylation site in the ADI1 3'UTR.
title: Genetic Basis of Alternative Polyadenylation is an Emerging Molecular Phenotype for Human Traits and Diseases

finding: The SNP rs17487792 was significantly associated with neuroblastoma predisposition, indicating that the T risk allele correlated with reduced BARD1 expression across 34 normal tissues, particularly in nervous system tissues. Additionally, tumors with a germline homozygous risk allele genotype (T/T) at this SNP exhibited a significantly increased burden of DNA double-strand breaks (DSBs) compared to the homozygous non-risk allele genotype (C/C), suggesting that deficient DNA repair associated with decreased BARD1 expression is a mechanism contributing to neuroblastoma predisposition. This association was more pronounced in high-risk neuroblastomas without MYCN amplification.
title: BARD1 germline variants induce haploinsufficiency and DNA repair defects in neuroblastoma

finding: Located downstream of CD28 and reduced T cell proliferation when targeted, highlighting its role in T cell activation.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The SNP rs13010060 was associated with the gene expression patterns observed in Wilms tumor cell lines with different WT1 mutations. This finding indicated that the mutation of WT1 and the corresponding genetic background affected the overall expression profile of genes from nephrogenic precursor cells to more differentiated nephron cells, suggesting an early developmental origin for the tumors.
title: Gene expression studies of WT1 mutant Wilms tumor cell lines in the frame work of published kidney development data reveals their early stem cell origin

finding: The SNP rs4952069, which fell within the intronic region of CAPN14, was associated with susceptibility to enteric fever, providing a p-value of 4.2 × 10−6. CAPN14 is a calcium-dependent cysteine protease, and SNPs in this locus have been previously linked to conditions such as eosinophilic oesophagitis and middle ear infections. The finding indicated that genetic variations that promote a Th2-dominant response may influence susceptibility to enteric fever, especially considering the role of Th2 cytokines in the immune response during infection.
title: Genetic Susceptibility to Enteric Fever in Experimentally Challenged Human Volunteers

finding: In both EA and Hispanic Ancestry (HA) data, rs11889341 was prioritized through ΔMGW-weighted analyses and demonstrated strong associations with SLE, especially due to its high ΔMGW of 1.75 Å.
title: Intrinsic DNA topology as a prioritization metric in genomic fine-mapping studies

finding: The variant rs72823641 was associated with asthma in several genome-wide association studies, demonstrating strong significance with p-values ranging from 4 x 10^-12 to 2 x 10^-136. It mapped to a large intron of the IL1RL1 gene and was interconnected with other variants in linkage disequilibrium (LD). This SNP's analysis allowed for the identification of a candidate variant, suggesting it could contribute to asthma risk through regulatory mechanisms.
title: DNA-binding factor footprints and enhancer RNAs identify functional non-coding genetic variants

finding: SNP rs10173081 was pinpointed as a candidate variant in connection with asthma, residing in a myeloid-specific open chromatin region while overlapping a DNase footprint and eRNA. This variant was further explored as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for multiple genes related to lung and blood expressions. The functional predictions indicated possible loss of binding for several transcription factors linked to asthma susceptibility.
title: DNA-binding factor footprints and enhancer RNAs identify functional non-coding genetic variants

finding: This SNP, located in the INPP5D gene, was linked to lower levels of the IDUA protein. This association was unique and not previously documented, emphasizing its relevance to immune signaling via microglia.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multi-omic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: rs934197 was identified as a strong known association signal for low density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, particularly within the <APOB> locus. Despite achieving a high significance level at p = 4.0 x 10^-17 in subcutaneous adipose, it was found that its low posterior inclusion probability (PIP < .001) suggested it was likely a shadow signal of another stronger eQTL. In other tissues, such as tibial artery and esophagus, it exhibited the highest PIP, indicating a potentially causal regulatory role for <APOB> in those tissues.
title: FIVEx: an interactive multi-tissue eQTL browser

finding: The SNP rs4988235, located in the MCM6 gene, was associated with lactase persistence. The derived allele associated with this SNP showed significant evidence of strong selection during periods of ancient famines, which supported its correlation with lactase persistence.
title: Fast and accurate estimation of selection coefficients and allele histories from ancient and modern DNA

finding: The rs11883564 locus showed a significant association with CD4+ T cell content in sun-exposed skin tissues (p = 4.2 × 10^-9) and overlapped with an association for STAM2 gene expression. STAM2 is crucial for T-cell development, and this SNP has also been associated with the response of alopecia areata to chemotherapy. A significant correlation was observed between STAM2 expression and the CD4+ T cell signature in skin tissue (p = 7.2 × 10^-9), highlighting the role of STAM2 in immune regulation.
title: Age, Sex, and Genetics Influence the Abundance of Infiltrating Immune Cells in Human Tissues

finding: The variant rs3769821 was identified as a candidate causal variant in the CASP8 promoter and was linked to breast cancer risk. Reporter assays demonstrated that the risk allele of rs3769821 caused a 30% reduction in CASP8 expression (P = 0.019), correlating with diminished T cell killing of breast cancer target cells.
title: Pooled genetic screens identify breast cancer risk genes involved in evasion from T cell-mediated killing

finding: The study found that the INPP5D rs35349669 polymorphism was associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease. This association was supported by replication and meta-analysis, indicating a significant link between this SNP and the pathophysiology of Alzheimer's, particularly in relation to neuroinflammation, which is pivotal in Alzheimer’s pathology.
title: TrkB-dependent regulation of molecular signaling across septal cell types

finding: The SNP rs13020356 was positively associated with controlling cancer cell behavior, particularly in the context of inhibiting aldehyde dehydrogenase 1A3. This inhibition led to a decrease in cancer cell growth, invasiveness, and stemness, contributing to the overall understanding of tumor biology in nutrient-rich conditions.
title: Targeting the cell and non-cell autonomous regulation of 47S synthesis by GCN2 in colon cancer

finding: The SNP rs1250229-T in the fibronectin (FN1) gene was associated with a decreased risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) specifically in patients with familial hypercholesterolemia. This finding was significant as it highlighted the genetic influence of the FN1 gene within the context of cardiovascular disease.
title: Conserved Cardiovascular Network: Bioinformatics Insights into Genes and Pathways for Establishing Caenorhabditis elegans as an Animal Model for Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: This SNP had links to Crohn's disease (CD) and was shown to disrupt FOSL2 binding to DNA.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with Crohn's disease (CD) and impacted FOSL2's DNA binding activity.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: The SNP rs13020216 was associated with signaling pathways affecting myeloma cell growth and survival, as discussed in the study by Hideshima & Anderson (2021). This finding highlighted its relevance in cancer research, particularly in the context of multiple myeloma.
title: Bioinformatics Illustrations Decoded by ChatGPT: The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly

finding: The SNP rs60199254 acted as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) that demonstrated a relationship with the expression levels of PIGF, contributing to the understanding of its regulatory role.
title: Characterization of Structural Variation in Tibetans Reveals New Evidence of High-altitude Adaptation and Introgression

finding: The SNP rs10206434 also functioned as an eQTL, showing a correlation with the expression levels of TTC7A, which indicates its significance in gene regulation.
title: Characterization of Structural Variation in Tibetans Reveals New Evidence of High-altitude Adaptation and Introgression

finding: The study demonstrated that the <italic>his5</italic> locus, when integrated near the efficient origin <italic>ars3002</italic>, exhibited increased incidence of copy number gains (CNGs) upon re-replication. This resulted in a higher number of resistant colonies when exposed to 5mM of 3-amino-triazole (3-AT), indicating that the re-replication process, coupled with the activity of the nearby origin, played a significant role in the amplification of the <italic>his5</italic> copies, thus contributing to drug resistance. The results highlighted the importance of the position of genomic loci in CNG formation.
title: Aberrant replication licensing drives Copy Number Gains across species

finding: The rs4988235 SNP was associated with the ability to digest lactose during adulthood without lactose intolerance symptoms. A third of the individuals from the Hun period, 2 out of 14 from the Avar period, and 6 out of 31 from the Conqueror period displayed the derived persistence allele. Notably, all carriers were predicted to have predominantly European ancestry, aligning with previous findings of European mtDNA haplogroups in samples.
title: Y-chromosome haplogroups from Hun, Avar and conquering Hungarian period nomadic people of the Carpathian Basin

finding: The rs182549 SNP also related to lactase persistence and demonstrated that carriers in the study were able to digest lactose effectively. Similar to rs4988235, this SNP was identified in individuals from all periods: 1/3 from the Hun period, 2/14 from the Avar period, and 6/31 from the Conqueror period. The persistence genotype showed a strong correlation with European origins, and some carriers were heterozygous for both SNPs, while others carried only the rs182549 derived allele, indicating possible previous admixture with non-carriers from East Eurasia.
title: Y-chromosome haplogroups from Hun, Avar and conquering Hungarian period nomadic people of the Carpathian Basin

finding: Found to affect the CXCR2 gene expression, with significant associations in neutrophil counts.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Participated in the regulation of CXCR2 gene, showing substantial implications for immune responses.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Demonstrated significant effects on neutrophil counts via regulation of CXCR2, corroborating its role in immune function.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Functioned as an expression QTL impacting the CXCR2 gene, indicating its relevance in blood cell phenotype.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Influenced the expression of CCR7, with additional links to eosinophil count regulation.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Linked to the expression regulation of MFSD2B, associated with differential transcript contributions.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Demonstrated coding effects impacting MFSD2B's role in red blood cell biology.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The rs55703767 SNP was identified as a common missense variant in the COL4A3 gene and was significantly associated with protection against diabetic kidney disease (DKD) across multiple definitions, including any albuminuria and end-stage renal disease (OR = 0.79, P = 5.34×10^-12). Its association was stronger in men compared to women (OR = 0.73 vs OR = 0.85). This variant also demonstrated a significant correlation with glomerular basement membrane (GBM) width and the degree of renal fibrosis, with its protective effect amplified under conditions of poor glycemic control.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The SNP rs12615970, located near the COLEC11 gene, was associated with chronic kidney disease (CKD) with an odds ratio of 1.31 (P = 9.43×10^-9) and showed nominal significance for various albuminuria-based traits, indicating its involvement in renal biology.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: This SNP was maintained in association with DKD, albeit with reduced significance in the larger dataset indicating its potential relevance in diabetic renal complications.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: Associated with DKD (P = 3.53×10^-5), indicating that variations in this locus are relevant to diabetic nephropathy pathways and outcomes.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The rs4972593 SNP displayed significant association for CKD-DN (P = 0.020) indicating its role in renal disease amongst diabetic patients.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The SNP rs6432901 in the SCN9A gene was found to correlate significantly with GMD of the putamen, showing lower GMD in high pain sensitivity participants. Mediation analysis confirmed the indirect effect of this SNP's genotype on pain threshold through its association with GMD.
title: Genomic and transcriptomic profiles influence on brain morphology and their interactions with pain sensitivity individual differences

finding: The SNP rs35473199 in the SCN9A gene also showed significant interaction effects with pain sensitivity regarding GMD of the putamen, with lower GMD in high pain sensitivity participants. It had an indirect effect on pain threshold, mediated by the GMD.
title: Genomic and transcriptomic profiles influence on brain morphology and their interactions with pain sensitivity individual differences

finding: SNP rs1260326 was identified as a missense variant in the GCKR gene. It was fine-mapped for multiple biomarkers, achieving a posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 1.000 for glomerular filtration rate and total protein level, 0.998 for blood glucose level, and 0.823 for pulse rate. These results suggested its potential causal role and pleiotropic effects across different physiological traits.
title: SparsePro: an efficient genome-wide fine-mapping method integrating summary statistics and functional annotations

finding: Associated with functional connectivity traits, rs2863957 was located in the 2q14.1 genomic region and contributed to understanding the genetic influences on intrinsic brain activity.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic functional architecture of human brain

finding: The rs59335482 insertion allele was associated with an increase in BIN1 mRNA expression in the brain. Moreover, this increase was noted in the CNS of Alzheimer's disease patients compared to non-AD patients, indicating a link between this polymorphism and BIN1 expression without conferring increased risk for AD.
title: BIN1 protein isoforms are differentially expressed in astrocytes, neurons, and microglia: neuronal and astrocyte BIN1 implicated in Tau pathology

finding: Designated as a lead variant in the multivariate SERPINE2 locus analysis, associated with an increased risk of hypertrophic scars (OR 1.3, p = 7.5×10^-5).
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: Found to be part of the suggestive causal variants for the SERPINE2 locus, but specific findings were not detailed in the context provided.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: Part of the significant associations in the SERPINE2 locus, reaffirming the multivariate analysis results for this locus.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: An intronic variant in high linkage disequilibrium with the lead variant rs13412535 that also functions as a pQTL for SERPINE2.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: The SNP rs13428812 was identified in the meta-analysis as one of six novel SNPs associated with the relationship between MS and Crohn's disease (CD), indicating a potential genetic overlap.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: In this context, rs4850441 was also pinpointed as a SNP intersecting with relevant enhancers in embryonic neural progenitors and was found to be connected with specific disease-associated genes, emphasizing its potential role in neurodevelopmental processes.
title: Single cell chromatin accessibility reveals regulatory elements and developmental trajectories in the embryonic forebrain

finding: The rs1042031 polymorphism in the apolipoprotein B gene was associated with the risk of breast cancer in a Chinese population. This association highlighted the genetic variant's relevance in breast cancer risk, indicating its potential importance in understanding the genetic factors contributing to TNBC.
title: Identification of Key Genes Potentially Related to Triple Receptor Negative Breast Cancer by Microarray Analysis

finding: The SNP rs744373 was identified in genome-wide association studies as a risk polymorphism associated with increased BIN1 expression. This variant was linked to poorer memory performance, particularly in individuals with epilepsy. Despite conflicting results regarding its correlation to BIN1 expression, the overall findings suggest that this SNP contributes to the genetic risk for developing sporadic Alzheimer's disease by influencing BIN1 levels.
title: Loss of the Alzheimer’s-linked bridging integrator 1 (BIN1) protein affects synaptic structure and disrupts tau localisation and release

finding: This SNP was found to loop to the promoter region of the gene MEIS1, which has been widely implicated in sleep and restless leg syndrome. The strong linkage disequilibrium with the sentinel SNP rs1519102 provided additional evidence for its role.
title: Variant-to-gene-mapping followed by cross-species genetic screening identifies GPI-anchor biosynthesis as novel regulator of sleep

finding: This SNP mapped to the DNER gene, which is involved in neuron-glia interactions. It had a p-value of 0.02 in the GWAS.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: The risk 'T' allele exhibited significantly increased transcriptional activity compared to the normal 'C' allele in PC-3 cells, indicating a positive regulatory effect.
title: A dinucleotide tag-based parallel reporter gene assay method

finding: The SNP rs13415583 was part of both the original GWAS and cFDR analysis, showing a discovery GWAS p-value of 1.913e-06 for RA, which was reduced to 4.764e-09 in the validation study. This indicated a strong association with RA in the context of the validated dataset.
title: fcfdr: an R package to leverage continuous and binary functional genomic data in GWAS

finding: The SNP rs2584937 was located 40398 bp downstream of the NCOA1 gene, which was previously associated with Major Depressive Disorder (MDD). NCOA1 is involved in glucocorticoid receptor signaling, impairments of which have been linked to MDD. Additionally, the expression of NCOA1 during pregnancy was found to be diminished in depressed patients, suggesting a further association between this SNP, NCOA1, and MDD.
title: Multi-omic modeling of antidepressant response implicates dynamic immune and inflammatory changes in individuals who respond to treatment

finding: The rs116558455 SNP in the FN1 gene, which represented a Glycine to Glutamic acid substitution, was identified in healthy elderly APOEε4 homozygous carriers in EFIGA/WHICAP cohorts. This variant was absent in all APOEε4 carriers with Alzheimer's disease (AD) in the Hispanic cohort, suggesting a protective effect against AD.
title: Rare genetic variation in Fibronectin 1 (FN1) protects against APOEe4 in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs140926439 SNP in the FN1 gene caused a similar Glycine to Glutamic acid change. This variant was present in healthy elderly APOEε4 homozygous carriers but was absent in homozygous APOEε4 AD patients among non-Hispanic whites, suggesting that it may have a protective role against AD.
title: Rare genetic variation in Fibronectin 1 (FN1) protects against APOEe4 in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs755264566 SNP within the ZRANB3 locus was included among the top four candidates; however, it was noted that its significance and association with T2D had not been established previously.
title: A Novel Type 2 Diabetes Locus in sub-Saharan Africans, ZRANB3, is Implicated in Beta Cell Proliferation

finding: The rs6733839 SNP was identified as having a high population attributable risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD), with an allele frequency of approximately 40% and an odds ratio of 1.20. This finding suggests that this variant strongly contributes to the genetic risk for AD, highlighting the significance of the BIN1 locus in the disease's etiology.
title: Alzheimer’s disease risk gene BIN1 induces Tau-dependent network hyperexcitability

finding: The rs744373 SNP was associated with increased Tau-PET levels in AD patients as well as reduced functional connectivity and impaired memory. This finding indicated that this variant plays a crucial role in connecting BIN1's function with Tau pathology, which is known to affect neuronal excitability and may contribute to the mechanisms underlying hyperexcitability in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Alzheimer’s disease risk gene BIN1 induces Tau-dependent network hyperexcitability

finding: The SNP rs1427407 was involved in trans-eQTL effects on hemoglobin subunit gamma-2 (HBG2), linking to blood cell counts.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs930263 was associated with trans-eQTLs affecting KCNA5, indicating a potential role in neuronal excitability.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The rs6742078 SNP was identified as an active variable in predicting asthma risk with a hazard ratio of 13.167 per standard deviation of the PHS score. This variant is located in an intron of the UTG1A4 gene, which encodes an enzyme involved in transforming small lipophilic molecules, highlighting its potential role in metabolic processes related to asthma.
title: Fast Lasso method for Large-scale and Ultrahigh-dimensional Cox Model with applications to UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs11692435 was linked to CT1 and is considered a schizophrenia-related locus within the ACTR1B gene, showing an association with a p-value of 1.17×10−12.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The SNP rs7570830 linked to SA5 was previously associated with subcortical volumes.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The genetic variant rs11884632, associated with SLC40A1, identified key relationships in pallidum, substantia nigra, and thalamic regions, indicating its role in iron export and hemochromatosis. This variant's associations in the voxel-wise map related to brain health markers were significant.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs9332964 C>T in SRD5A2 was identified as associated with 5-alpha reductase deficiency, an autosomal recessive disorder affecting male sexual development. This SNP had not been reported in the KHV call set and was found to be rare globally but more common in the Vietnamese population, with an allele frequency of 0.05% in the Vietnamese population, which is significantly higher compared to other populations.
title: Genetic profiling of Vietnamese population from large-scale genomic analysis of non-invasive prenatal testing data

finding: The SNP rs4988235 was identified at the LCT locus as a strong signal of selection in Great Britain. The derived allele at this SNP was linked to lactase persistence, enabling individuals to digest lactose into adulthood. An estimated selection coefficient of 0.080 (CI: [0.056, 0.101]) was reported, aligning with literature findings. The presence of this allele was suggested to have provided a beneficial advantage during periods of famine, despite previous studies indicating that the introduction of milk consumption occurred before the allele's frequency increase.
title: A novel expectation-maximization approach to infer general diploid selection from time-series genetic data

finding: The SNP rs6717613 (G->A) was found to significantly impact the binding strength of transcription factor ATF2, with a Delta-MOP score of 0.45. The major allele (G) yielded a MOP score of 0.29 while the minor allele (A) had a MOP score of 0.74. This SNP's location was confirmed to play a role in the differential binding strength of ATF2, which is critical in regulating drug sensitivity in lymphoblastoid cell lines.
title: Genome-wide non-coding variant interpretation improves discovery of transcriptional regulators of drug response

finding: Reid et al. (2021) found that the STAT4 rs11889341(T) risk allele, when combined with smoking, significantly increased the risk of myocardial infarction and nephritis in cases of systemic lupus erythematosus, underlining its importance in autoimmune responses.
title: Bioinformatics Analysis of next generation sequencing data for Risk Prediction in Patients with Type 1 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs4507142 was identified as an outlier exhibiting possible directional pleiotropic effects specifically associated with GM-BAG traits.
title: The Genetic Heterogeneity of Multimodal Human Brain Age

finding: The SNP rs11689011 in the HIF2A gene exhibited a suggestive association with basal metabolic rate, recorded at a p-value of 9.5E-06, implying a role for HIF signaling in metabolic functions.
title: Adipocyte-specific deletion of the oxygen-sensor PHD2 sustains elevated energy expenditure at thermoneutrality

finding: This missense mutation in the COL4A3 gene was identified as significantly associated with ESKD in a recent GWAS involving almost 20,000 individuals with T1DM.
title: Assessment of differentially methylated loci in individuals with end-stage kidney disease attributed to diabetic kidney disease

finding: Previously identified in the GENIE consortium meta-analysis as significantly associated with ESKD located in the AFF3 gene. Functional studies indicated it influences kidney tubule fibrosis through the TGF-β1 pathway.
title: Assessment of differentially methylated loci in individuals with end-stage kidney disease attributed to diabetic kidney disease

finding: The SNP rs3827760 in the EDAR gene was linked to thicker hair and shovel-shaped incisors. Jomon-derived haplotypes presented frequencies of 14.9% for the ancestral allele (thinner hair and non-shovel-shaped incisors) and 17.3% for the derived allele (thicker hair and shovel-shaped incisors) in the mainland Japanese population.
title: Comprehensive analysis of Japanese population history by detecting ancestry-marker polymorphisms without using ancestral genomic information

finding: At this SNP associated with lactase persistence, SIA detected a strong signal of selection with a sweep probability close to 1 and a selection coefficient greater than 0.01, indicating it was one of the strongest signals of selection in the human genome.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: The intergenic variant rs7556897 was shown to interact with obesity in its influence on blood pressure among children, hinting at a broader metabolic context.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The rs4988235(T) allele, located upstream of the LCT gene and linked to adult lactase persistence, was found to have varied frequencies in different populations, ranging from 5% to almost 100%. Its selection coefficient was estimated to be high in human populations. Despite this, the exact causes of its adaptive advantage were debated, with suggestions of different selection pressures across Europe. Ancient DNA evidence indicated that this allele was rare in Europe during the Neolithic period but became common in Northern Europe after the Iron Age, hinting at a possible rise in frequency due to gene flow from regions east of the Baltic during the Bronze Age.
title: Modelling the spatiotemporal spread of beneficial alleles using ancient genomes

finding: The SNP rs34111570 was identified as a lead eVar at a primary eQTL locus related to the MCFD2 gene, which overlapped with the gene body. This primary locus showed an extensive block of linkage disequilibrium (LD) encompassing all eVars reported by the GTEx consortium.
title: TreeMap: A Structured Approach to Fine Mapping of eQTL Variants

finding: The SNP rs7574514 was identified as a linked eVar at the same primary eQTL locus as rs34111570 for the MCFD2 gene. Similar to rs34111570, it was part of an extensive block of linkage disequilibrium (LD), indicating its role in the regulation of gene expression.
title: TreeMap: A Structured Approach to Fine Mapping of eQTL Variants

finding: The rs3749171 variant of GPR35, responsible for the T108M substitution, was indicated to be related to the pathogenesis of ulcerative colitis (UC) through findings in genome-wide association studies. This SNP highlights the significance of GPR35 as a risk gene for inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and its potential involvement in modulating the intestinal epithelial barrier.
title: Epithelial GPR35 protects from Citrobacter rodentium infection by preserving goblet cells and mucosal barrier integrity

finding: The SNP rs4988235, linked to lactose intolerance, was present among all individuals analyzed. This finding confirmed that lactose intolerance traits existed in the Korean population during the TK period, consistent with the traits observed in contemporary Koreans.
title: Diverse northern Asian and Jomon-related genetic structure discovered among socially complex Three Kingdoms period Gaya region Koreans

finding: The SNP rs3827760, related to hair thickness and straightness, was found to be homozygous in the majority of samples, with one individual showing a distinct Jomon-like SNP profile. This indicated that traits associated with straight hair had been established in Koreans for 1,700 years.
title: Diverse northern Asian and Jomon-related genetic structure discovered among socially complex Three Kingdoms period Gaya region Koreans

finding: The risk allele rs7556897 was located 10.3kb from the CCL20 gene and exhibited a high variant-to-gene (V2G) score. It impacted CCL20 as evidenced by expression and protein quantitative trait locus (eQTL, pQTL) mapping studies. This SNP was identified as a Ps-associated GWAS SNP linked to T<sub>h</sub>17-dependent keratinocyte genes.
title: T cells promote distinct transcriptional programs of cutaneous inflammatory disease in human skin structural cells

finding: SNP rs1374264 was part of a pair with SNP rs1898841, displaying a pairwise correlation of 0.59. They were among the 12 SNPs identified as being associated with elevated systolic blood pressure (SBP) and diastolic blood pressure (DBP) as per GWAS catalog.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: SNP rs1898841, paired with SNP rs1374264 with a correlation of 0.59, was similarly associated with elevated SBP and DBP from the GWAS catalog.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The SNP rs12616641 was found to be significantly associated with the strength of the somatomotor network and also showed significance for the strength of the limbic network. It was located in an intergenic region near the PAX8 gene on chromosome 2, highlighting its potential relevance to brain functional network integrity.
title: Novel genetic variants associated with brain functional networks in 18,445 adults from the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4124874 (UGT1A1*60 T>G) was identified as having a minor allele that decreased the transcriptional activity of the UGT1A1 enhancer and was linked to lower regulatory activity in drug responses involving the transcription factor pregnane X receptor (PXR).
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: SNP rs3771341 was associated with bilirubin levels and its presence in an intronic enhancer correlated significantly with the expression level of UGT1A1 in the liver, with a p-value of less than 1e-5 and an effect size of -0.3.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: SNP rs4148325 was also linked to bilirubin levels, falling within the same intronic enhancer region as rs3771341 and showing significant association with UGT1A1 expression in liver tissue.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: SNP rs6742078, located in the proximal region of UGT1A1, was part of a haplotype associated with UGT1A1 expression in the liver with statistical significance.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: SNP rs4148324 was associated with UGT1A1 expression in the liver, showing significant correlation in the context of its effect on gene regulation.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: The variant rs41380347 was associated with lactase persistence in Arabia and was found to have strong selection evidenced by a selection coefficient of s = 0.011 (logLR = 13.27) in Saudis. It was present at high frequency (~50%) in Saudis and Emiratis, but was absent in any Eurasian or African populations in the 1000 Genome Project. This indicated a recent origin within the Middle East and an increase in frequency correlated with a shift to a herder-gatherer lifestyle.
title: The Genomic History of the Middle East

finding: The SNP rs6749207 was located in the EDAR gene, which is associated with hair, teeth, and sweat gland development. It was shown to be under positive selection in East Asian and Native American populations, linked to increased hair thickness.
title: A fast linkage disequilibrium-based statistical test for Genome-Wide Epistatic Selection Scans in structured populations

finding: This SNP showed a significant gender difference in allele effect size, with a p value of 2.49×10^-12. It had p values of 1.30×10^-46 in males and 4.20×10^-7 in females.
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort

finding: The SNP rs2058622, located within an intron of the IL18R1 gene, was identified as a significant eQTL for IL18RAP expression in blood. The G allele of this SNP was associated with increased IL18RAP expression (p-value 4.8 x 10-54, Normalized Effect Size (NES) of 0.28). This SNP was linked to a cis-regulatory element accessible in the CD4 helper T cell cluster, suggesting its role in eczema pathogenesis.
title: Integrated single-cell chromatin and transcriptomic analyses of human scalp reveal etiological insights into genetic risk for hair and skin disease

finding: The SNP rs72966077, located downstream of the WNT10A gene, was identified in relation to androgenetic alopecia (AGA) and was found to disrupt an ERG transcription factor motif. This SNP also connected to keratinocyte gene regulation, with its alternative allele influencing chromatin accessibility, thus playing a role in the pathogenesis of AGA and possibly linked to acne vulgaris.
title: Integrated single-cell chromatin and transcriptomic analyses of human scalp reveal etiological insights into genetic risk for hair and skin disease

finding: The SNP rs11691869 was identified as a lead variant linked to creativity, and it was positioned near the AFF3 gene, known to be associated with schizophrenia (SCZ) and intellectual disability. This indicated a potential overlap in the genetic basis of creativity and certain psychiatric conditions.
title: Genetic architecture of creativity and extensive genetic overlap with psychiatric disorders revealed from genome-wide association analyses of 241,736 individuals

finding: Associated with creativity, rs1653301 was found near the gene FTCDNL1, which had links to schizophrenia (SCZ). This finding highlighted a genetic intersection between creativity and psychiatric disorders.
title: Genetic architecture of creativity and extensive genetic overlap with psychiatric disorders revealed from genome-wide association analyses of 241,736 individuals

finding: This SNP was found to have genome-wide significance in the second factor associated with RSN amplitude (F2), specifically impacting four sensorimotor networks. It was linked to sleep duration, making it relevant for both sleep and brain function research.
title: Shared genetic influences on resting-state functional networks of the brain

finding: The SNP rs13020230 was identified as a significant marker associated with glioblastoma (GBM) prognosis due to its correlation with the unique presence of tumor-specific neutrophils (TSNs). This finding suggested that rs13020230 might play a role in the immunosuppressive microenvironment of gliomas by influencing the recruitment or functionality of TSNs, which exhibit high expression of immunosuppressive genes and are linked with poor patient outcomes.
title: Tumor-specific neutrophils originating from meninges promote glioblastoma

finding: SNP rs2241880 within ATG16L1 exhibited significant frequency differences between CD-PDOs and healthy controls, supporting its association with Crohn's disease.
title: A Living Organoid Biobank of Crohn’s Disease Patients Reveals Molecular Subtypes for Personalized Therapeutics

finding: The SNP rs7604640 was found to lie in NeuN+ open chromatin specific to the striatum, approximately 46 kb upstream of the SIX3 locus on chromosome 2. This variant had predicted open chromatin activity specifically in D1 and D2 neurons but not in cortical excitatory neurons. It was identified as an off-lead SNP in the SmokingInitiation GWAS and was in linkage disequilibrium with the lead SNP rs163522. Additionally, rs7604640 was recognized as a known cis-eQTL for the antisense SIX3-AS1 gene in striatal regions, with its expression implicated in the development of D2 medium spiny neurons.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: The SNP rs76182733 exhibited a significant association with the reproductive subtype of PCOS (P_meta=2.76×10^-9) and had an OR of 5.68 (95% CI, 3.00-10.78). It was located at the promoter region of the IQCA1 gene.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs55762028 was found to be associated with the metabolic subtype of PCOS (P_meta=1.03×10^-8) with an OR of 1.86 (95% CI, 0.92-3.75). It was located in an intergenic region near the FIGN gene.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs13030379 was linked to therapeutic outcomes with TGFbeta in cancer treatment, suggesting that individuals with this SNP may experience differential responses to CAP therapy, potentially through modulation of EGF receptor signaling pathways according to the review by Gomez-Gil et al.
title: Epidermal Growth Factor potentiates EGFR(Y992/1173)-mediated therapeutic response of triple negative breast cancer cells to cold atmospheric plasma-activated medium

finding: The SNP rs6546231, located near the gene MEIS1, was associated with increased Forearm:Height. Abnormal forelimb development was observed in mouse models of MEIS-/- which confirms the relevance of this SNP in skeletal development.
title: The genetic architecture of the human skeletal form

finding: The reQTL for ARL4C was detected in the IAV experiment, highlighting a subtle but statistically significant decrease in eQTL effect, showcasing the utility of the 2df model.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: The reQTL for SESTD1 was discerned through the 2df-model during IAV perturbation, emphasizing the significance of interaction terms in assessing gene regulation.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: This deleterious variant in the APOB gene was associated with higher LDL-C levels, indicating a potential role in familial hypercholesterolemia and demonstrating a joint effect with alcohol consumption on lipid levels.
title: Role of Rare and Low Frequency Variants in Gene-Alcohol Interactions on Plasma Lipid Levels

finding: This SNP was identified as a CD-risk variant associated with Crohn's disease, indicating a potential genetic predisposition to this immunological disease. It was analyzed in a cohort of patients from the Prospective Registry in IBD study at Massachusetts General Hospital.
title: Identification of topoisomerase as a precision-medicine target in chromatin reader SP140-driven Crohn’s disease

finding: Similar to rs28445040, this SNP also exhibited an association with Crohn's disease risk. Its significance was evaluated in the context of analyzing immunological responses in disease patients.
title: Identification of topoisomerase as a precision-medicine target in chromatin reader SP140-driven Crohn’s disease

finding: This SNP was studied in lymphoblastoid cells that were homozygous for this variant. It was part of the research on SP140's function and its loss-of-function implications in disease contexts, providing insights into the mechanisms underlying immune dysregulation.
title: Identification of topoisomerase as a precision-medicine target in chromatin reader SP140-driven Crohn’s disease

finding: The SNP rs13404184 disrupted the binding of transcription factor SPI1, which regulated the AD gene INPP5D specifically in the hippocampus.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs61068452 also disrupted the binding of transcription factor SPI1 regulating INPP5D, valid in both the hippocampus and lateral temporal lobe.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs71350303 disrupted RELA regulation of TNFAIP6 in the hippocampus.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: The study highlighted that carrying the minor allele at rs56967129 within hECE18<sup>FragA</sup> resulted in a significant fold change in luciferase activity when compared to the empty control vector. This indicated that the variant had a positive effect on enhancer activity.
title: An Engrailed1 enhancer underlies human thermoregulatory evolution

finding: Similar to rs56967129, the minor allele at rs146778681 enhanced luciferase activity significantly above the control. The finding reinforced the role of this SNP in upregulating the enhancer activity of hECE18.
title: An Engrailed1 enhancer underlies human thermoregulatory evolution

finding: The presence of the minor allele at rs769072620 also led to increased luciferase activity compared to the control vector, demonstrating its contribution to enhancer function.
title: An Engrailed1 enhancer underlies human thermoregulatory evolution

finding: The study found that the minor allele at rs529226880 corresponded with significant enhancement of luciferase activity over the control, indicating its positive influence on enhancer activity.
title: An Engrailed1 enhancer underlies human thermoregulatory evolution

finding: The rs1344706 polymorphism in ZNF804A was associated with changes in experience- and sleep-dependent, local and distributed neural network activity that supports offline information processing during sleep in a healthy population. The study demonstrated that while average motor sequencing task learning and sleep-dependent performance improvements were similar between genotype groups, significant differences were noted in neurophysiological traits. Specifically, CC participants exhibited increased slow-wave and spindle amplitudes as well as enhanced slow-wave coherence following a learning task, whereas AA participants displayed insensitivity to learning in terms of slow-wave and spindle activities.
title: Schizophrenia-associated variation at ZNF804A correlates with altered experience-dependent dynamics of sleep slow-waves and spindles in healthy young adults

finding: The SNP rs10166942[C], located 5' of the start codon of TRPM8, was found to be associated with reduced migraine risk. Homozygous individuals carrying the C allele expressed less TRPM8 and demonstrated lower sensitivity to cold compared to individuals with the T allele, which is associated with increased migraine predisposition.
title: The neurotrophin artemin and its receptor GFRα3 mediate migraine-like pain via the ion channel TRPM8

finding: The SNP rs13030422 was linked to insights regarding urine-derived components and their roles in the management of bladder cancer. The finding was significant as it related to the therapeutic implications and potential markers for diagnosis.
title: A Multi-Tissue Comparison and Molecular Characterization of Canine Organoids

finding: The study reported that the common variant rs35349669 in the INPP5D gene was associated with increased INPP5D levels, which conferred an increased risk for developing late-onset sporadic Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). This finding was significant as INPP5D encodes the phosphatase SHIP1, which is specifically expressed in microglia and implicated in Alzheimer’s disease pathology.
title: INPP5D limits plaque formation and glial reactivity in the APP/PS1 mouse model of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs10175462 at the PAX8 locus was noted as the first genome-wide significant risk SNP for cervical cancer identified outside of the HLA region in a European ancestry population.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: rs1550623-A, located in the intron region of the gene CDCA7, was identified as the strongest risk allele for breast cancer among European populations (frequency of 0.8469), but it was found to be fixed at 1 in both HM and other East Asians. This illustrates the significant differences in cancer susceptibility between HM people and other populations.
title: Differentiated genomic footprints and connections inferred from 440 Hmong-Mien genomes suggest their isolation and long-distance migration

finding: The SNP rs3827760 (A>G) within EDARV370A was noted for having the highest derived allele frequency among HM people. This variant was linked to phenotypic traits such as hair thickness and the quantity of mammary and eccrine glands, indicating a specific adaptation in East Asian populations.
title: Differentiated genomic footprints and connections inferred from 440 Hmong-Mien genomes suggest their isolation and long-distance migration

finding: The SNP rs72825667 was identified as a microglia-specific eQTL for the gene MERTK, which is involved in various biological processes. This finding emphasized the potential relevance of rs72825667 in regulating the expression of MERTK in microglia.
title: Cell-type specific inference from bulk RNA-sequencing data by integrating single cell reference profiles via EPIC-unmix

finding: The variant rs1367117 was associated with the peptide TSQC[T/I]LK of the Apolipoprotein B (APOB) protein. Although the study detected a strong association with LDL cholesterol levels, it did not establish a significant association at the protein level. This insight contributed to the understanding of the genetic architecture surrounding LDL-C and ApoB levels.
title: Nanoparticle Enrichment Mass-Spectrometry Proteomics Identifies Protein Altering Variants for Precise pQTL Mapping

finding: Research revealed that the rs1143627 polymorphism in the IL1B gene showed a significant association with the presence of IA-2A and ZnT8A autoantibodies in patients with Type 1 diabetes in a Chinese Han population.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The polymorphisms rs1143627 and rs1143643 in the IL1B gene were linked with the positivity rates of autoimmune markers in Type 1 diabetes, indicating a role in autoimmune mechanisms.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The functional variant rs6435156C>T in the BMPR2 gene was associated with an increased risk of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) in the Southern Chinese population, indicating its relevance in pulmonary diseases.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The AFF3 gene polymorphism (rs10865035) was found to be associated with an increased risk of rheumatoid arthritis in a population-based case-control study.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The study found the SNP rs41380347 was present in the sample syr013, where the individual was heterozygous, indicating lactose tolerance. This is significant as lactase persistence allows for milk digestion and is common among Arabian populations.
title: Bioarchaeological analysis of one of the earliest Islamic burials in the Levant

finding: The SNP rs17481869 located at 2p22.3 was characterized as an ATAC-QTL and was associated with susceptibility to B-ALL. Functional validation demonstrated that this variant exhibited differential allele-specific activity across several B-ALL cell lines, reinforcing its role in modulating chromatin accessibility related to B-ALL.
title: Epigenomic mapping in B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia identifies transcriptional regulators and noncoding variants promoting distinct chromatin architectures

finding: The SNP rs7566605 in the INSIG2 gene was associated with severe obesity in a study among Japanese participants. This finding indicated a link between genetic variation at this locus and obesity, which is a significant aspect of metabolic adaptation associated with environmental factors like diet.
title: Gene-by-environment interactions and adaptive body size variation in mice from the Americas

finding: The rs13419896/G allele in EPAS1 was identified as contributing to down-regulated mRNA expression levels in Sherpa highlanders compared to non-Sherpa lowlanders, aligning with hypoxia-tolerant traits by inhibiting excessive EPO production under high-altitude conditions.
title: Downregulations of mRNA expressions in the EPAS1 and EGLN1: Unraveling a genetic mechanism for high-altitude hypoxia adaptation in Sherpa highlanders

finding: The rs4953354/A allele in EPAS1 also exhibited down-regulatory effects on gene expression in Sherpa highlanders, supporting the native highlanders' adaptation to hypoxic environments through diminished mRNA levels and controlled EPO response.
title: Downregulations of mRNA expressions in the EPAS1 and EGLN1: Unraveling a genetic mechanism for high-altitude hypoxia adaptation in Sherpa highlanders

finding: The rs34290285 SNP was associated with asthma in a GWAS context, pointing to a u-sQTL in the D2HGDH gene. This variant produced an unproductive isoform with a premature termination codon (PTC), which led to the downregulation of D2HGDH expression levels. Although this finding was consistent with AS-NMD, the study found no colocalization with eQTL signals, leading to an independent eQTL signal indicated by rs71430382.
title: Global impact of aberrant splicing on human gene expression levels

finding: The rs71430382 SNP was identified as an independent eQTL in the same region as the D2HGDH gene, showing a stronger effect compared to the asthma-associated rs34290285. While it aligned with weaker GWAS signals, it confounded the overall colocalization of GWAS and eQTL signals, which were notably stronger in thyroid tissues compared to other tissues.
title: Global impact of aberrant splicing on human gene expression levels

finding: The SNP rs10196867 in the CTNNA2 gene was significantly associated with substance dependence (P=4.67×10⁻⁸), indicating its role in the genetic factors influencing addiction vulnerability in both alcoholism and drug dependence.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies common genetic risk factors for alcohol, heroin and methamphetamine dependence

finding: The SNP rs288326, a non-synonymous SNP, was identified for height with a PIP of 0.96, significantly higher than the PIP of 0.35 recorded by SuSiE, thereby demonstrating the enhanced resolution provided by PolyFun.
title: Functionally-informed fine-mapping and polygenic localization of complex trait heritability

finding: Associated with TN disease, having an OR of 0.90 (95% CI 0.86 to 0.93) and a p-value of 2.99×10^-9, and also showed weak associations with luminal A-like disease.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: As a fetal cortex eQTL for TBR1, rs13021985 was linked to neurodevelopmental processes, indicating its significance for brain morphology influencing cognitive abilities.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: This sequence variant encoded a missense variant impacting ACTR1B protein function, linking it to neuronal migration and highlighting its importance for cortical structure.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: The study reported a significant association between the lactase persistence SNP rs4988235 (with AA/AG genotypes considered lactase persistent and GG considered lactase non-persistent) and the relative abundance of <italic>Bifidobacterium</italic> species in the gut microbiome. Specifically, individuals carrying the GG genotype, which denotes lactase non-persistence, exhibited a greater relative abundance of various <italic>Bifidobacterium</italic> species compared to those with the AA/AG genotypes, who showed lower levels of these bacteria. Despite this difference, the analysis indicated that <italic>LCT</italic> genotypes could not be distinguished based on the specific <italic>Bifidobacterium</italic> strains present, but the overall trend highlighted a substantial presence of <italic>Bifidobacterium</italic> species in lactase non-persistent individuals.
title: Strain-level analysis of Bifidobacterium spp. from gut microbiomes of adults of differing lactase persistence genotypes

finding: The SNP rs34681162 was newly identified in relation to blood pressure traits and linked to ADAM17, a gene implicated in dysregulated coronary arteriole dilation, underscoring its potential relevance in vascular pathophysiology.
title: Chromatin interaction maps of human arterioles reveal new mechanisms for the genetic regulation of blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs9678851 was identified as being associated with systolic blood pressure (SBP) in a meta-analysis. It was linked to the gene SLC4A1AP, which is known to be significantly associated with hypertension and is involved in cardiovascular health.
title: Powerful statistical method to detect disease associated genes using publicly available GWAS summary data
