finding: The SNP rs780094 was found to be associated with plasma triglyceride concentration and identified as a novel quantitative trait locus in the context of lipid traits. It is located in the gene region of GCKR and was found to interact with other genes such as SUPT7L and SLC4A1AP within the linkage disequilibrium interval.
title: Powerful statistical method to detect disease associated genes using publicly available GWAS summary data

finding: The rs12712928 variant was associated with fasting glucose (FG) and demonstrated allelic differences in transcriptional activity and binding of transcription factors. It also showed significant associations with gene expression levels of SIX3 and SIX2.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The SNP rs4988235 was identified as the causal derived allele associated with lactase persistence in Europeans. It was reported to be in complete linkage disequilibrium with an insertion variant located within the first intron of the lactase gene (LCT), which is a well-known example of adaptive evolution in European populations. The original study indicated that the human reference genome carries the derived deleted allele, while this insertion is believed to have occurred via an Alu-mediated non-allelic homologous recombination event approximately 520,000 years ago. This finding highlighted the functional relationship between rs4988235 and the aforementioned SV, which includes 11 predicted transcription factor binding sites.
title: De novo assembly of 64 haplotype-resolved human genomes of diverse ancestry and integrated analysis of structural variation

finding: The MERTK rs4374383 polymorphism was found to predict the progression of liver fibrosis in hepatitis C virus-infected patients, suggesting a significant relationship with liver disease severity. Additionally, it was reported that this polymorphism affected the severity of fibrosis in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, indicating its role in liver health and injury response. Furthermore, the same variant was associated with the prediction of incident nonalcoholic fatty liver disease and diabetes, indicating its importance in metabolic-related liver conditions.
title: Differential TAM receptor regulation of hepatic physiology and injury

finding: The SNP rs17831251 was associated with a human-specific, podocyte-specific regulatory region of the PLA2R1 gene. This finding was related to kidney disease and highlighted the significance of this particular enhancer region in the context of gene activity and chromatin accessibility, underscoring the importance of developmental modeling in clinical insights regarding renal health.
title: Comparative single-cell analyses identify shared and divergent features of human and mouse kidney development

finding: The SNP rs3771180 was associated with asthma and was identified as an eQTL in a whole blood dataset by the GTEx project. It affected the binding of TF motifs related to inflammatory responses in HELA cells, particularly influencing upstream regulation of the Interleukin Receptor 1 gene.
title: RSAT Var-tools: an accessible and flexible framework to predict the impact of regulatory variants on transcription factor binding

finding: The T300A substitution in the gene ATG16L1 was associated with an increased risk of Crohn's Disease (CD), but it also conferred protective effects against lethal Salmonella enterica Typhimurium infection when present as a heterozygous allele. This finding explained its prevalence in the population, as heterozygosity promoted enhanced cytokine production through inflammasome activation, whereas homozygosity impaired essential autophagy-related processes.
title: Heterozygosity for Crohn’s Disease Risk Allele of ATG16L1 Protects against Bacterial Infection

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel BMI locus at PAX3 and validated in HISLA Stage 2 analyses, showing strong association with BMI.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The rs11575194 SNP near the IGFBP5 gene showed a strong association with IGFBP-5 serum levels and birth weight. However, it did not have significant correlations with height or SHR, indicating that its effects on growth may be independent of serum levels and might interact with other factors influencing birth weight.
title: Protein QTL analysis of IGF-I and its binding proteins provides insights into growth biology

finding: The SNP rs3754673 in the NPAS2 gene was associated with OC traits at a significant level (p=7.8x10^-7) as per the stratified False Discovery Rate analysis, further reinforcing the genetic implications of CNS development in obsessive-compulsive traits.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pediatric Obsessive-Compulsive Traits: Shared Genetic Risk between Traits and Disorder

finding: The variant rs62107263 in the ALKAL2 gene was found to have G×E effects on BMI, and was associated with obesity and body fat distribution.
title: Genome-wide scale analyses identify novel BMI genotype-environment interactions using a conditional false discovery rate

finding: The variant rs62107261, linked to rs62107263 in D’=1, was previously associated with obesity and body fat distribution.
title: Genome-wide scale analyses identify novel BMI genotype-environment interactions using a conditional false discovery rate

finding: The variant rs74676797 in the TMEM18 gene was shown to have G×E effects and is in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs13021737, which was previously associated with BMI and obesity.
title: Genome-wide scale analyses identify novel BMI genotype-environment interactions using a conditional false discovery rate

finding: The variant rs13021737, in perfect LD with rs74676797, has been associated with BMI and obesity.
title: Genome-wide scale analyses identify novel BMI genotype-environment interactions using a conditional false discovery rate

finding: The rs1049359-tagged CRE was shown to regulate two distal target genes, RNF181 and TMSB10, confirmed through CRISPR screening and RT-qPCR analysis, highlighting its role in a multiple causal pattern.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs1143634, encoding a synonymous substitution, showed a small but significant differential expression of IL1B among genotypes at 2 and 7 hours post-LPS stimulation, indicating a potential influence on inflammatory responses relevant to IBD.
title: The association between transcriptional regulation of macrophage differentiation and activation and genetic susceptibility to inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs2975760 within the CAPN10 gene was associated with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM), based on a study that highlighted its role as a genetic risk factor for this metabolic disorder.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs3792267 in the CAPN10 gene was found to be associated with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM), as determined in studies that established its contribution to the susceptibility of this condition.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The rs1143634 C/T variant in IL1B exhibited an association with blood lipid levels, such as LDL and total cholesterol, in the Eastern Chinese Han population, indicating its potential influence on MI susceptibility.
title: In-silico analysis of Myocardial Infarction-related missense SNPs to identify novel biomarkers to predict susceptibility

finding: This sentinel cis pQTL associated with higher ERBB4 levels (p=1.0×10-195, effect=0.22 SD) and was linked to lower BMI, supporting implications of ERBB4 in obesity.
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: The variant correlated with a decrease in BMI (p=2×10-23, effect=-0.01 SD), indicating a relationship with ERBB4 levels and obesity.
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: The rs232230 SNP in the IGKC gene, which caused a nonsynonymous variant (V->L), was identified as a risk factor for both gastric and breast cancer with odds ratios of 1.64 and 1.94 respectively. The allele was present in 1,066 haplotypes from the G1K samples, displaying an even distribution across various human populations.
title: Population matched (PM) germline allelic variants of immunoglobulin (IG) loci: New pmIG database to better understand IG repertoire and selection processes in disease and vaccination

finding: The SNP rs6759814, located in the gene KCNH7, was associated with valine levels. The homozygosity of the minor C allele showed strong significance related to metabolic pathways, specifically implicating its role in glutamatergic synaptic transmission pathways.
title: Recessive genetic effects on type 2 diabetes-related metabolites in a consanguineous population

finding: The genetic effect on the expression of the IGKV1-27 gene in males was observed to disappear by late puberty, linking hormonal changes during puberty to genetic regulation of gene expression.
title: Analysis of transcriptional changes in the immune system associated with pubertal development in a longitudinal cohort of children with asthma

finding: The SNP rs13010042 was shown to be linked with the processes regulating mRNA export in cancer. The study indicated that this SNP could influence RNA maturation and its subsequent translation, which could play a role in malignancies including AML.
title: The eukaryotic translation initiation factor eIF4E reprogrammes the splicing machinery and drives alternative splicing

finding: The caQTL and clQTL rs2692224 influenced chromatin accessibility and chromosomal interaction at the FN1 locus, with allele C showing greater accessibility and chromosomal contact compared to allele A, thus linking FN1 expression to TGFβ1 signaling in CAD.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapped for TCF21 binding, chromatin accessibility and chromosomal looping in coronary artery smooth muscle cells reveal molecular mechanisms of coronary disease loci

finding: The SNP rs1344706 was reported as a psychosis risk variant that correlated with the expression of ZNF804A in human brain tissue. This finding was highlighted in the context of its association with schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depressive disorder, indicating its potential role in these psychiatric conditions.
title: Schizophrenia Risk Proteins ZNF804A and NT5C2 Interact at Synapses

finding: The LPIN1 rs13412852 polymorphism was reported as a significant factor within pediatric nonalcoholic fatty liver disease. The research suggested that this SNP was associated with the disease's histological features, contributing to the overall understanding of genetic influences on pediatric NAFLD.
title: Comparative Analysis of Global Hepatic Gene Expression in Adolescents and Adults with Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease

finding: The SNP rs13035725 was identified as a risk locus for inflammatory bowel disease and ulcerative colitis, being significantly associated with expression of multiple genes relevant for neutrophil migration.
title: Variation in PU.1 binding and chromatin looping at neutrophil enhancers influences autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs4674259 was noted as a significant shared SNP between tfQTL and GWAS data sets, underscoring its possible linkage to immune functions.
title: Variation in PU.1 binding and chromatin looping at neutrophil enhancers influences autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs9712275 was significant for both PU.1 QTL and Crohn’s disease, showing association with multiple active histone marks and an eQTL for the PLCL1 gene.
title: Variation in PU.1 binding and chromatin looping at neutrophil enhancers influences autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs6738825 was involved in significant associations relevant to Crohn’s disease and displayed high PCHi-C connectivity to the PLCL1 gene, suggesting its importance in disease modulation.
title: Variation in PU.1 binding and chromatin looping at neutrophil enhancers influences autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The variant rs1250229-T in the fibronectin gene was associated with a decreased risk of coronary artery disease, which underscores its protective role in cardiovascular health.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs117888248 was strongly associated with increased risk of severe illness in COVID-19. It had an odds ratio of 1.84 for hospitalization and 2.09 for requiring mechanical ventilation, indicating a significant impact on COVID-19 severity. This SNP was part of a haplotype derived from Neandertals, which demonstrated that carriers faced an approximately 80% increased risk of hospitalization and a 109% increased risk of requiring mechanical ventilation.
title: The MERS-CoV receptor gene is among COVID-19 risk factors inherited from Neandertals

finding: The SNP rs744373 was noted as a significant variant associated with LOAD, specifically linked to faster amyloid-beta associated tau accumulation and cognitive decline, underscoring its role as a risk SNP in LOAD pathogenesis.
title: Integrative single-nucleus multi-omics analysis prioritizes candidate cis and trans regulatory networks and their target genes in Alzheimer’s disease brains

finding: The G-allele of rs78349146 at 2q24.2 was found to be associated with increased risk of major depression (MD) in the Hispanic/Latinx group, with an effect allele frequency of 0.04, a beta of 0.15, and a significant P value of 9.32×10⁻⁹. This variant is located downstream of the gene LINC01806 and was shown to colocalize with the expression quantitative trait loci (eQTLs) for DPP4, RBMS1, and TANK.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of major depression aids locus discovery, fine-mapping, gene prioritisation, and causal inference

finding: The SNP rs780094 showed associations with diabetes and lipid metabolism, highlighting its relevance in metabolic health.
title: NETMAGE: a humaN-disEase phenoType MAp GEnerator for the Visualization of PheWAS

finding: The rs3754648 variant was intronic to AGAP1 and associated with hemifacial microsomia, a disorder affecting facial patterning that often coincides with dental phenotypes. This variant lies within a human craniofacial superenhancer region.
title: “Integration of multimodal data in the developing tooth reveals candidate dental disease genes”

finding: At the MCM6 / LCT locus (rs4988235), it was found that the derived allele associated with lactase persistence began increasing in frequency around 7,000 years ago and has continued to rise up to the present. This selection was correlated with the introduction of farming practices, prior to the expansion of Yamnaya pastoralists into Europe.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: In the WHG background, strong selection at rs12465802 occurred within the last 2,000 years, suggesting that different ancestral backgrounds exhibited distinct selective pressures at the MCM6 / LCT locus.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: The rs780094 SNP, which affects glucokinase regulation, was associated with several clinical traits including triglycerides and LDL cholesterol levels, as well as diseases like coronary artery disease and gout across five different populations.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: The SNP rs7569427 was noted as an intronic variant in the MLPH gene at the 2q37.3 locus, showing a P-value of 0.02, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing smoking behavior.
title: Mixed-model admixture mapping identifies smoking-dependent loci of lung function in African Americans

finding: The SNP rs2280289 was characterized as a missense variant in the RAB17 gene at the 2q37.3 locus, with a P-value of 0.036. This SNP was previously related to smoking cessation success, supporting its role in the smoking-related genetic landscape.
title: Mixed-model admixture mapping identifies smoking-dependent loci of lung function in African Americans

finding: The rs880890 variant was positively associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) and hypertension. The A allele demonstrated a significant increase in enhancer activity (40% more than the G allele) under shear stress conditions, which is crucial for endothelial function. The presence of the A allele led to increased binding of heat shock factors (HSFs) that regulate CALCRL expression, contributing to the modulation of key signaling pathways such as eNOS and angiogenesis. CRISPR deletion of the rs880890-harboring enhancer showed a significant downregulation of CALCRL expression, reinforcing the SNP's role in CAD risk through altered endothelial functions.
title: Coronary Artery Disease risk variant dampens the expression of CALCRL by reducing HSF binding to shear stress responsive enhancer in endothelial cells

finding: The SNP rs938662, residing in the PRKCE locus, was identified as a genome-wide significant pQTL in the 500FG cohort with a P value of 4.37 × 10−8, correlating with protein networks upon Candida stimulation.
title: Integration of Candida albicans-induced single-cell gene expression data and circulatory protein concentrations reveal genetic regulators of inflammation

finding: rs6759626 was in high LD with rs10930089, which overlaps a verified TSS of an unannotated transcript related to general cognitive ability.
title: A catalog of transcription start sites across 115 human tissue and cell types

finding: rs9287826 was in high LD with rs10930089, which overlaps a verified TSS of an unannotated transcript associated with general cognitive ability.
title: A catalog of transcription start sites across 115 human tissue and cell types

finding: rs10930089 overlaps with a RAMPAGE-verified unannotated TSS (ZH38T0028803), showing high expression in neuronal and cardiac tissues, and was linked to the KCNH7 gene, which has associations with bipolar disorder and treatment response in schizophrenia.
title: A catalog of transcription start sites across 115 human tissue and cell types

finding: The rs1367117 variant, p.Thr98Ile, was identified in a credible set related to the gene APOB, which encodes the main protein component of LDL. This variant had associations with various lipid biomarkers in large GWAS across different ancestries, and it also demonstrated a potential maternal-specific association with adiposity in family studies. The successful identification of this variant using RSparsePro contrasted with previous attempts using SuSiE, which failed likely due to LD discrepancies.
title: Robust fine-mapping in the presence of linkage disequilibrium mismatch

finding: The rs1260326 variant, p.Leu446Pro, was part of a credible set based on the European ancestry GWAS related to the gene GCKR. This variant was located in a ChromHMM-predicted enhancer in the liver and in a promoter-interacting region detected in the HepG2 cell line. Findings implied a causal effect of this variant, potentially through the regulation of glucokinase activity and carbohydrate metabolism in the liver.
title: Robust fine-mapping in the presence of linkage disequilibrium mismatch

finding: The mutation in ADCY3 (rs6545800) was identified in patients with inflammatory bowel diseases, indicating its role in the pathophysiology of conditions such as Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.
title: A forskolin-mediated increase in cAMP promotes T helper cell differentiation into the Th1 and Th2 subsets rather than into the Th17 subset

finding: The SNP rs13010049 was linked to gene expression changes observed during colorectal cancer progression under low-dose metronomic chemotherapy, suggesting it played a role in the modulation of angiogenesis-related genes. This finding highlighted the potential of genetic variants in influencing cancer treatment responses.
title: Longitudinal examination of perfusion and angiogenesis markers in primary colorectal tumors shows distinct signatures for metronomic and maximum-tolerated dose strategies

finding: The SNP rs1402398 was confirmed as strongly associated with epilepsy in the French-Canadian cohort. It was located in a non-coding region surrounding the FANCL and BCL11A genes, which have been linked to epilepsies through other studies, although functional or clinical evidence for their roles was lacking. This association was part of the replication of the largest GWAS on epilepsies.
title: Polygenic risk scores of several subtypes of epilepsies in a founder population

finding: The SNP rs4665630 was also replicated in the study and was associated with epilepsy. This SNP was found in a genomic region devoid of identified epilepsy-associated genes; therefore, its role in the disorder remains unclear. The replication of this association contributed to the understanding of the genetic factors in epilepsy.
title: Polygenic risk scores of several subtypes of epilepsies in a founder population

finding: The SNP rs4452212 was identified as a strong candidate for differentiating Middle Eastern populations from European populations. This intergenic variant has previously been linked to telomere length variation within Europe and between Europe and Africa.
title: Exploring ancestry inference of the Middle East

finding: The rs6753933 SNP was found to colocalise with a GWAS hit for lymphocyte count in CD4+ T cells at the RBMS1 locus. The analysis revealed that the effect sizes of the RBMS1 eQTL were highly reproducible across various eQTL Catalogue datasets, providing robust evidence for its role in regulating lymphocyte counts.
title: eQTL Catalogue: a compendium of uniformly processed human gene expression and splicing QTLs

finding: The rs6740960 SNP at the 2p21 locus was identified as significantly associated with normal-range variation in jaw shape and with an increased risk of non-syndromic orofacial clefting (nsCL/P) within European populations. The T allele conferred outward protrusion of the lower jaw and zygomatic region, while being linked to a predisposition for nsCL/P, evidenced by a p-value of 5.71 × 10^-13. Mechanistically, it was shown that this SNP resides in a craniofacial enhancer regulating PKDCC expression, impacting craniofacial morphogenesis through alterations in gene dosage.
title: A common cis-regulatory variant impacts normal-range and disease-associated human facial shape through regulation of PKDCC during chondrogenesis

finding: The rs1047891 variant in the <italic>CPS1</italic> gene demonstrated significant sex-stratified metabolic associations across multiple amino acids and lipids, exhibiting a markedly stronger effect in females.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The rs1106639 variant was associated with 2-hydroxyglutarate in conjunction with <italic>D2HGDH</italic>, confirming prior reports.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The rs1509567 associated with nonanoylcarnitine within <italic>ACADL</italic> corroborated findings from earlier analyses.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The rs13306206 variant in the APOB gene increased the risk of CAD development and was correlated with elevated levels of serum total cholesterol (β TC-raw = 19.9 mg/dL, P TC-adjusted = 8.6 x 10−155).
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: This SNP achieved a high posterior probability of 0.49 in eQTL analyses at the ITGA4 locus, revealing it as a likely candidate causal variant for IBD, significantly stronger than the original IBD GWAS lead variant.
title: Genetic associations at regulatory phenotypes improve fine-mapping of causal variants for twelve immune-mediated diseases

finding: Variant rs1506537 was predicted to increase GATA4-DNA binding affinity significantly compared to the reference allele. In in vitro binding assays, it exhibited the highest binding with a measurable affinity of 451.7 nM for the alternate allele. Additionally, this variant was associated with increased expression of the gene MRPL33 in cardiac tissue.
title: Cardiovascular Disease-Associated Non-Coding Variants Disrupt GATA4-DNA Binding and Regulatory Functions

finding: The study established that rs117701653, located in the CD28/CTLA4/ICOS locus, was a causal non-coding variant affecting the risk for rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and type 1 diabetes (T1D). The disease-associated allele A reduced the binding affinity of the chromatin regulator SMCHD1, which in turn led to enhanced expression of ICOS in CD4+ memory T cells. This elevated ICOS expression correlated with an increase in circulating T peripheral helper (Tph) cells, particularly in patients with RA, implicating rs117701653 in a pathogenic pathway linked to these autoimmune conditions. Enhanced Tph cell abundance was observed in subjects with the A/A genotype compared to A/C and C/C genotypes.
title: Non-coding autoimmune risk variant accelerates T peripheral helper cell development via ICOS

finding: The association of the SNP rs2683616 was linked to AUDIT-C score and was tagged by rs1402398, indicating it was part of the novel findings related to alcohol consumption.
title: Meta-analysis of problematic alcohol use in 435,563 individuals identifies 29 risk variants and yields insights into biology, pleiotropy and causality

finding: The SNP rs1344706 was identified as a psychosis risk variant that regulated the expression of the ZNF804A gene in the human brain. This finding was significant in the context of psychiatric disorders such as schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depressive disorder.
title: Long-read sequencing reveals the complex splicing profile of the psychiatric risk gene CACNA1C in human brain

finding: The SNP rs141063413 demonstrated a significant association with chromatin accessibility and expression of the FOXD4L1 gene specifically in neurons, confirming its role in gene expression and supporting the hypothesis of a progenitor-specific mediation effect.
title: Inferring cell-type-specific causal gene regulatory networks during human neurogenesis

finding: The rs849563 SNP within the neuropilin 2 (Nrp2) locus was associated with susceptibility to autism spectrum disorder (ASD) in an Iranian population. The finding, reported by Hosseinpour et al. in 2017, highlighted the genetic variation's relevance to the development and behavioral characterization of ASD, consistent with the broader context of Nrp2's role in neuronal processes.
title: Reduced Hippocampal Inhibition and Enhanced Autism-Epilepsy Comorbidity in Mice Lacking Neuropilin 2

finding: The SNP rs6733839 was shown to create a transcription factor (TF) motif for the MEF2 family, predicting increased chromatin accessibility at the BIN1 enhancer in microglia. This risk variant was linked to higher expression levels of the Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk gene BIN1, potentially through enhanced binding of TFs SPI1 and MEF2A.
title: A comparative atlas of single-cell chromatin accessibility in the human brain

finding: The SNP rs13020307 was noted in the context of 3D cell cultures as effective models for studying extracellular vesicles in cancer, supporting the idea that this SNP may influence cancer biology through its effects on EV production.
title: Investigating the impact of fibroblast proximity to a tumor on fibroblast extracellular vesicle production utilizing 3D bioprinted stromal models

finding: The E627* variant (rs35744605) was associated with protection from type 1 diabetes (T1D). This SNP was noted as rare and linked to a loss of MDA5-dependent signaling.
title: Molecular basis of autoimmune disease protection by MDA5 variants

finding: The R843H variant (rs3747517) was associated with a protective effect against type 1 diabetes (T1D) and was common within certain populations. This SNP contributes to a loss of MDA5-dependent signaling.
title: Molecular basis of autoimmune disease protection by MDA5 variants

finding: The I923V variant (rs35667974) was reported as rare and resulted in protection against type 1 diabetes (T1D). Its associated activity was linked with impaired cellular interferon response to viral infections.
title: Molecular basis of autoimmune disease protection by MDA5 variants

finding: The T946A variant (rs1990760) was commonly associated with protection from type 1 diabetes (T1D) due to a relevant base pair substitution. This SNP also indicated a loss of MDA5-dependent signaling.
title: Molecular basis of autoimmune disease protection by MDA5 variants

finding: The variant rs774930016 (S105N) in the GCKR gene was associated with significantly increased serum triglyceride (TG) levels in a cohort of Sikh individuals, with a beta value of 0.59 (p=7 × 10^−4) after adjusting for age, gender, and BMI. This finding persisted in the replication cohort, indicating a robust association with hypertriglyceridemia (HTG). It was noted to explain 38% of the genetic variance associated with HTG in the studied population.
title: Targeted sequencing of candidate genes of dyslipidemia in Punjabi Sikhs: Population-specific rare variants in GCKR promote ectopic fat deposition

finding: The variant rs755537970 (R553W) also showed a marginally significant association with triglyceride levels in combined samples, with a beta of 0.51 (p=0.028). This finding suggested a potential role in contributing to hypertriglyceridemia, although it was less significant compared to rs774930016.
title: Targeted sequencing of candidate genes of dyslipidemia in Punjabi Sikhs: Population-specific rare variants in GCKR promote ectopic fat deposition

finding: The rs1260326 variant in GCKR was confirmed to be associated with triglyceride metabolism in Sikhs, demonstrating a beta of 0.09 (p=3.42 × 10^−5). This variant, previously recognized in Caucasian studies, showed different risk allele frequencies across populations but explained less than 2% of the genetic variance for TG in Sikhs. Importantly, the association remained statistically significant even when controlling for other factors.
title: Targeted sequencing of candidate genes of dyslipidemia in Punjabi Sikhs: Population-specific rare variants in GCKR promote ectopic fat deposition

finding: The SNP rs917997 was identified as both a significant cis pQTL and a methylation QTL for IL18R1 levels. It was causally associated with circulating IL18R1 levels and its role in regulating IL18R1 through DNA methylation was confirmed.
title: Integrative omics approach to identify the molecular architecture of inflammatory protein levels in healthy older adults

finding: This SNV in the EDAR gene had a very high allele frequency (0.93) and displayed a strong iHS score in various Han groups, indicating substantial selection pressure related to adaptations in hair and skin development.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: The rs3087243 variant was identified as the lead eQTL for CTLA4, which is associated with rheumatoid arthritis. It exhibited strongest eQTL effects in cytotoxic CD4+ T cells, despite the low overall expression of CTLA4 in these cells. This finding highlighted that pathogenic variants can modulate gene expression even in states where gene expression levels are low.
title: Modeling memory T cell states at single-cell resolution identifies in vivo state-dependence of eQTLs influencing disease

finding: The rs11123923 variant was identified as the lead eQTL for IL18R1 and was highlighted for its association with inflammatory bowel disease. It exhibited the strongest effects in TH2 and TH17 states.
title: Modeling memory T cell states at single-cell resolution identifies in vivo state-dependence of eQTLs influencing disease

finding: The SNP rs1250259 was identified as a coding variant within the fibronectin gene (FN1) that negatively impacted FN1 secretion when the risk allele (rs1250259-A) was present, leading to lower FN1 levels and increased risk of coronary artery disease (CAD). Experimental evidence demonstrated that the CAD protective allele (rs1250259-T) increased FN1 secretion, indicating its role in the pathogenesis of CAD.
title: A common polymorphism that protects from cardiovascular disease increases fibronectin processing and secretion

finding: The SNP rs7603674 was part of the strongest signal of transmission distortion (TD) identified at the end of chromosome 2, with a transmission rate of 56.2% for donor NC18, significantly differing from binomial expectations.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: SNP rs7578293 also contributed to the strongest signal of transmission distortion at chromosome 2 for donor NC18, indicating it was associated with a transmission rate of 56.2%.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: The finding for SNP rs7567762 was included in the strongest TD signal at the end of chromosome 2, reflecting a transmission anomaly with a rate of 56.2%.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: SNP rs12478306 was identified within the context of the strongest TD signal on chromosome 2, showing a transmission rate of 56.2% for donor NC18.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: The SNP rs2084684 was part of the strongest signal of TD at the end of chromosome 2, associated with a transmission rate of 56.2% for donor NC18.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: SNP rs2385305 contributed to the strongest signal of transmission distortion on chromosome 2, with a notable transmission rate of 56.2%.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: The finding for SNP rs2100268 was included among the SNPs exhibiting the strongest TD signal at chromosome 2, recorded at a transmission rate of 56.2%.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: The minor allele of rs142787485, located in the 3' UTR of the RAB10 gene, was associated with lower LDL-C levels in carriers. Functional analysis showed that this allele disrupted binding sites for two microRNA species, leading to increased transcript stability and subsequently, higher protein levels of RAB10. A cell-based experiment revealed that HepG2 cells expressing the minor allele exhibited a 9% increase in GFP-RAB10 protein levels compared to cells with the major allele.
title: Systematic elucidation of genetic mechanisms underlying cholesterol uptake

finding: The SNP rs13030580 was identified as a significant factor related to the therapeutic efficacy of sonodynamic therapy (SDT) when combined with 5-ALA in glioblastoma treatment. Specifically, it was associated with the modulation of apoptotic cell death and upregulation of reactive oxygen species in primary glioma cells.
title: Development and Optimisation of in vitro Sonodynamic Therapy for Glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs13384965 was associated with an intron variant in the CYTIP gene, which was found to be up-regulated in T2D islets. This finding suggested a strong or causal role for CYTIP in Type 2 diabetes (T2D) at the genetic level.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes- and obesity-associated human β-cells using deep transfer learning

finding: The lincRNA AC105393.1 variant rs62106258 was found to be pleiotropic for BMI, smoking, and type 2 diabetes, helping to elucidate its role in metabolic pathways.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: The rs4442975 SNP was associated with breast cancer susceptibility and was located near an enhancer that interacted with the promoter region of IGFBP5, resulting in allele-specific expression where the G-allele led to lower IGFBP5 expression and increased breast cancer risk.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The rs721048 variant was significantly related to prostate cancer susceptibility, forming contact with an enhancer that regulates EHBP1 expression, thus linking it to tumor development.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The SNP rs13010047 was linked to the expression of FGFR1, which is associated with glioblastoma progression. Higher FGFR1 expression correlated with significantly poorer survival rates in glioblastoma patients, thereby reflecting the importance of this SNP in the context of glioblastoma lethality and therapy resistance.
title: Spatial distribution and functional relevance of FGFR1 and FGFR2 expression for glioblastoma tumor invasion

finding: The common regulatory variant rs560887 was identified as influencing expression levels of G6PC2, showing an association with increased FG and HbA1c levels due to its effect on G6PC2 isoform expression.
title: Tissue-Specific Alteration of Metabolic Pathways Influences Glycemic Regulation

finding: The SNP rs4664308 was associated with the risk of idiopathic membranous nephropathy in a meta-analysis conducted in 2020. The findings from this study indicated that this polymorphism in the PLA2R1 gene could increase the likelihood of developing this particular renal condition.
title: The timing of human adaptation from Neanderthal introgression

finding: The SNP rs3783513 was identified as being associated with endometriosis risk variants. It was mapped to the chromosome 2q14.1 locus using a GWAS P-value threshold of p<5x10-8, indicating its significance in the genetic landscape of endometriosis. Further investigation into the expression quantitative trait loci (eQTLs) revealed its role in regulating IL1A expression, which was connected to the risk of developing endometriosis.
title: M2 Macrophages are Major Mediators of Germline Risk of Endometriosis and Explain Pleiotropy with Comorbid Traits

finding: Similar to rs3783513, the SNP rs10167914 was also associated with endometriosis in the chromosome 2q14.1 locus under the same GWAS criteria. It was involved in the regulation of expression for associated genes through eQTL analysis, further emphasizing its significance in understanding the genetic susceptibility to endometriosis.
title: M2 Macrophages are Major Mediators of Germline Risk of Endometriosis and Explain Pleiotropy with Comorbid Traits

finding: This variant was associated with a CM spanning CD207 in Monocytes, localizing in an intergenic enhancer region, modulating the epigenome affecting both CLEC4F and CD207 expressions.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The SNP rs10928560 was found to be associated with OSA, located near the C-X-C motif chemokine receptor 4 (CXCR4) gene, with a p-value of 2.8 x 10^-8. This variant contributed to the understanding of genetic risk factors for OSA.
title: Genetic analysis of obstructive sleep apnoea discovers a strong association with cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs3749034 was linked to bipolar disorder, being associated with the hsa-miR-504 pathway, illustrating its potential impact on psychiatric conditions.
title: Synonymous SNPs of viral genes facilitate virus to escape host antiviral RNAi immunity

finding: The rs11678116 SNP was associated with migraine, revealing a functional linkage between genotype and phenotype. It contributed to the transcription regulation of the Lipid-Droplet Associated Hydrolase (LDAH) gene by forming a glucocorticoid receptor (GR) binding motif, which decreased cortisol-responsive enhancer activity in the T/T genotype, leading to lower LDAH expression after cortisol treatment. This finding highlighted the potential mechanisms linking rs11678116 to elevated cholesterol and triglyceride levels in migraine patients.
title: Glucocorticoids Unmask Silent Non-Coding Genetic Risk Variants for Common Diseases

finding: The variant rs17321999 at 2p23.1 was associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and varicose veins, indicating a genetic overlap and potential shared pathobiology.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs9967884 showed significant association with varicose veins in the meta-analysis, with high linkage disequilibrium with rs17321999 at 2p23.1, further supporting the genetic link to SLE.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs3791679 was confirmed to be associated with varicose veins, residing in an enhancer region of EFEMP1, a gene critical for elastic tissue integrity.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs2861819 was identified in an intergenic region near PPP3R1, indicating its potential role in T-cell signaling and involvement in varicose veins pathology.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: Variant rs6752964 at the 2p21 locus showed a unique metabolic discordance, where its association indicated increased abdominal obesity but reported protection from type 2 diabetes, potentially linked to THADA and THADA-AS expression.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: The analysis of rs10804244 indicated that the G>A variant weakened a binding site for the IRF transcription factor. This finding was derived from the predictions of a convolutional regression model trained on GM12878 DNase-seq data, where nucleotide-resolution importance scores highlighted a disrupted IRF motif associated with this variant.
title: gReLU: A comprehensive framework for DNA sequence modeling and design

finding: The rs10496099 T>C variant in the EHBP1 gene was associated with decreased hepatic EHBP1 expression and augmented nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) fibrosis in patients. Further analysis indicated that the C allele was linked to a higher prevalence of liver steatosis (≥2), necroinflammation (≥1), and fibrosis (>1) in a cohort of 1367 NAFLD patients. This variant was characterized as loss-of-function, highlighting EHBP1's protective role against the progression of NASH.
title: Cholesterol-associated Locus EHBP1 Protects against NASH Fibrosis

finding: Individual PVP28 was originally typed as homozygous for rs12473206-G but was confirmed to be heterozygous, compatible with the observed read mapping.
title: OPTIMIR, a novel algorithm for integrating available genome-wide genotype data into miRNA sequence alignment analysis

finding: The variant rs372272284 at the EPAS1 locus was fixed in Denisovans but had the human reference allele in all Neanderthals. It was associated with decreased hemoglobin levels in Tibetans, and it strengthened a canonical splice site, resulting in a donor gain.
title: Resurrecting the Alternative Splicing Landscape of Archaic Hominins using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs10933431, found intronically within INPP5D, was significantly associated with taurine and hypotaurine metabolism in astrocytes, with a p-value of 5.60×10⁻⁴. This finding implies a potential dysregulation of these metabolic processes in relation to Alzheimer's disease.
title: gsQTL: Associating genetic risk variants with gene sets by exploiting their shared variability

finding: SNP rs13010035 was positively linked to metabolic reprogramming in fibroblasts associated with both breast cancer and rheumatoid arthritis. This underscored a metabolic convergence in fibroblast behavior across different pathological contexts.
title: Hybrid computational modeling highlights reverse Warburg effect in breast cancer-associated fibroblasts

finding: The missense variant rs767802807 in the GLI2 gene was identified in a family with diabetes. This variant, characterized as c.4661C>T (p.P1554L), was shown to have altered transcriptional activity and impaired differentiation into pancreatic beta-like cells in isogenic iPSC lines. The study emphasized a novel implication of this variant in diabetes predisposition.
title: Heterozygous missense variant in GLI2 impairs human endocrine pancreas development

finding: The SNP rs3769821 was identified as a peak eSNP for CASP8, showing a significant eQTL effect (p = 1.24 x 10^-8). It colocalised with risk loci for multiple malignancies, including breast cancer and melanoma, indicating its importance in cancer pathogenesis associated with immune response.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: The SNP rs1866140 was characterized as a peak eSNP for GNLY, with p = 8.86 x 10^-23. It was involved in a trans regulatory network influencing the expression of multiple genes, emphasizing its regulatory role in NK cell biology.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: Rs62158211, linked with AC016745.1, demonstrated associations with functional connectivity traits, underlining its relevance in brain network activity.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: The UGT1A1 rs887829 C/C genotype was associated with elevated glucose levels during the glucose tolerance test after olanzapine treatment, suggesting its role in glucose metabolism influenced by the drug.
title: Metabolic effects of aripiprazole and olanzapine multiple-dose treatment in healthy volunteers. Association with pharmacogenetics

finding: This SNP in the ZNF804A gene also showed positive selection signals with an estimated operation duration of 17,143 years and was linked to adaptations to psychosocial stress, prevailing in European populations with a strong correlation to yardstick PFS-26.
title: Global adaptive evolution involved in neuroticism and educational behaviors through the spread of anatomically modern humans

finding: The study highlighted that rs1344706 was associated with the expression levels of the ZNF804A gene in the human brain. This gene exhibited alterations in expression that were linked to schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depressive disorder. The findings emphasized that this transcript was regulated fetally by the psychosis risk variant rs1344706, suggesting its relevance in the heritability and diagnostic differences among these mental illnesses.
title: Deep transcriptome sequencing of subgenual anterior cingulate cortex reveals disorder-specific expression changes in major psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs6430538 was found to have a significant effect on the risk of Alzheimer’s disease (AD). This finding emerged from a study that integrated multi-omics data, which highlighted the role of genetic variants in influencing the clinical outcomes associated with AD. The context of this finding was centered around enhancing the understanding of AD risk factors and the potential for early intervention strategies.
title: WIMOAD: Weighted Integration of Multi-Omics data for Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) Diagnosis

finding: The SNP was associated with the ASE of BIN1, further demonstrating its importance in Alzheimer's disease pathways.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs13020261 was associated with the Unfolded Protein Response (UPR) pathway activation in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). This association suggested a potential link between this genetic variant and the effectiveness of treatments that target metabolic pathways involved in PDAC.
title: PGM3 inhibition Shows cooperative Effects With Erastin inducing Pancreatic cancer cell death via activation of the Unfolded Protein Response

finding: The PAS SNP rs1130319 in the 3' UTR of ADI1 was detected as a pA-QTL across ten out of twelve tissues. The PIA associated with this SNP indicated a shortening of the 3' UTR, characterized by elevated usage of an upstream polyadenylation site. This shortening was consistent in all analyzed tissues.
title: Systematic identification of functional SNPs interrupting 3’ UTR polyadenylation signals

finding: The rs12621278 SNP was found to be protective against prostate cancer earlier in studies focused on Asian populations. It belonged to various genes within a segment on chromosome 2 associated with reduced prostate cancer risk, highlighting its relevance in cancer pathways.
title: Archaic Adaptive Introgression in Modern Human Reproductive Genes

finding: The SNP rs6717024 was confirmed as genome-wide significant for diverticular disease, consistent with previous studies, reaffirming the association of the ARHGAP15 locus in this condition.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: The SNP rs6736741, part of independent ARHGAP15 loci, confirmed significant phenotypic expression with diverticular disease in multiple ancestries.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: Similarly, rs10928187 demonstrated significant associations with diverticular disease in PheWAS analyses, supporting its potential role as a genetic risk variant.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: SNP rs6734367 exhibited a notable increase in effect sizes in diverticulosis and diverticulitis analyses compared to previous GWAS findings, indicating a strengthened association.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: The rs4988235 SNP at the LCT locus was identified as under positive selection during the historical period of European history. This finding was significant since the causal allele for lactose tolerance associated with this SNP was absent prior to the arrival of Steppe Pastoralists in the Bronze Age, indicating that natural selection for this trait began only after this arrival. The finding also aligned with a rapid increase in frequency of the rs4988235 variant, consistent with results observed in other ancient DNA studies.
title: Understanding natural selection in Holocene Europe using multi-locus genotype identity scans

finding: Identified in a region spanning 27.3 kb on chromosome 2p16.1, this SNP was previously reported and was associated with total WMH burden. It is intronic in the EFEMP1 gene.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: This SNP, located in an intron of the NBEAL1 gene, was significant in a large 442.3 kb genomic region associated with PVWMH and was an eQTL impacting multiple genes.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The SNP rs57242328 was associated with PVWMH and located in an intergenic region on chromosome 2p21 that has been implicated in total WMH load, though it was in low linkage disequilibrium with other significant SNPs.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: This SNP, associated with total WMH, was identified in the same regions as rs7576872 and rs7596872, highlighting its potential importance in white matter pathology.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: This SNP was part of the significant cluster associated with PVWMH, found within the NBEAL1 gene, serving as an eQTL.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The SNP rs11679640 was confirmed as significant for its association with total WMH, though it showed low linkage with the top SNPs in its region.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The rs200302685 variant in the HOXD12 gene is a damaging variant involved in the regulation of embryonic development as it belongs to the homeobox family of genes. Its role is further implicated in maintenance and control of HIV-1 latency through epigenetic regulation.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing-based Characterization of Human Genome Variation and Mutation Burden in Botswana

finding: The study indicated that rs62172376 was identified as a causal variant at the CALCRL/TFPI locus, revealing a gene-environment interaction concerning ox-LDL exposure. This variant was linked to the protective haplotype that showed increased enhancer activity and higher expression of the TFPI gene in human artery.
title: Ox-LDL induces a non-inflammatory response enriched for coronary artery disease risk in human endothelial cells

finding: rs840616 was associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) risk in European populations, exhibiting a significant effect in the context of the gene environment interaction when endothelial cells were treated with ox-LDL.
title: Ox-LDL induces a non-inflammatory response enriched for coronary artery disease risk in human endothelial cells

finding: The SNP rs4500960 was associated with reduced educational attainment (EA) and was identified as an intronic variant in the T-box, Brain 1 (TBR1) transcription factor, which is crucial for neuronal differentiation and migration during development. This finding established a significant connection between this genetic variant and educational outcomes.
title: Educational attainment impacts drinking behaviors and risk for alcohol dependence: results from a two-sample Mendelian randomization study with ~780 000 participants

finding: The rs6733839 SNP was a high-confidence AD-risk variant located approximately 20 kb upstream of the BIN1 gene. Functional deletion of a microglia-specific enhancer containing this variant significantly reduced BIN1 expression specifically in microglia, but not in other brain cell types such as neurons and astrocytes.
title: Cell type-specific enhancer-promoter connectivity maps in the human brain and disease risk association

finding: The rs2540334 SNV was associated with basal cell carcinoma risk and was found to alter the CASP8 gene promoter binding dynamics. This SNV demonstrated reduced transcriptional activity and modified IRF6 binding, indicating its role as a risk-associated eQTL.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: Linked to CASP8 and basal cell carcinoma risk, rs2349075 broke an AP-1 motif and showed decreased transcriptional activity. Editing at this locus confirmed diminished CASP8 expression associated with its risk allele.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: The SNP rs966423 demonstrated significant associations with the risk of differentiated thyroid cancers in multiple studies and its association with mortality was also confirmed.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs12990503 showed a strong association with increased risk of differentiated thyroid cancers and other malignancies, identified during fine-mapping analysis.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The variant rs57481445 was identified as a novel risk variant associated with differentiated thyroid cancer after fine-mapping analysis, indicating its potential role in cancer predisposition.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs3821098 was also newly identified as a risk variant in the context of differentiated thyroid cancer, expanding the understanding of genetic predispositions.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs11887827 demonstrated a strong association with a low p value of 1.701 × 10^-5. It played a crucial role in conditioning the significance of rs6715049 and rs7593114.
title: BayesRB: a markov chain Monte Carlo-based polygenic genetic risk score algorithm for dichotomous traits

finding: This SNP was found to be strongly associated with the WNT10 gene in the Wnt signaling pathway, which is crucial in various neurodegenerative diseases, including Parkinson's disease (PD). The associated p-value was 2.2 × 10^-16, indicating a very high significance.
title: CluStrat: a structure informed clustering strategy for population stratification

finding: Analyzed in the GWAS, rs6754826 was located in an intergenic region on chromosome 2 and linked to a rare allele that contributed to a 26.6-point increase in DSST scores, thus showing protective effects on processing speed.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: The SNP rs13010032 was associated with social-ecological archetypes of land degradation in the Nigerian Guinea Savannah, as reported by Adenle and Ifejika Speranza in 2021. Their study provided insights on sustainable land management, indicating that this SNP may play a role in understanding the socio-ecological factors influencing land degradation and sustainability outcomes.
title: Sensitivities in associating land-system archetypes with sustainability metrics: Insights from simulations

finding: The SNP rs1658810 was identified as a non-coding variant that was positively associated with Schizophrenia, located in the intron of the protein-coding gene C2orf69. It exhibited significant associations with various other genes in eQTL analyses, including C2orf47 and TYW5, across different studies. Moreover, functional studies using massively parallel reporter assays confirmed that this SNP displayed allelic differences in driving gene expression, reinforcing its role as a high confidence risk locus. The application of DeepPerVar further revealed that variants prioritized based on this SNP were more likely to be causally related to Alzheimer's disease, as demonstrated by significant correlations with Braak staging.
title: DeepPerVar: a multimodal deep learning framework for functional interpretation of genetic variants in personal genome

finding: The SNP rs4988235 was documented with high combined selection score values, suggesting it was subjected to robust recent selection. It also served as a marker for other SNPs in the vicinity that shared similar selection histories, underlining its importance in the context of adaptation.
title: A genome-wide Approximate Bayesian Computation approach suggests only limited numbers of soft sweeps in humans over the last 100,000 years

finding: The SNP rs56320407 was identified as a neuron-specific edQTL within the CCDC88A gene locus, co-localized with educational attainment. The T allele was associated with higher RNA-editing levels and decreased educational attainment, suggesting contributions to cognitive functions through mRNA stability.
title: Genetics of cell-type-specific post-transcriptional gene regulation during human neurogenesis

finding: The alternate allele (G) of rs2232328 was associated with increased expression of G6PC2 in human alpha-cells, contributing to higher fasting blood glucose levels via enhanced glucagon secretion.
title: G6PC2 controls glucagon secretion by defining the setpoint for glucose in pancreatic α-cells

finding: SNP rs573225 was located in an open chromatin region and was in linkage disequilibrium with lead SNP rs560887, which was associated with variation in fasting glucose levels in individuals of European ancestry.
title: G6PC2 controls glucagon secretion by defining the setpoint for glucose in pancreatic α-cells

finding: It was identified as a lead SNP in association with fasting glucose levels, showing a high linkage disequilibrium with rs573225.
title: G6PC2 controls glucagon secretion by defining the setpoint for glucose in pancreatic α-cells

finding: This SNP was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with rs2232328 and was associated with an exonic missense variant (S342C) linked to variations in fasted and fed blood glucose, impacting G6PC2 promoter activity.
title: G6PC2 controls glucagon secretion by defining the setpoint for glucose in pancreatic α-cells

finding: This missense variant was identified as pathogenic through clinical testing and literature mining. While it was predicted benign by PolyPhen-2 in reference annotations, it caused a start-loss variant in a novel transcript under specific immune-stimulated conditions. This transcript was relevant to chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis, evidencing the variance's potential impact on immune response.
title: SUsPECT: A pipeline for variant effect prediction based on custom long-read transcriptomes for improved clinical variant annotation

finding: This SNP tagged a risk haplotype for AD, linked specifically to increased expression of the BIN1 gene in microglia.
title: Cell-subtype specific effects of genetic variation in the aging and Alzheimer cortex

finding: The SNP rs1260326, representing the P446L variant in the GCKR gene, was shown to be associated with a decline in blood glucose lowering efficacy of the glucokinase activator (GKA) AZD1656 in the LL genotype of the Gckr-P446L mouse model after 19 weeks of treatment. Initially, both wild-type and P446L genotypes displayed similar glycaemic efficacy, but while the wild-type maintained efficacy over time, the LL genotype experienced a decline. This was correlated with raised hepatic glucokinase activity without an increase in liver lipids, highlighting that GKRP deficiency might predispose individuals with the GCKR P446L variant to diminished GKA effectiveness and increased risk of lipid accumulation.
title: Compromised chronic efficacy of a Glucokinase Activator AZD1656 in mouse models for common human GCKR variants

finding: The PROC SNP rs116169054 was predicted to generate an overlapping uORF containing 35 codons by creating a uAUG in the 5’UTR of the transcript NM_000312.4. Preliminary experimental results indicated that this variant was associated with decreased levels of protein C, a factor linked to venous thrombosis (VT) risk.
title: MORFEE: a new tool for detecting and annotating single nucleotide variants creating premature ATG codons from VCF files

finding: Analysis revealed that rs219224 was related to changes in monocyte counts, reinforcing the connection between ACKR2 and monocyte biology.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: The SNP rs199689137 (p.R446Ter) was identified as a stop variant in the ABCG5 gene within a large cohort from the UK Biobank, which included 293,134 individuals. This variant was associated with carrier status showing significant elevations in LDL-C levels (24.7 mg/dL; 95% confidence interval [CI] 14 to 35; P=1.1×10−6) and conferred a two-fold increased risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) (odds ratio 2.06, 95% CI 1.27 to 3.35; P=0.004). This finding suggested that the presence of this SNP, associated with a heterozygous loss-of-function variant in ABCG5, impacted lipid levels and contributed to increased CAD risk.
title: Heterozygous ATP-binding Cassette Transporter G5 Gene Deficiency and Risk of Coronary Artery Disease

finding: The SNP rs4672495 was identified as being associated with disease activity in rheumatoid arthritis. This indicates that variations at this locus may influence the severity or progression of the disease in affected individuals.
title: Structural and mechanistic insights into disease-associated endolysosomal exonucleases PLD3 and PLD4

finding: The lactase persistence allele (rs4988235) had a selection estimate of 8.1% with selection beginning approximately 6,102 years ago, demonstrating its strong association with the phenotype of lactase persistence in European populations.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The positively selected variant rs3771180 was associated with lower asthma risk and higher neutrophil levels, with a selection estimate of 0.015.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: SNP rs189235692 in the IL1B gene was associated with both Escherichia and Shigella phages, linking pro-inflammatory gene variants to bacterial virus interactions.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The exonic variant rs2234675 in the PAX3 gene was described as having genome-wide significance. It was associated with a threonine to lysine change causing a decrease in cerebellar volume of 0.17 SD, reflecting its role in neurodevelopment.
title: Genome-wide association study of cerebellar volume

finding: The CXCR1 variant rs2234671 was associated with overall response in CRC treatment, indicating its potential as a predictive biomarker.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: CXCR2 rs2230054 was associated with overall response rates in CRC, reflecting its potential role in treatment outcomes.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: This SNP showed significant association with kidney stones and was linked to a history of gout.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: This SNP was associated with GCKR and correlated with nephrolithiasis.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: As the SNP with the highest posterior probability for being causal for atrial fibrillation at the CEP68 locus, rs2723064 was previously identified in GWAS.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: Identified as having the highest posterior probability for being causal for atrial fibrillation at the CEP68 locus, this SNP was also linked with a previously established index variant.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The SNP rs11688682 was associated with a caQTL specifically in endothelial cells, which colocalized with a T2D GWAS signal at the GLI2 locus, indicating its regulatory influence on gene expression in this context.
title: Population-scale skeletal muscle single-nucleus multi-omic profiling reveals extensive context specific genetic regulation

finding: The variant rs34075781, found in the MOGS gene (NM_006302: c.1484G>A, p.R495Q), was homozygous in all archaic genomes. The variant is associated with congenital disorders of glycosylation (MOGS-CDG), affecting the immune system's glycosylation processes. Its absence in modern human populations suggests potential detrimental effects on immune defense that may have impacted Neanderthal survival against specific infections.
title: Did variants in inborn errors of immunity genes contribute to the extinction of Neanderthals?

finding: This SNP was identified as a potential causative SNP for type 1 diabetes (T1D). It was located within a Treg super-enhancer and flanking an active transcription start site, interacting with the promoter of the CD28 gene, which plays a critical role in Treg homeostasis.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: Associated with T1D, this SNP was also located in the region of the CTLA4 gene. It was found to be involved in Treg-specific enhancer regions which could potentially modulate immune responses.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: This SNP was implicated in T1D and its associated gene interactions included ABI2 and IQCA1. Its prioritization suggested a potential role in regulatory pathways important for T cell function.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: Linked to regulatory activity in Tregs, indicating a potential mechanism in T1D.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: Demonstrated interplay with transcription factors impacting Treg status and T1D mechanisms.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: Found to have implications in regulatory pathways affecting Treg functions, connected to T1D.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: rs12989701 was shown to be associated with the BIN1 gene, demonstrating its significance through CTCF binding sites in modulating the risk of Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs10207628 was linked to the BIN1 gene, associated with enhancer regions, which are crucial for gene expression related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs6431219 was connected to multiple histone modifications in the context of the BIN1 gene, highlighting its importance in Alzheimer's disease risk factors.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs10194375 was associated with the BIN1 gene, indicative of its role from enhancer to promoter flanking regions in influencing Alzheimer's disease pathways.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs72838215 contributed to histone modification associations with the BIN1 gene, solidifying its relevance in Alzheimer's disease gene regulatory networks.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs6733839 was linked to open chromatin regions in relation to the BIN1 gene, underlining its importance in the genetic regulation relevant to Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs10933431 was associated with INPP5D, showing its role in open chromatin regulation affecting Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs744373 was associated with the BIN1 gene and linked to increased tau-PET levels, suggesting its significant role in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs1260326 was associated with C-reactive protein levels across the European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American ancestry cohorts, demonstrating its significance in multiple ancestry groups.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: rs780094 was found to be statistically significant in relation to C-reactive protein levels in the European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: rs6734238 was associated with C-reactive protein across the African-American (PAGE), European, South Asian cohorts, and was previously validated in other studies, making it significant in those ancestry groups.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs1367228 was associated with facial variation around the eye sockets and upper cheekbones. It was located within a transcription factor binding sequence in an intron of the EFEMP1 gene, showing preferential activity in fetal osteoblast cell lines and mesenchymal stem cell-derived chondrocytes, thereby suggesting its role in modulating enhancer activity relevant to embryonic facial development.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: The SNP rs1370926 was associated with multiple facial phenotypic traits, impacting the morphology of the nose, upper lip, forehead, and eyes. It was located 34 kb upstream of the PAX3 gene, corroborating previous reports of PAX3's involvement in general facial morphology.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: The SNP rs2161037 was mapped to the DHRS9 gene and was reported to be associated with C-reactive protein levels. This finding suggests that variations in this SNP could influence host immune responses against tuberculosis.
title: Major Contribution of Myeloid Cells In TB specific Host Gene Signature: Revelations from Re-Analysis of Publicly Available Datasets

finding: Similar to rs2161037, the SNP rs12328794 was also mapped to the DHRS9 gene and associated with C-reactive protein levels, indicating a connection with immune activity and tuberculosis pathology.
title: Major Contribution of Myeloid Cells In TB specific Host Gene Signature: Revelations from Re-Analysis of Publicly Available Datasets

finding: The variant rs6431625, a missense variant in UGT1A3, was associated with direct bilirubin levels in Korea4K, showing a very strong significance with a P-value of 1.41 x 10^-23. This finding contributed to the identification of new geno-phenotype associations that were not previously reported in the earlier Korea1K dataset.
title: Korea4K: whole genome sequences of 4,157 Koreans with 107 phenotypes derived from extensive health check-ups

finding: The SNP rs4988235, located in the LCT region, was associated with the lactase persistence trait, indicating strong positive selection in human populations, particularly in those from Middle Eastern, European, and African ancestries.
title: AncestryGrapher toolkit: Python command-line pipelines to visualize global– and local– ancestry inferences from the RFMix2 software

finding: The SNP rs41525747, also in the LCT region, showed a similar association with the lactase persistence trait, reinforcing the evidence of recent selection acting on this functional allele in diverse populations.
title: AncestryGrapher toolkit: Python command-line pipelines to visualize global– and local– ancestry inferences from the RFMix2 software

finding: This SNP, identified as rs41380347, emerged as another common polymorphism linked to lactase persistence, highlighting the role of natural selection in shaping genetic variation related to lactose tolerance.
title: AncestryGrapher toolkit: Python command-line pipelines to visualize global– and local– ancestry inferences from the RFMix2 software

finding: The SNP rs869051967 contributed to the understanding of the lactase persistence trait and demonstrated patterns of positive selection that were consistent across several studies involving Middle Eastern, European, and African populations.
title: AncestryGrapher toolkit: Python command-line pipelines to visualize global– and local– ancestry inferences from the RFMix2 software

finding: Lastly, the SNP rs145946881 was identified as being significantly associated with lactase persistence, underscoring the demographic processes that have influenced genetic variation in human populations due to both admixture and selection.
title: AncestryGrapher toolkit: Python command-line pipelines to visualize global– and local– ancestry inferences from the RFMix2 software

finding: The rs77375846 SNP, located in the <italic>IL18RAP</italic> gene, was associated with average event desaturation and minimum SpO<sub>2</sub> in a multiple-population analysis, demonstrating a combined p-value of 1.57 × 10<sup>−9</sup>. This finding was consistent with previous reports.
title: Whole-Genome Association Analyses of Sleep-disordered Breathing Phenotypes in the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: Selection on rs3827760 showed an estimated selection coefficient (s) of 0.0047, indicating a selection event with an estimated allele age of approximately 45,000 years. This SNP is associated with traits like tooth shape and hair straightness. The results contrasted significantly with earlier estimates which suggested stronger selection and a much younger allele age.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs3748971 was associated with increased expression of the gene ALPPL2, with a significant P value of 0.002. This association was highlighted in the context of its role as an mQTL (methylation Quantitative Trait Loci) for the CpG site cg21566642.
title: Appraising the causal relevance of DNA methylation for risk of lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs878481 showed an association with increased expression of the gene ALPPL2, with a highly significant P value of 0.0001. This association was noted as it served as an mQTL for the CpG site cg05951221.
title: Appraising the causal relevance of DNA methylation for risk of lung cancer
