finding: The variant rs58516622 was found to have a large effect on EGR1 binding as it altered 5 overlapping binding sites, demonstrating its significance in modulating gene expression.
title: Overlapping binding sites underlie TF genomic occupancy

finding: The SNP rs6733839 in the BIN1 locus exhibited statistically significant evidence of replication for its association with late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD), although specific odds ratio and p-value were not disclosed in the findings.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: The study identified rs711244, an exonic nonsynonymous SNP located in exon 1 of AC007382.1, with a very low p-value of 1.42×10^-12, indicating a strong association. Although the function of AC007382.1 was unknown, it had previously been associated with amygdala volume, suggesting a potential link to cognitive functioning within the visual network-SC.
title: Specificity and overlap in the genetic architectures of functional and structural connectivity within cerebral resting-state networks

finding: The SNP rs4988235, linked to lactose resistance, exhibited a strong correlation (r² = 0.64) with the inferred chromosome subpopulation groups. Specifically, the T allele conferring lactose resistance was highly prevalent (83%) in chromosome allele 1, which was under selection, whereas it was almost absent (<1%) in chromosome allele 2.
title: Historical recombination variability contributes to deciphering the genetic basis of phenotypic traits

finding: The missense mutation Trp976Arg in the titin gene (<italic>TTN</italic>) was identified as a potential cause of dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) in a moderately large DCM family, although the calculated LOD score was 2.73, which is below the standard threshold for causal mutations. Trp976 was found to be 100% conserved evolutionarily across 35 species and 99% structurally conserved in humans and mice, underscoring its likely role in stabilizing the immunoglobulin (Ig) domain of the titin protein.
title: Conserved cysteines in titin sustain the mechanical function of cardiomyocytes

finding: The rs13003198 SNP, located ~6kb upstream of DGKD, was associated with increased 24-hour urinary calcium excretion in male stone formers, with a mean of 7.27mmol for GG homozygotes versus 4.54mmol for AA homozygotes, indicating enhanced CaSR-signal transduction.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The rs838717 SNP associated with increased 24-hour urinary calcium excretion in male stone formers (mean of 7.27mmol for GG versus 4.54mmol for AA), reinforcing its role in CaSR signal transduction.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs3827760, located in the EDAR gene, was associated with hair and dental traits and was found to be under population-specific adaptation. It was among the top 5% of the MU distribution, supporting its potential adaptiveness.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: The SNP rs4988235 in the LCT gene, associated with lactose tolerance, was shown to be evolving under adaptive forces and ranked in the top 5% of the MU distribution.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: The SNP rs4988235 (C/T-13910) was associated with adult lactase persistence in Europeans. Direct evidence from ancient DNA indicated that the allele was rare or absent in the Neolithic and did not significantly increase in frequency until the Bronze Age, starting around 5,000 years ago. The selection coefficient for this SNP was estimated to be between 0.018 and 2-2.5%, identified across regions such as Britain, Central Europe, and Iberia.
title: Estimating time-varying selection coefficients from time series data of allele frequencies

finding: The SNP rs28445040 was identified as a CD-risk variant associated with mutations in SP140, which are linked to the predisposition to Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) in humans. The study indicated that these mutations could impact the immune system's ability to manage the gut microbiota, thus contributing to disease conditions like Crohn's disease (CD).
title: Immune chromatin reader SP140 regulates microbiota and risk for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: Similar to rs28445040, the SNP rs6716753 was found to be associated with the risk of Crohn's disease (CD) as part of the SP140 mutations. The mutations in this SNP were implicated in dysregulation of host-commensal interactions that may lead to an increased susceptibility to inflammatory conditions, including IBD.
title: Immune chromatin reader SP140 regulates microbiota and risk for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: Arising from the ICA1L locus, this SNP showcased sex-biased regulatory functions with significant enhancer activity discerned in male donors, substantiating its role in sex differences in CAD risk.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The low-frequency splice donor variant rs35732034 (C>T) showed strong protective effects in T1D with an odds ratio of 0.63, indicating its significant role in the disease pathway.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: Similar to rs35732034, rs35337543 (C>G) also emerged as a low-frequency splice donor variant with a protective effect against T1D, emphasizing its importance in the genetic architecture of the disease.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: The missense variant rs231775 (A>G), resulting in the CTLA4 Thr17Ala change, presented with an odds ratio of 1.20, suggesting a significant association with T1D risk.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: The rs1260326 variant, associated with the gene GCKR, showed significant associations in 8 of the 16 metabolites, highlighting its important role in metabolic regulation.
title: Integrative analysis of metabolite GWAS illuminates the molecular basis of pleiotropy and genetic correlation

finding: The SNP rs3730150 was identified as a common SNP located in the homologous region of the <italic>GNAQP</italic> pseudogene, which showed sequencing misalignment that could lead to misinterpretation of somatic mutations in <italic>GNAQ</italic>. It was used as a reference to demonstrate erroneous mapping of somatic mutation reads.
title: Correspondence: Recurrent GNAQ mutation encoding T96S in natural killer/T cell lymphoma

finding: Similar to rs3730150, rs3730153 was also deemed a common SNP in the <italic>GNAQP</italic> locus. Its presence confirmed the misalignment of sequencing reads that affected the interpretation of somatic mutations, implicating that findings regarding <italic>GNAQ</italic> mutations might be incorrect.
title: Correspondence: Recurrent GNAQ mutation encoding T96S in natural killer/T cell lymphoma

finding: The SNP rs3730148 was part of the array of common SNPs in the <italic>GNAQP</italic> pseudogene, which contributed to the notion that the sequencing alignment may have been misleading, reinforcing the potential misreporting of <italic>GNAQ</italic> mutations.
title: Correspondence: Recurrent GNAQ mutation encoding T96S in natural killer/T cell lymphoma

finding: The SNP rs79716587 (A->G) demonstrated a strong association with WBC (p=2.4e-13) and was highlighted as a top-ranked GWAS SNP in its region. This SNP disrupted a RUNX motif within an SP1 binding site falling under the core promoter of ARHGAP15, contributing to the understanding of the genetic basis for variations in neutrophil function.
title: Deep neural networks identify context-specific determinants of transcription factor binding affinity

finding: The SNP rs1464264 was located at an enhancer specific to OCUM1 cells and was associated with histone acetylation levels. The major 'A' allele correlated with increased H3K27ac levels and subsequent upregulation of the gene ARL4C. This link between rs1464264 and ARL4C expression was confirmed in an independent cohort of primary gastric cancer patients, indicating a role for the 'A' allele in promoting ARL4C expression, which is implicated in gastric cancer risk as per previous GWAS studies.
title: Integrative Epigenomic and High-Throughput Functional Enhancer Profiling Reveals Determinants of Enhancer Heterogeneity in Gastric Cancer

finding: This SNP reduced SF3B1 transcript levels solely in fetal cortex, showing development-stage specific regulatory effects relevant to ASD.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: A pathogenic germline nonsense mutation in MSH6 (rs267608094) was identified in one of the BCAC patients. While this variant was significant, it too did not correlate with the observed dMMR in the tumours, maintaining a mutation burden of less than 1 mutation/Mb.
title: Activation of Wnt/β-catenin signalling by mutually exclusive FBXW11 and CTNNB1 hotspot mutations drives salivary gland basal cell adenoma

finding: The study reported that rs7608180 produced an allele effect (AE) with the reference G allele, resulting in a fold change (FC) of 0.57 and a false discovery rate (FDR) of q=0.002.
title: Massively Parallel Reporter Assay Confirms Regulatory Potential of hQTLs and Reveals Important Variants in Lupus and Other Autoimmune Diseases

finding: This SNP was associated with Barrett's oesophagus (BO) and was found to overlap with a regulatory region unique to developmental epithelial cell clusters. Its presence was predicted to result in reduced activity of the regulatory element through the creation of a repressor binding site for YY1, linking it to the mechanism of BO development.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: For the SNP rs1179500 in the CRIM1 gene, there was a notable association with FEV1/FVC (p-value of 3.6×10^-17), indicating its involvement in the tumor growth factor beta (TGF-β) signaling pathway related to lung function.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs12466981 associated with EML4 showed a significant correlation with FEV1/FVC (p-value of 2.7×10^-14), indicating its relevance in genes associated with lung cancer.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs7566315 showed both mQTL effects on N-Acetylaspartate (NAA) concentration and eQTL effects on the expression of the ALMS1 gene. Specifically, the concentration of NAA, approximated by features at 2.0375 ppm, was linked to the genotype of this SNP, indicating a direct correlation between ALMS1 expression levels and NAA concentrations in urine.
title: Untargeted metabolome- and transcriptome-wide association study identifies causal genes modulating metabolite concentrations in urine

finding: The SNP rs13030507 was highlighted as a positive original finding in the context of its association with cancer research, specifically relating to bone metastatic cancer. This finding underscored its potential relevance in the development of 3D engineered models and bioprinted scaffolds aimed at replicating the bone-tumor niche, thus providing critical insights into its role in such studies.
title: Enhancing Precision in Bioprinting Utilizing Fuzzy Systems

finding: The SNP rs648078 was associated with atrial fibrillation (P=6×10^-27). A 200-bp inversion at chromosome 10q22.2 was found in strong LD (r^2=0.953) with this SNP, highlighting the inversion's potential influence on atrial fibrillation.
title: Structural variation across 138,134 samples in the TOPMed consortium

finding: The variant rs2867112 was implicated in a causal association between lifetime smoking and waist-hip ratio (WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>). This finding was derived from Mendelian randomization analyses highlighting the link between genetic predisposition to lifetime smoking and increased abdominal adiposity.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The finding related to SNP rs13030515 indicated its association with T Cell Factor 1 (TCF1) expression in CD8+ T cells. This association was highlighted by the study's investigations which revealed that the administration of CarboTaxol enhanced TCF1 expression, thereby contributing to the expansion of stem-like TCF1+CD8+ T cells. This finding was crucial in the context of improving anti-tumor immunity, as TCF1+CD8+ T cells were shown to play a significant role in sustaining tumor-directed immune responses during cancer therapy.
title: Chemotherapy synergizes with cancer vaccines and expands stem-like TCF1+CD8+ T cells

finding: The SNP rs13020227 was also recognized as a positive original finding, particularly in relation to predicting therapeutic responses and resistance in colorectal cancer models. This finding indicated its relevance in the study of drug efficacy in cancer treatment.
title: Ultrasound-mediated drug diffusion, uptake, and cytotoxicity in glioblastoma 3D tumour sphere model

finding: All individuals with sufficient coverage for the rs4988235 SNP carried the G allele associated with lactose intolerance, suggesting that the Niedertiefenbach people could not digest dairy products.
title: Neolithic genomes reveal a distinct ancient HLA allele pool and population transformation in Europe

finding: The minor allele of rs13429458 was found to increase the risk of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) in Asian populations, but not in Caucasian women, suggesting a population-specific role in susceptibility to this condition.
title: Unique genetic features of the naked mole-rat’s THADA gene

finding: This SNP was associated with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) in the context of studying various SNPs related to PCOS, indicating its relevance to the disease.
title: Unique genetic features of the naked mole-rat’s THADA gene

finding: The SNP rs11126784 was identified as being strongly associated with patterns of neurodegeneration (ND, p = 2e-54) and was linked to the gene body of DPYSL5, which is associated with cortical surface measurements and axonal growth. This finding indicated a significant enrichment in cortico-striatal circuitry and highlighted the importance of whole brain analyses.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association studies on the tissue compartments of human brain identify novel loci underpinning brain development and neuropsychiatric outcomes

finding: The rs1344706 polymorphism in the ZNF804A gene was associated with an increased risk of schizophrenia.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The derived allele, which encodes EDAR370A, demonstrated very high frequencies in northern East Asian and Native American populations, reaching up to 90%. This variant showed clear evidence of positive selection through diverse analytical methods, facilitating increased activation of the NF-kB pathway in vitro. Its association with phenotypes included thicker and straighter hair, dental shoveling of incisors, altered ear and chin shapes, and a higher density of fingertip sweat glands.
title: Characterisation of a second gain of function EDAR variant, encoding EDAR380R, in East Asia

finding: The SNP rs1260326, located in the gene GCKR, was associated with hsCRP levels, revealing a genetically determined relationship between hsCRP and cholesterol metabolism.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The SNP rs7422195 was identified as a risk variant for multiple sclerosis (MS), showing a discordant association based on an individual's HLA-DRB1*15:01 status. It conferred increased risk in the absence of this allele but exhibited a protective effect when present on an HLA-DRB1*15:01 homozygous background. This suggests a complex interaction between phagocytosis and antigen presentation in the immune response, highlighting the pivotal role of MerTK expression in the pathology of MS.
title: Vitamin D regulates MerTK-dependent phagocytosis in human myeloid cells

finding: The SNP rs13020214 was associated with immune responses relevant to B cell lymphoma, as detailed in the study published in 'Cancers (Basel)'. This association was contextualized within the research that demonstrated the effectiveness of immune checkpoint inhibitors in enhancing antitumor responses against B cell lymphoma. The findings indicated that genetic variations at this locus may influence patient outcomes and responses to therapies involving immune checkpoint blockade.
title: Local CpG-Stat3 siRNA treatment improves antitumor effects of immune checkpoint inhibitors

finding: The SNP rs2439202 exhibited significant allelic differences in K562 and SH-SY5Y but was noted to behave differently from the majority as it was not aligned in the same direction with others, suggesting unique regulatory implications.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: The SNP rs2605039 demonstrated significant allelic differences in both cell lines and was identified as an eQTL in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, suggesting it may have implications for understanding the genetic architecture of schizophrenia.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: Significant allelic variation was observed for SNP rs7582536 in both K562 and SH-SY5Y cells, marking it as potentially influential in gene regulation pertinent to schizophrenia or Alzheimer's pathology.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: SNP rs1658810 exhibited significant allelic differences across K562 and SH-SY5Y cell lines and was noted as an eQTL in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, linking it to the genetic underpinnings of schizophrenia.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: Located within an intron of DARS-AS1 on Chromosome 2, rs309134 was recognized as eQTL linked to left ventricular mass (LV mass) and demonstrated substantial positive effects on gene expression particularly in the LV and aorta.
title: Transcriptional Variabilities in Human hiPSC-derived Cardiomyocytes: All Genes Are Not Equal and Their Robustness May Foretell Donor’s Disease Susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs13388394 was identified as associated with whole brainstem volume. It exhibited a combined annotation-dependent depletion (CADD) score indicating deleterious effects and was also involved in common brain disorders.
title: The genetic architecture of human brainstem structures and their involvement in common brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs6422701 was found to be enriched in the T1D cohort, with the T allele being overrepresented. This allele was associated with decreased PDCD1 mRNA expression in whole blood as reported by the GTEx project. Further, it correlated to significantly decreased PD-1 expression on CD4 Tem and CD4 Temra cells in both CTR and AAb-REL groups, suggesting a link to decreased PD-1 expression on memory T cells in T1D pathogenesis.
title: Human immune phenotyping reveals accelerated aging in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP was identified through exhaustive searching as part of a two-SNP model for iRA and T1D, indicating its protective effects in these diseases, therefore highlighting its significance in shared autoimmune pathways.
title: Sharing information between related diseases using Bayesian joint fine mapping increases accuracy and identifies novel associations in six immune mediated diseases

finding: Identified for its protective role in CEL and iCEL through stochastic search methods, which supported its joint tagging capability with other causal variants.
title: Sharing information between related diseases using Bayesian joint fine mapping increases accuracy and identifies novel associations in six immune mediated diseases

finding: An association was identified between the NAT8 SNP (rs13538) and the ratio of N-acetyl-4-Cl-KYN to 4-Cl-KYN in plasma, with patients having two 'G' alleles showing a 1.86-fold higher ratio compared to those with two 'A' alleles. This variant was a non-synonymous SNP impacting the enzyme's function, potentially altering the acetylation process and influencing drug metabolism.
title: Role of transporters and enzymes in metabolism and distribution of 4 chlorokynurenine and metabolites

finding: The variant rs182549-T in the lactase gene (LCT) was reported to confer lactase persistence (LP). It exhibited a high allele frequency in populations of northern and western European ancestry, who continue to consume cow's milk, while it remained low in populations that do not consume cow's milk and are primarily non-LP.
title: Detection of complex genetic architecture using two-locus population differentiation: modeling epistasis

finding: The study indicated that the minor allele of SNP rs114518452, which was prevalent in African ancestry populations, created an NGG PAM sequence leading to a potential off-target site with three mismatches. When editing was performed using a high fidelity SpCas9 variant (R691A, aka HiFi), off-target insertion and deletion rates in heterozygous donor CD34+ HSPCs were significantly reduced from 4.8% to 0.1%, indicating improved specificity. Additionally, the editing process resulted in undetectable levels of pericentric inversions, while still achieving a high rate of on-target editing (82.3%). This finding underscored the importance of considering genetic variants in designing gene editing strategies to maximize specificity and minimize unintended consequences.
title: Gene editing without ex vivo culture evades genotoxicity in human hematopoietic stem cells

finding: The SNP rs35667974 (I923V) was identified as associated with ulcerative colitis (UC) risk with over 95% certainty. It was confirmed as the most likely causal gene in the IFIH1 region for IBD in a meta-analysis of GWAS, highlighting its role in IBD susceptibility.
title: Functional screen of Inflammatory bowel disease genes reveals key epithelial functions

finding: The SNP rs35337543, located at a splice donor site position +1 in intron 8, was linked to IBD risk with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 1% and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.3 (P-value=0.003). This association was noted for its predicted impact leading to skipping of exon 8, contributing to the understanding of mechanistic pathways in IBD.
title: Functional screen of Inflammatory bowel disease genes reveals key epithelial functions

finding: The SNP rs35732034, found at a splice donor site position +1 in intron 14, was associated with IBD risk, showing a MAF of 0.8% and an OR of 1.3 (P-value=0.002). It was recognized for its role in predicted skipping of exon 14 and leading to premature truncation of the C-terminal domain, critical for its functional interaction with viral RNA.
title: Functional screen of Inflammatory bowel disease genes reveals key epithelial functions

finding: The SNP rs13030474 was associated with variations in lipid metabolism as highlighted in a study of lipidomic influences in oncology. The finding related to the relevance of lipid profiles in cancer research, emphasizing its significance in understanding lipid metabolism in tumor development and treatment strategies.
title: Flexibility of a mammalian lipidome — insights from mouse lipidomics

finding: The majority allele and genotype of rs6436132 near MIR153-1 was associated with higher ADAS13 scores, indicating a greater severity of cognitive decline in Alzheimer's disease. This finding suggested that factors such as sex, with females showing lower scores, could reduce the effect of this SNP on ADAS13.
title: Human microRNA-153-3p targets specific neuronal genes and is associated with the risk of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The study associated SNP rs13010019 with immunotherapy response in glioblastoma using immunocompetent mouse models. The investigation revealed that this SNP played a role in the modulation of immune responses linked to the expansion and functionality of M-MDSCs, which are critical in the glioblastoma microenvironment.
title: Systemically targeting monocytic MDSCs using dendrimers and their cell-level biodistribution kinetics

finding: The SNP rs13032049 within the WDPCP gene was associated with fresh fruit intake, salt and coffee intake, adiposity, angina pectoris, myocardial infarction, and depression. It also exhibited an association with disorders of lipoprotein metabolism.
title: Evidence for Involvement of WDPCP Gene in Alcohol Consumption, Lipid Metabolism, and Liver Cirrhosis

finding: The SNP rs2178197 within the GPN1 gene was linked to hypertension, hematologic traits, and body impedance, and was associated with disorders of lipoprotein metabolism.
title: Evidence for Involvement of WDPCP Gene in Alcohol Consumption, Lipid Metabolism, and Liver Cirrhosis

finding: At the rs7563201 locus, there was strong power in colocalization analyses (power=1.00, PP=0.93) with the expression of ZFP36L2, a gene implicated in disturbed oocyte maturation and LH receptor regulation, indicating a significant role in the pathophysiology of PCOS.
title: Colocalization highlights genes in hypothalamic–pituitary–gonadal axis as potentially mediating polycystic ovary syndrome risk

finding: The variant rs35349669 in INPP5D was associated with an increased risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD), with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.08, suggesting that it potentially plays a role in the pathogenesis of AD.
title: INPP5D expression is associated with risk for Alzheimer’s disease and induced by plaque-associated microglia

finding: The intronic variant rs61068452 in INPP5D was linked to a reduced CSF t-tau/Aβ1-42 ratio, indicating a protective effect in LOAD with a highly significant p-value (p=1.48E-07), suggesting that this polymorphism might contribute to a lower risk of developing AD.
title: INPP5D expression is associated with risk for Alzheimer’s disease and induced by plaque-associated microglia

finding: Similar to rs3001, the SNP rs3002 was involved in studies identifying interactors of ORC4, highlighting its importance in the origin activity and replication.
title: Characterization of DNA replicators of a 75-kb region of Chromosome 2 of fission yeast, Schizosacharomyces pombe

finding: Similar to rs72646508, the variant rs145777339 was characterized as a low frequency variant (AF<0.01) identified in the meta-analysis. It too was associated with the American ancestry demographic, suggesting important implications for this group in genetic research.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: The rs2659279 SNP on chromosome 13 was associated with the FXYD6 gene, which is involved in ion transport regulation and was highlighted as significant in the genome-wide association studies (GWAS) for body height traits.
title: pCMLM: Genome Wide Association Study of Body Size Traits in Multiple Regions of Yak Based on the Provided Compressed Mixed Linear Model

finding: The SNP rs13398147 was identified as a significant eQTL in esophagus and colon tissues, where the T allele was associated with decreased expression of the EPHA4 gene. In a cohort of 6,449 adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (IS) patients from the East Asian GWAS, this SNP showed significant enrichment (P=0.023) in IS patients as compared to controls, indicating its pivotal role in the pathogenesis of IS.
title: Impaired central pattern generators due to abnormal EPHA4 signaling leads to idiopathic scoliosis

finding: The rs12692386 variant was found to be significantly associated with the promoter usage of the ADAM17 gene (ENSG00000151694) in CAGE analysis, which demonstrated a strong genotype-dependent shift in promoter usage. This finding indicated that the rs12692386 variant acted as a promoter usage quantitative trait locus (puQTL), highlighting its role in regulating the expression of ADAM17.
title: Improved detection of genetic effects on promoter usage with augmented transcript annotations

finding: The top SNP rs74490912 was found to be associated with the expression of a specific BIN1 peptide. However, this SNP was in only weak linkage disequilibrium with the rs6733839 AD SNP, indicating that it may not share the same functional pathways.
title: BIN1 protein isoforms are differentially expressed in astrocytes, neurons, and microglia: neuronal and astrocyte BIN1 implicated in Tau pathology

finding: This SNP was associated with the STRN gene, demonstrating the strongest locus for total area with a beta coefficient of -4.13 and a meaningful p-value of 1.98 × 10−18.
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: The SNP rs13010046 was linked to the KEAP1-NRF2 system, which has been identified as a crucial molecular target in cancer treatment. This finding was contextualized within cancer therapies that exploit the Nrf2 pathway to improve treatment outcomes.
title: Nrf2 modulates the hybrid epithelial/mesenchymal phenotype and Notch signaling during collective cancer migration

finding: The SNP rs13020182 was associated with the effects of Bromamine T (BAT) exerting stronger anti-cancer properties than Taurine. This finding indicated that variations at this locus could potentially influence the efficacy of different compounds in ovarian carcinoma treatment.
title: The nutritional supplement taurine activates p53-dependent and independent tumor suppressor mechanisms in various cellular models of ovarian cancer

finding: rs4602255 was associated with breast cancer in a genome-wide association study, confirmed by the addition of more than 10% cases and controls in the dataset.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel susceptibility locus linked to multiple cancers, including breast, prostate, and endometrial cancers, associated with the gene MYCN.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs13010088 was associated with mutations in the oncogene CTNNB1, which played a significant role in fatty acid oxidation and phospholipid metabolism alterations in hepatocellular carcinoma, suggesting it influenced lipid metabolic pathways in this context.
title: Phospholipid isotope tracing reveals β-catenin-driven suppression of phosphatidylcholine metabolism in hepatocellular carcinoma

finding: The rs58117425 SNP was found in the TEX41 gene and exhibited significant association only in men, indicating a specific genetic signal contributing to number of children ever born.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies genetic effects on reproductive success and ongoing natural selection at the FADS locus

finding: The rs7580304 SNP located in the PPP3R1 gene was identified as a female-specific signal affecting childlessness, further demonstrating the genetic underpinnings of reproductive success.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies genetic effects on reproductive success and ongoing natural selection at the FADS locus

finding: The non-coding SNP rs6542814 located in intron 1 of SH3RF3/POSH2 was associated with delaying the onset of Alzheimer's disease (AD) by approximately 9.2 years in carriers of the PSEN1 G206A mutation. This SNP was also linked to lower expression levels in fibroblasts as per data from the Genotype-Tissue Expression Portal.
title: Reduced SH3RF3 may protect against Alzheimer’s disease by lowering microglial pro-inflammatory responses via modulation of JNK and NFkB signaling

finding: SNP rs6739165 located in the COL4A3 gene showed differential SuRE activity based on alleles, being strongest in the C allele. This highlighted its potential role as a regulatory SNP associated with allelic differences in enhancer activity.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: Variants within the WDPCP gene including rs7566031 were associated with GGT levels (p-value 1.79e-10), total cholesterol (p-value 1.21e-08), and LDL cholesterol (p-value 1.79e-12), with replication in meta-analysis, linking WDPCP to metabolic pathways.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: Associated with IBD, this SNP had a particularly strong statistical association with a p-value of 2.023e-12. The research indicated that the switching of risk and non-risk alleles could influence the activities of distant CREs rather than just affecting local chromatin accessibility in GM12878 cells.
title: GTAGMe-seq: joint profiling of genetic variants, DNA methylation, GpC methyltransferase footprints, and 3D genome in the same DNA molecules

finding: rs573982927 was associated with long sleep duration and was linked to obesity traits with a significant p-value, being located in the gene MYO3B.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: rs144874087 was associated with the strength of the 1-day circadian periodicity with a p-value of 1.9×10^-8, located near LINC01935, which had not been previously linked to this phenotype.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: rs181820530 was associated with the strength of the 1-day circadian periodicity with a p-value of 4.5×10^-8, also located near LINC01935, indicating a novel association.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The study identified rs114518452 as a significant genetic variant influencing off-target potential in CRISPR gene editing. The minor allele, rs114518452-C, which is common in African-ancestry populations with a minor allele frequency of 4.5%, introduced a protospacer adjacent motif (PAM) for SpCas9 at a predicted off-target site. Experimental validation showed approximately 9.6% off-target indels in human CD34+ hematopoietic stem/progenitor cells edited with this allele. The reference allele rs114518452-G did not demonstrate off-target editing, indicating an allele-specific off-target risk associated with the minor allele.
title: Human genetic diversity modifies therapeutic gene editing off-target potential

finding: In this study, the T allele of the SNP rs1420101 was associated with lower serum IL-1RL1-a levels and higher blood eosinophil counts. This SNP defined the asthma risk haplotype, affecting IL-33-induced responses of Th2 cells by suggesting an additive effect between genetic predisposition and asthma status.
title: IL-33 induced gene expression in activated Th2 effector cells is dependent on IL-1RL1 haplotype and disease status

finding: This non-synonymous coding SNP was part of the identified asthma risk haplotype and was shown to encode a functionally altered signalling domain in the IL-1RL1 receptor. Carriers of this SNP exhibited altered sensitivity to IL-33-induced gene expression, contributing to the understanding that individuals carrying risk haplotypes demonstrated increased IL-33 responsiveness.
title: IL-33 induced gene expression in activated Th2 effector cells is dependent on IL-1RL1 haplotype and disease status

finding: Like rs4988956, this non-synonymous coding SNP was associated with the IL-1RL1 asthma risk haplotype, influencing IL-33 signalling pathways and Th2 cell responses. The presence of this SNP indicated a stronger transcriptional response to IL-33 in carriers compared to non-carriers, highlighting its role in asthma pathophysiology.
title: IL-33 induced gene expression in activated Th2 effector cells is dependent on IL-1RL1 haplotype and disease status

finding: This SNP was also included in the IL-1RL1 risk haplotype and associated with enhanced Th2 cell responses to IL-33. Its connection to altered signalling in the IL-1RL1 receptor underscores its relevance in asthma and Th2-mediated inflammation, establishing a framework for understanding genetic contributions to asthma severity.
title: IL-33 induced gene expression in activated Th2 effector cells is dependent on IL-1RL1 haplotype and disease status

finding: The exonic polymorphism rs315952 (Ser133Ser) of the interleukin 1 receptor antagonist (IL1RN) was related to overweight/obesity with hypertension in a study conducted by Yang in 2014.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The association of rs780094 polymorphism of the glucokinase regulatory protein with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease was reported, suggesting a genetic link to the disease.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs560887 was identified through a joint analysis within the G6PC2/ABCB11 locus. Although it did not show significance in univariate tests for insulin resistance, fasting insulin, insulin secretion, and fasting proinsulin, it was positively associated with elevated fasting plasma glucose and increased insulin release after both oral and intravenous glucose loads.
title: JASS: Command Line and Web interface for the joint analysis of GWAS results

finding: This SNP had a high MAF of 0.4963, significant for population genetic structure studies based on allele frequencies.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: The EDARV370A variant (rs3827760) was previously reported to be prevalent in East Asian populations and was shown to have pleiotropic effects on EDA-dependent ectodermal appendage traits, including mammary gland branching. This indicates the variant's importance in the regulation of mammary epithelial traits.
title: Ectodysplasin signaling via Xedar is required for mammary gland morphogenesis

finding: The SNP rs1379621278 was recognized as critical for antigen binding in the context of IL1β and gevokizumab interaction, validating previous mutagenesis studies and suggesting its significance in targeted therapeutic strategies.
title: CytoSIP: An annotated structural atlas for interactions involving cytokine or cytokine receptor

finding: The SNP rs6759298 was identified within an ankylosing spondylitis-associated locus and showed the most significant expression-modulating effect in stimulated T cells compared to other candidate SNPs at this locus, indicating its potential as a causal variant.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: The SNP rs17678683 was identified as an eQTL for ZEB2 in skeletal muscle, showing strong regulatory function.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The SNP rs2013278 was found to regulate the production of non-functional splicing isoforms within the multiple immunological-trait susceptibility locus CD28, which is relevant for immune and inflammatory diseases.
title: Alternative paths to immune activation: the role of costimulatory risk genes for polygenic inflammatory disease in T helper cells

finding: The variant rs4988235 in the lactase gene (LCT) was initially thought to be associated with height and low-density lipoprotein (LDL)-cholesterol; however, after thorough adjustments for both genome-wide and locus-specific ancestry, these associations were confirmed to be false positives. In contrast, the association between rs4988235 and body mass index (BMI) remained weakly significant post-adjustment, suggesting a genuine correlation with weight, but not with height or LDL.
title: Unappreciated Subcontinental Admixture in Europeans and European Americans: Implications for Genetic Epidemiology Studies

finding: The GWAS variant rs3771501 was associated with decreased expression of the gene TGFA in chondrocytes treated with PBS, indicating a potential role of this regulatory pathway in OA risk.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The eQTL rs3755381 was identified as having significant eQTL effects on the PAPPA gene, demonstrating regulatory influence in the context of OA.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The SNP rs922452, located in the EDAR gene on chromosome 2, had the highest PBS selection signal (PBS=0.3180) and was linked to physical traits such as hair straightness and skin tone in East Asians.
title: Malaria resistance-related biological adaptation and complex evolutionary footprints of Tai-Kadai people inferred from 796 genomes

finding: The SNP rs780094 was reported as being associated with elevated fasting serum triacylglycerol levels, reduced fasting and OGTT-related insulinaemia, and a reduced risk of type 2 diabetes. These findings were based on the context of metabolic dysfunctions, particularly relevant when exploring genetic factors contributing to type 2 diabetes in the Nile rat, which serves as a model organism for understanding such conditions.
title: A haplotype-resolved genome assembly of the Nile rat facilitates exploration of the genetic basis of diabetes

finding: The variant rs72844419 was identified as an eQTL for MAT2A, showing a sub-cell-type effect similar to that of rs2072449 but in the opposite direction. Detailed findings indicating how this variant modulated expression were highlighted.
title: Single-cell gene expression prediction from DNA sequence at large contexts

finding: The variant rs7559150, identified by Soskic et al., was associated with reducing NIF3L1 expression specifically in memory T cells after stimulation. In CD4 T cell activation models, it showed a predicted negative effect on expression, particularly stronger in non-activated T cells. Its expression effect varied depending on the cell type, enhancing expression in proliferating DN and DP thymocytes while reducing it in quiescent and more mature T cells.
title: Single-cell gene expression prediction from DNA sequence at large contexts

finding: The variant rs7562391, located 17,635 bp from the TSS of PPIL3, was characterized by a negative impact on PPIL3 expression among activated T cells. It was predicted to be a missense variant and influenced by enhancer activity. This variant was also noted to weaken a potential HOX binding motif, while improving a FOXP1 binding motif, indicating a complex interplay of transcription factors during T cell development.
title: Single-cell gene expression prediction from DNA sequence at large contexts

finding: The SNP rs10153620 was associated with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). Chromatin loop data predicted this SNP's target gene as NRP2, which is known to have a key role in neural functions. In contrast, brain eQTLs predicted a gene (PARD3B) with unclear brain functions.
title: Robust Hi-C chromatin loop maps in human neurogenesis and brain tissues at high-resolution

finding: The SNP rs113851554 was strongly associated with restless legs syndrome (RLS) and insomnia, with a reported P-value of 1.1 × 10^−180 and an odds ratio of 2, indicating a significant effect on sleep-related phenotypes. This association highlighted the importance of the intronic region of MEIS1 in the development of these traits.
title: Intronic elements associated with insomnia and restless legs syndrome exhibit cell type-specific epigenetic features contributing to MEIS1 regulation

finding: The SNP rs35744605 in IFIH1 was mentioned as an important variant in the context of T1D research, contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on the immune system and the interactions leading to T1D development.
title: Use of Induced Pluripotent Stem Cells to Build Isogenic Systems and Investigate Type 1 Diabetes

finding: This variant was validated as a functional regulatory variant that disrupted KLF4 binding and led to a significant reduction in BIN1 gene expression in the SH-SY5Y cell line.
title: Functional regulatory variants implicate distinct transcriptional networks in dementia

finding: The association between CPS1 and L-citrulline was found to be significant with a p-value of 1 × 10<sup>−25</sup>. This SNP was reported in the literature as having a strong association with the metabolite L-citrulline, reflecting its role in the urea cycle.
title: Gene-metabolite annotation with shortest reactional distance enhances metabolite genome-wide association studies results

finding: Similar to rs1509820, the SNP rs975530777 was associated with L-citrulline in two literature reports, with a p-value of 1 × 10<sup>−14</sup>. This association also underscored the involvement of CPS1 in L-citrulline metabolism, confirming its biological relevance despite not achieving genome-wide significance in the TK study.
title: Gene-metabolite annotation with shortest reactional distance enhances metabolite genome-wide association studies results

finding: The SNP rs6733839 in the BIN1 locus was widely reported as a risk variant, although no strong association was evidenced in African Americans.
title: How understudied populations have contributed to our understanding of Alzheimer’s disease genetics

finding: This SNP was identified as a risk variant in Japanese populations, with no evidence of association found in African American or Turkish populations.
title: How understudied populations have contributed to our understanding of Alzheimer’s disease genetics

finding: The C allele of rs3771239 was associated with higher expression of the gene SDC1 and was linked to increased chromatin accessibility in cartilage, suggesting its potential regulatory role.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The G allele of rs12471240 was significantly associated with higher expression of the gene NGEF, along with increased local chromatin accessibility, indicating its regulatory potential.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs6733839 was associated with a microglia-specific enhancer and promoter related to the risk gene BIN1 for Alzheimer's disease (AD), indicating a link between this variant and AD pathology.
title: Multimodal single-cell/nucleus RNA-sequencing data analysis uncovers molecular networks between disease-associated microglia and astrocytes with implications for drug repurposing in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs35349669 was highlighted in a study that examined its association with late-onset Alzheimer's disease, confirming its relevance through a replication study and meta-analysis.
title: Multimodal single-cell/nucleus RNA-sequencing data analysis uncovers molecular networks between disease-associated microglia and astrocytes with implications for drug repurposing in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This SNP was found to be one of the two loci associated with Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm, where it validated in STARR-seq and was associated with diminished p65 binding and expression of the LDAH gene in HAECs.
title: Functional non-coding SNPs in human endothelial cells fine-map vascular trait associations

finding: Similar to rs13385499, this SNP was part of the evidence for functionality regarding the LDAH gene, and its alternate allele mutation led to a reduction in p65 binding and LDAH expression, indicating its role in Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm.
title: Functional non-coding SNPs in human endothelial cells fine-map vascular trait associations

finding: The SNP rs11682175 was significantly associated with multiple phenotypes including major depression, neuroticism, and schizophrenia. It was identified as the top fine-mapped SNP in the schizophrenia loci associated with rs75575209 and rs7596038. Although it was not reported in the CLOZUK GWAS, its high PIP scores indicating strong association were noted.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: This lead SNP was associated with the promoter of the GIGYF2 gene and demonstrated intersecting OCRs in various cell populations, indicating a significant potential role in schizophrenia.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: Located in the promoter of NGEF, this SNP had the highest PIP in the dataset and intervened with numerous transcription factor binding sites, linking it to synaptic dysfunction in schizophrenia.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: The rs3738919-C allele was found to be associated with rheumatoid arthritis within the European Caucasian population, as reported in a family-based study. This polymorphism may contribute to susceptibility to early rheumatoid arthritis, which aligns with the focus of the study on gene interactions relevant to the disease.
title: Harnessing gene-gene interactions via an RNA-Sequencing network analysis framework improves precision medicine prediction in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP was associated with CpG sites cg06162668 and cg27288595, which showed relationships with obesity and metabolic disease phenotypes, indicating its relevance in the genetics of these traits.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The SNP rs2042477 was located at the KCNIP3 locus and identified during the analysis of rare coding variants. This suggested a potential contribution to the heritable risk of Parkinson's disease.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The rs63750245 represents a nonsense mutation in the MSH2 gene, which resulted in microsatellite instability (MSI) being identified as a biomarker for Lynch syndrome. This emphasized its role as a significant genetic factor for cancer predisposition.
title: MecCog: A knowledge representation framework for genetic disease mechanism

finding: The SNP rs72823641 was the most significantly associated SNP located within IL1RL1, associated with asthma and the combined phenotype of asthma and/or hay fever and eczema.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SNP rs6722871 showed a meta-P-value of 1.19 × 10^-59 and was located at the SERPINE2 locus. This SNP was confirmed as a known variant affecting the cytokine network, particularly related to immune-related proteins.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: This SNP located at the SERPINE2 locus was associated with additional signals independent from the lead variant, indicating more complex genetic architecture influencing cytokine levels.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: Detected in the SERPINE2 locus along with other associations, this SNP contributed to the understanding of genetic variants affecting the cytokine network.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs13010134 was associated with immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) response in melanoma patients, as revealed by the analysis method DeepMicroNET. This finding indicated that the variant played a role in the mechanisms of antigen processing and presentation, which were highlighted within the context of therapeutic outcomes for patients undergoing ICI therapies.
title: Unveiling the Gut Microbiome Network Fingerprint: A Deep Learning Approach to Predict Immunotherapy Response in Melanoma Patients

finding: The GCKR rs780094 variant was connected to elevated levels of liver enzymes in obesity, suggesting its importance in metabolic disease mechanisms.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs13010035 was associated with metabolic reprogramming in Rheumatoid Arthritis Synovial Fibroblasts (RASFs). The study highlighted that RASFs, influenced by regulatory signals, shifted their ATP production from oxidative phosphorylation to glycolysis. This metabolic switch, relevant to RA's pathogenesis, was linked to the pivotal role of the hypoxia-inducible factor 1 (HIF1), suggesting a reverse Warburg effect impacting neighboring cells within the RA microenvironment.
title: Metabolic Reprogramming in Rheumatoid Arthritis Synovial Fibroblasts: a Hybrid Modeling Approach

finding: The rs1427407 SNP was associated with fetal hemoglobin (HbF) levels within the DHS +62 site, as demonstrated in genome-wide association studies (GWAS). The study by Bauer et al. validated its repressive role on HbF, making it a critical target in therapeutic interventions for hemoglobinopathies.
title: CRISPR-Decryptr reveals cis-regulatory elements from noncoding perturbation screens

finding: The rs7606173 SNP was linked to fetal hemoglobin (HbF) levels located at the DHS +55 site, which was also corroborated by the findings of Bauer et al. This SNP's role in regulating HbF levels further establishes its significance for potential therapeutic applications in treating related disorders.
title: CRISPR-Decryptr reveals cis-regulatory elements from noncoding perturbation screens

finding: The SNP rs34043159 was found to be associated with sporadic Alzheimer's disease in the southern Han Chinese population, indicating its potential role in neurodegenerative disease susceptibility.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The rs917997 SNP of IL18RAP was reported to control IFN-γ production by PBMCs, linking it to immune response modulation in autoimmune disease contexts.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The derived T allele of rs182549 was estimated to be 688 generations old, corresponding to an age of approximately 14,000 to 21,000 years. This variant, which is located in an intron of the MCM6 gene and is associated with lactase persistence (LP), was found at a frequency of about 50% in European populations. The analysis incorporated data from the 1000 Genomes Project and the Simons Genetic Diversity Project, revealing that the age estimates were consistent between the two sources.
title: Dating genomic variants and shared ancestry in population-scale sequencing data

finding: The derived A allele of rs4988235 was similarly estimated to be 693 generations old, which translates to approximately 14,000 to 21,000 years. It is strongly associated with lactase persistence and is in near perfect association with rs182549. Previous estimates had suggested a broader age range between 2,200 and 21,000 years, yielding high confidence in the newly calculated estimates.
title: Dating genomic variants and shared ancestry in population-scale sequencing data

finding: The derived G allele of rs3827760, which encodes the Val370Ala substitution in the EDAR gene and is linked to sweat and morphological traits, was estimated to be 1,456 generations old, or about 29,000 to 44,000 years. The variant was found at high frequencies in East Asian populations and demonstrated strong concordance in age estimates between datasets from the 1000 Genomes Project and the Simons Genetic Diversity Project.
title: Dating genomic variants and shared ancestry in population-scale sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs10210899 was found to have significant allelic heterogeneity driven by sex, similar to rs12740374, with notable effects in the female cohorts.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs4245791 was jointly driven by sex and BMI, indicating its significant association with LDL-cholesterol in the studied population.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs11884143 was driven by urban status and exhibited heterogeneity due to both urban status and ancestry, contributing to the complexity of LDL-cholesterol associations.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs1712248 was identified as having heterogeneity due to ancestry alone, providing insights into its role in LDL-cholesterol variations.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs13030569 was investigated in relation to the MCT1 inhibitor AZD3965, confirming its preclinical safety for use with breast cancer treatment, thereby contributing to the understanding of MCT1's involvement in different cancer types.
title: ME3BP-7 is a targeted cytotoxic agent that rapidly kills pancreatic cancer cells expressing high levels of monocarboxylate transporter MCT1

finding: The insertion allele of rs59335482 was found to be associated with a higher Alzheimer’s disease (AD) risk. It was shown to increase transcriptional activity in luciferase assays conducted in HEK cells and SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells, and it was associated with an increase in BIN1 mRNA expression in the brain.
title: The Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factor BIN1 induces isoform-dependent neurotoxicity through early endosome defects

finding: The SNP rs7579014, a candidate variant at the 2p16.1 risk locus, was identified as the top eQTL for the HiChIP target gene BCL11A, linking it to risk for endometrial cancer.
title: Analysis of promoter-associated chromatin interactions reveals biologically relevant candidate target genes at endometrial cancer risk loci

finding: In the context of immune diseases, the SNP rs13034664 colocalized with the eQTL of CCL20, a chemokine important for lymphocyte recruitment. It also affected the activity of a nearby chromatin enhancer specific to Tregs, indicating a significant role in Treg biology.
title: Immune disease variants modulate gene expression in regulatory CD4+ T cells and inform drug targets

finding: The SNP rs13385731 was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) influencing the expression of <italic>RASGRP3</italic> in plasmacytoid dendritic cells (pDCs) of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) patients, with the SLE risk allele associated with increased expression.
title: Autotaxin may play a Critical Role between the Genetic Risk Factors and Pathogenesis of SLE in Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cells

finding: This SNP showed maternal association with standing height, indicating its potential involvement in maternal imprinting mechanisms affecting this phenotype.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs10197004 demonstrated a significant association with wellbeing and was related to lipid metabolism, particularly involving LDL receptor-related protein 1B (LRP1B). This finding aligned with previous research indicating the role of lipid-related molecules in wellbeing.
title: The association between metabolite concentrations and wellbeing in adults

finding: The study identified rs13425622 as an eQTL that has a significant impact on the expression levels of the gene MARCO in the populations studied. It was reported that the minor G allele at this SNP was associated with lower levels of MARCO expression. All Korowai individuals in the dataset were fixed for the G allele, whereas the majority of Mentawai and Sumba individuals were heterozygotes for the T allele, which is linked to higher MARCO expression. This SNP's association with gene expression was particularly significant given its correlation with Apicomplexa load and the differential expression of MARCO among the island populations.
title: The whole blood microbiome of Indonesians reveals that environmental differences shape immune gene expression signatures

finding: The variant rs7596259 functioned as a sc-caQTL affecting a master regulatory region and three dependent regions in rods, and was also associated with the increased expression of ITGA6 in that cell type.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs113822101, as part of the FDA5 PRS, demonstrated a significant influence on weight metrics. It was located downstream of HPCAL1, which is associated with type 2 diabetes.
title: Polygenic risk score based on weight gain trajectories is predictive of childhood obesity

finding: rs970797 was associated with nose-related features, specifically with a significance of p = 2.15 × 10−12 for nose traits and p = 1.72 × 10−8 for eye traits. It was confirmed to influence the height of the nasal root, with T alleles tending to result in a flatter nasal root, and was linked to dimensions affecting the overall shape of the face.
title: Genome-wide Association study of facial morphology identifies novel genetic loci in Han Chinese

finding: The SNP rs3795859, located in intron 35 of LRPPRC, was identified as regulating the skipping of exon 35 across 14 tissues. In a minigene assay, the T allele of rs3795859 increased the exclusion of exon 35 in HeLa and HEK293T cell lines.
title: Junction-skipping regulation in complex disease

finding: The SNP rs28445040 was identified as a probable IBD causal variant with 39% posterior probability, regulating the skipping of the 7th exon in SP140, which is predominantly expressed in immune cells.
title: Junction-skipping regulation in complex disease

finding: The missense variant in <italic>IQCA1</italic> was associated with episodic memory outcomes associated with multiple eQTL effects.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: This variant was reported to interact with <italic>APOE</italic>, affecting episodic memory and simple processing speed.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The SNP rs260607 was part of significant linkage disequilibrium with the EDAR gene, reflecting adaptive genetic interaction related to ectodermal structures including hair and skin traits.
title: A fast linkage disequilibrium-based statistical test for Genome-Wide Epistatic Selection Scans in structured populations

finding: The SNP rs17034770 was involved in the linkage between the EDAR gene and coadaptation with properties influencing hair and skin features in specific ethnic backgrounds.
title: A fast linkage disequilibrium-based statistical test for Genome-Wide Epistatic Selection Scans in structured populations

finding: The SNP rs1344706 was associated with alterations in the expression of the gene ZNF804A in the human brain. The research highlighted that variations in this SNP were linked to schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depressive disorder. It was specifically mentioned that this SNP acted as a risk variant for psychosis, significantly influencing gene expression related to these psychiatric conditions.
title: Schizophrenia risk gene ZNF804A controls ribosome localization and synaptogenesis in developing human neurons

finding: The SNP rs13030419 was positively associated with the expression of synthetic cannabinoids which induced autophagy and mitochondrial apoptotic pathways in human glioblastoma cells. This correlation indicated its relevance in glioblastoma therapy and the potential for synthetic cannabinoid treatment in GBM.
title: Discovery of Novel Small Molecule CB2 Agonist for the Treatment of Glioblastoma Tumors

finding: This SNP was found in the HDLBP gene, known as the high density lipoprotein binding protein. It was linked to chronic lymphoblastic leukemia, highlighting its importance in the elucidation of genetic risk factors associated with protein-RNA interaction sites in cancer.
title: Transcriptome-wide high-throughput mapping of protein-RNA occupancy profiles using POP-seq

finding: The SNP rs116175783 was found to be associated with intelligence and was located in the intron of the TBR1 gene. The analysis revealed that it interacted with the promoter of the SLC4A10 gene in oligodendrocyte precursor cells. SLC4A10 is also known to be associated with intellectual disability, although its connection to rs116175783 was previously unknown, particularly in the context of oligodendrocyte precursor cells.
title: Improving chromatin-interaction prediction using single-cell open-chromatin profile and making insight about the cis-regulatory landscape of the human brain

finding: The SNP IL18R1:rs759382 was identified as both a bulk eQTL and an immune-mediated eQTL. This SNP had been reported previously as a blood eQTL and its association with the gene IL18R highlighted its role in maintaining inflammation in coeliac disease (CeD). Although IL18R was not differentially expressed, its ligand IL18 was downregulated in untreated CeD samples and its interaction with IL18R may have implications for epithelial barrier function and immune response in CeD.
title: Gene expression and eQTL analysis reflect the heterogeneity in the inflammatory status of the duodenal epithelial lining in coeliac disease

finding: SNP rs754523 was identified as influencing cooking time, corroborated through the expression data of the associated genes.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: The rs58194899 SNP located in the TSSC1 gene achieved genome-wide significance with PSQ scores, indicating a strong association with altered pain sensitivity.
title: Genome-wide association study of pain sensitivity assessed by questionnaire and the cold pressor test

finding: The rs1250258 SNP was positioned tightly linked to rs1250259-A and was associated with increased circulating FN1 levels. This SNP was part of the CAD risk haplotype and indicated a potential cardioprotective role.
title: A common polymorphism that protects from cardiovascular disease increases fibronectin processing and secretion

finding: The rs12620516 variant showed a significant correlation with IGFBP2 gene expression, particularly in samples with increased proportions of preHTC chondrocytes.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The association of rs7556897T>C in the intergenic region SLC19A3-CCL20 suggested a modification of blood pressure in children, which could be relevant for renal outcomes.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The IL1B rs1143634 genetic variant was found to be pertinent to periodontitis risk, which could have systemic implications including for renal health.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: RS1047891, located near CPS1, was identified as a male-specific locus for T2D, and previous reports suggested a stronger effect in females for cardiovascular disease and certain blood metabolites.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: The rs12712928 variant was linked to T2D and was associated with higher fasting glucose levels in East Asian populations, indicating its risk pattern specific to these groups.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: No significant associations obtained (P>0.05).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The rs13004845 tamVar was predicted to contain a strong 3' AG splice site in the reference allele, which was abolished by a G-to-A substitution in the alternate allele. The experiments confirmed that splicing occurred in the reference allele with a 57% efficiency, while the alternate allele was found to be unspliced. This finding related to a 28% decrease in expression of the reference allele as measured by the Griesemer MPRA, indicating a significant impact on expression.
title: U-rich elements drive pervasive cryptic splicing in 3’ UTR massively parallel reporter assays

finding: The rs1058261 variant in desmin was suggested to have a protective association against combined cancer and cardiovascular death in a study within the Tampere adult population.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs2293275 variant in the LHCGR gene had a significant effect modification on the clinical-biochemical profiles and levels of luteinizing hormone in polycystic ovary syndrome patients.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The COL4A3 variant rs55703767 was associated with susceptibility to diabetic kidney disease in type 2 diabetes mellitus patients.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The intronic indel in the <italic>CACNB4</italic> gene was associated with a nearly twenty-fold increase in risk for cardiovascular disease, with an odds ratio of 19.0 (95% CI: 5.5 - 65.8, p = 4.3 × 10^-8). This finding demonstrated a substantial effect that was not detectable under the additive model.
title: The impact of non-additive genetic associations on age-related complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs4988235 was associated with lactase persistence in humans and its allele frequencies were assessed in various Viking-Age groups, as well as present-day populations. The findings indicated a significant increase in the frequency of the lactase persistence allele in Northern Europe, particularly among Viking populations, suggesting a strong positive selection for this trait due to the consumption of dairy products, which was integral to their diet during the Viking Age.
title: Population genomics of the Viking world

finding: The SNP rs10173412 was identified as a lead variant associated with lymphocyte counts in a multi-ancestry GWAS. It was shown to be an intronic variant of the gene RBMS1, and it was included in the primary credible set of RBMS1 eQTLs, indicating a potential regulatory connection between this variant and the gene's expression.
title: Gene Expression and Splicing QTL Analysis of Blood Cells in African American Participants from the Jackson Heart Study

finding: The SNP rs17771664 was found to be an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene LANCL1. It was notably associated with the phenotype 'Number of Pain Sites' and fell within a chromatin peak shared by the excitatory neuron subtypes Exc-TAC3, Exc-SKOR2, and Exc-MAF. This SNP was identified as one of the most significant SNPs within its linkage disequilibrium (LD) block and belonged to the credible set of the LocusZoom SNPs, indicating a likely causal relation.
title: Spatial, transcriptomic and epigenomic analyses link dorsal horn neurons to chronic pain genetic predisposition

finding: The study found that the CD28 polymorphism (rs1980422) was associated with seropositivity in rheumatoid arthritis (RA). This suggests that the presence of this SNP may contribute to the risk of developing RA, specifically in seropositive patients.
title: Utilizing a PTPN22 gene signature to predict response to targeted therapies in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: This SNP in SMPD4 showed lower expression levels in subjects with AUD compared to higher expression levels after ethanol exposure in SK-N-BE(2) cells, reflecting a therapeutic interaction of the SNP with alcohol treatment.
title: Allele-Specific Expression and High-Throughput Reporter Assay Reveal Functional Variants in Human Brains with Alcohol Use Disorders

finding: The SNP rs6739323 was found to be associated with coronary artery disease (CAD), with the risk allele linked to lower expression of LTBP1 in cultured human smooth muscle cells (SMCs) and human aortic tissue. In this study, it was confirmed that LTBP1 was expressed in native contractile SMCs in the medial coronary layer as well as in fibromyocytes in the fibrous neointima, suggesting its involvement in SMC phenotype modulation in the context of atherosclerosis.
title: Integrative single-cell meta-analysis reveals disease-relevant vascular cell states and markers in human atherosclerosis

finding: This SNP served as a QTL for chromatin accessibility, H3K27ac, H3K4me1, and methylation. The findings illustrated the role of this variant in the regulation of chromatin modifications associated with gene expression.
title: Epigenetic variation impacts ancestry-associated differences in the transcriptional response to influenza infection

finding: The SNP rs2113417 was associated with the methylation level of a 710-bp region. This SNP was found to correspond with significant chromatin accessibility differences, and it was reported that it had three mQTLs, with only one (cg03595348) within the same DMR. The findings indicated a relationship between this SNP and the gene KCNIP3, suggesting its role in influencing the epigenetic landscape.
title: Fine Mapping Regulatory Variants by Characterizing Native CpG Methylation with Nanopore Long-Read Sequencing

finding: This SNP was identified as a caQTL where homozygous GG genotypes exhibited higher chromatin accessibility than GC or CC genotypes. The sequence with the 'G' allele showed significantly higher MPRA activity than the 'C' allele.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: This SNP was included in the discussion of putative causal variants, showing significant transcriptional activation effects identified by MPRA.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: This SNP was highlighted as a putative causal variant due to its empirically supported transcriptional activation in beta cells.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: Confirmed to have allelic effects in the IRS1 locus, supporting its inclusion as a potential causal SNP impacting transcriptional activity.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The rs7571816 SNP, located in the DIS3L2 gene, was significantly associated with body height, confirming previous reports of its relevance to this phenotype.
title: A genome-wide association study of neonatal metabolites

finding: The rs75862065 SNP overlapped with a hotspot missense mutation in PRKRA; it occurred multiple times in OV, COAD, GBM, and LUAD, suggesting its significance in those cancers.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The missense mutation in PNPT1 (rs782572) was linked to methylation level at mt-RNR2 (position 2617) and was found in high linkage disequilibrium with variants associated with blood pressure, suggesting its potential role in cardiovascular health.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: The intronic variant in TRMT61B (rs11684695) correlated with increased methylation levels at mt-RNR2 (position 2617) and elevated expression of TRMT61B. This association highlighted its role in mitochondrial RNA methylation and was also connected to cancer-linked variants.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: This SNP, located in the EPAS1 gene, showed significant genetic differentiation between the Salar/Tu populations and southern East Asian groups, emphasizing its role in adaptation to environmental hypoxia.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of ethnolinguistic diverse northwestern Chinese Hexi Corridor people from the 10K_CPGDP project suggested the differentiated East-West genetic admixture along the Silk Road and their biological adaptations

finding: Like rs7589861, this SNP within the EPAS1 gene also indicated notable genetic differentiation between the Salar/Tu population and their southern East Asian counterparts, further supporting its connection to adaptations related to hypoxia.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of ethnolinguistic diverse northwestern Chinese Hexi Corridor people from the 10K_CPGDP project suggested the differentiated East-West genetic admixture along the Silk Road and their biological adaptations

finding: The variant rs3769823, previously identified as a functional variant associated with multiple cancers, colocalized with a multi-cell-type cCRE within the CASP8 alternative promoter. This missense variant altered CASP8 protein activity and affected lung cancer cell apoptosis and proliferation, with predicted binding affinity to allelic transcription factors identified. The presence of TF footprints suggested its role in cell-type specific regulation.
title: Context-aware single-cell multiome approach identified cell-type specific lung cancer susceptibility genes
